                            <div class="bd-padding" id="divplaces_to_visit_in_switzerland_by_train" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <p>Switzerland has earned widespread fame and repute as being one of the best travel destinations in the world, which routinely attracts millions of tourists to the country especially those who want to experience the beautiful mountains and diverse cultures. If you have been browsing Switzerland holiday packages on websites online, you must be aware that the country is served by a widespread rail network, which includes the highest railway in Europe against the backdrop of snowcapped peaks! Naturally, a vast majority of Switzerland tour packages online, include travel within the country using the railway network which is efficient and cheap as compared to taking flights. If you are packing your bags for a Swiss holiday this season, then it is essential that you read our guide that lists out 5 amazing places in the country to go by train (You can get a Switzerland train pass for tourists which also includes free access to hundreds of Museums around the country!)</p>
                                        <p>
                                            If you have been browsing

                <a target="_blank" href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class='lnks'>Switzerland holiday packages</a> on websites online, you must be aware that the country is served by a widespread rail network, which includes the highest railway in Europe against the backdrop of snowcapped peaks!

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Naturally, a vast majority of Switzerland tour packages online, include travel within the country using the railway network which is efficient and cheap as compared to taking flights. If you are packing your bags for a Swiss holiday this season, then it is essential that you read our guide that lists out 5 amazing places in the country to go by train (You can get a

                <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Switzerland train pass</a> for tourists which also includes free access to hundreds of museums around the country!)

                                        </p>
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Interlaken</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/interlaken.jpg" alt="Interlaken" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Interlaken is one of the most beautiful towns in Switzerland, which itself is a statement due to the stiff competition. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The resort town has an easygoing vibe and is accessible by rail from anywhere in the country. The town lies between two beautiful lakes and lies in the Canton of Bern. Interlaken is one city that you should not miss at any cost on your

                <a target="_blank" href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class='lnks'>Switzerland tour</a>.

                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2. Lucerne</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/mount-titlis.jpg" alt="mount-titlis" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Lucerne is another major city in the country, located in central Switzerland. With numerous mountain peaks, lakes and rivers nearby, Lucerne is also a top tourist destination, which can easily be accessed by rail (don't forget to capitalize on your

                <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-ultimate-benefits-of-swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>benefits of Swiss Travel Pass</a> to make the most on Swiss Rail Network).

                                        </p>
                                        <p>The city also hosts the ‘Fasnacht' festival in December, which involves days of decadent celebration by locals in colorful attire and is a wonderful opportunity for food lovers to get their hands on some authentic Swiss delicacies.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3. Zermatt</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/zermatt-cafe-switzerland.jpg" alt="zermatt-cafe-switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Zermatt is famous for its ski resorts and lies close to the Swiss-Italian border. </p>
                                        <p>Cable cars, ski sloped, the quaint little town has it all. The majority of the local population speaks German, being one of the three official languages of Switzerland. The city is accessible by rail and is one of the stops of the famous Glacier Express panoramic train.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4. Basel</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/basel-roche-tower.jpg" alt="basel-roche-tower" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Basel being the 3rd most populous city of Switzerland is also a major railway hub, from where you can even take international trains to Paris and other destinations. Basel has a lot to offer for tourists with its multicultural makeup of the city.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5.Lugano</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/lake-lugano.jpg" alt="lake-lugano">
                                            </div>

                                        </div>
                                        <p>Lugano is situated close to the Italian border and the majority of the population speaks Italian. The Lugano railway station is situated centrally in the city and can be easily accessed by tourist rail passes. The Swiss city is unique for its pervading Italian influence on its food, music and wine!</p>
                                        <p>We have told you briefly about the top 5 Swiss destinations to go for by train.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            We hope this article has been informative for you. Don't hesitate to contact us at<a target="_blank" href="https://www.swisstours.com/" class='lnks'>SWISStours</a> for information and for some terrific discounts on bookings! Bon Voyage!

                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>

                            <%--switzerland-itinerary-8-days--%>
                            <div class="bd-padding" id="divswitzerland_itinerary_8_days" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li class="in-view">
                                        <p>After speaking to fellow travellers on my various visits to Switzerland, I have realised that most travellers allocate around eight days to explore this country. Keeping that in mind, here is a step-by-step <a target="_blank" href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class='lnks'>Switzerland itinerary for 8 days</a> packed with the most unforgettable experiences. This may not be leisurely, but hey, who is looking for leisure when there is so much fun stuff to see and do?</p>
                                        <p>Before we go ahead, let's get a glimpse of what we are going to do in our 8-day Switzerland itinerary.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            <ul>
                                                <li style="margin: 0 0 0px 15px;">Day 1 - Montreux.</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>a) Lakeside Promenade</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>b) Freddy Mercury Statue and Queen: The Studio Experience exhibition at the Casino</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>c) Chillon Castle</li>
                                            </ul>
                                            <ul>
                                                <li style="margin: 7px 0 0px 15px;">Day 2 - Montreux</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>a) Zermatt</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>b) Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</li>

                                            </ul>
                                            <ul>
                                                <li style="margin: 7px 0 0px 15px;">Day 3 - Montreux</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>a) Gstaad - the town and its picturesque pedestrian city centre</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>b) Saanen - town and the Lauenensee</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>c) Gruyeres - Gruyeres cheese factory, town and castle</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>d) Broc - Caillers' chocolate factory</li>
                                            </ul>
                                            <ul>
                                                <li style="margin: 7px 0 0px 15px;">Day 4 - Montreux to Interlaken</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>a) Grindelwald - Grindelwald First and the village of Grindelwald</li>
                                            </ul>
                                            <ul>
                                                <li style="margin: 7px 0 0px 15px;">Day 5 - Interlaken</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>a) Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe</li>
                                            </ul>
                                            <ul>
                                                <li style="margin: 7px 0 0px 15px;">Day 6 - Interlaken</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>a) Interlaken town</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>b) Lakes Thun and Brienz</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>c) Iseltwald</li>
                                            </ul>
                                            <ul>
                                                <li style="margin: 7px 0 0px 15px;">Day 7 - Interlaken</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>a) Lucerne - Old Town, Lake Promenade, Chapel Bridge</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>b) Swiss Museum  of Transport</li>

                                            </ul>
                                            <ul>
                                                <li style="margin: 7px 0 0px 15px;">Day 8 - Interlaken to Zurich </li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>a) Zurich city- Bahnofstrasse, Lake promenade</li>
                                                <li style='margin-left: 30px;'>b) Rhine falls</li>

                                            </ul>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>As you can see, the  Switzerland itinerary for 8 days will take us to so many exciting towns and attractions. However, to do all that travelling seamlessly, we need to be equipped with the <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a>, so make sure you have purchased it before your arrival. The Swiss Travel Pass will allow you unlimited travel on all public transport, up to 50% discounts on mountain excursions and free access to over 500 museums. In fact, almost all the attractions that we will visit in this program are covered by the Swiss Travel Pass for some discount.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/swiss-travel-pass.jpg" alt="Swiss Travel Pass" />
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Travel Pass</p>
                                                <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Now, let's get started with our itinerary.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="1">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Day 1 - Montreux - Chillon Castle</b></h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/SWISStours-Blog-Montreux-Chillion.jpg" alt="MontreuxChillion_img" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Head directly to <a target="_blank" href="/blog/montreux-switzerland" class='lnks'>Montreux</a> upon arrival at either Zurich or Geneva airports.<br />
                                            Zurich airport to Montreux - roughly 2.45 hours.<br />
                                            Geneva to Montreux - approximately 1.15 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Check in to your hotel, freshen up and head out to see this beautiful lakeside town.  Start off with the gorgeous Chillon Castle (20 minutes by bus number 201 from Montreux), built on an outcrop on the lakeshore. The Chateau de Chillon has, at different times in its history, been an armoury, a prison and even a hospital. It is also the inspiration behind the poem 'The Prisoner of Chillon' by Lord Byron. This is Switzerland's most visited monument, so visit it and find out why.</p>
                                        <p>Note: The castle closes at 5 pm, so ensure you are there on time.</p>
                                        <p>Take the bus back to Montreux and explore the lovely lakeside promenade. Make sure to take a photo with the legendary Freddie Mercury, whose statue holds a prime spot overlooking the beautiful bay. If you are a Freddie and Queen fan like me, check out the 'Queen: The Studio Experience' exhibition at the Casino Barrière. Visit Montreux's beautiful Old Town with its cobble-stoned streets, historic old houses and fabulous views over the lake and surrounding Alps.</p>
                                    </li>


                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Day 2 - Montreux- Zermatt- Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</b></h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/SWISStours-Blog-Matterhorn-Zermatt.jpg" alt="Matterhorn-Zermatt" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Get ready to take a train to <a target="_blank" href="/blog/zermatt-switzerland" class='lnks'>Zermatt</a> (roughly 2.40 hours), a quintessentially Swiss town and one of Switzerland's most popular ski resorts. Don't stress; Zermatt is not just for skiers and winter sports enthusiasts. In fact, Zermatt is home to the world's most photographed mountain- The Matterhorn, which is said to be the inspiration behind the peculiar triangular shape of one of Switzerland's most popular chocolates. Yes, you guessed right ..the Toblerone.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            One of the best places to view and photograph the Matterhorn is the <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</a> (also known as Kleine Matterhorn).  Take a bus or a leisurely 20-minute walk to the cable car station of the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise. Make your way to the peak by cable car via two changes en route. Once at the peak, you can head to the viewing platform,  walk through the Ice Palace and enjoy a snack or meal with the best view you can imagine.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Upon returning to Zermatt, walk through this lovely car-free village, visit the historical quarter 'Hinterdorf', the Matterhorn Museum and, time permitting, the Gorner Gorge (summer months) before heading back to Montreux.</p>
                                        <p>Note: A jacket, sturdy shoes and goggles are a must when travelling to the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise in any season.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Matterhorn-Glacier-Paradise-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>


                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Day 3 - Montreux - Gstaad- Gruyeres - Broc</b></h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/SWISStours-Blog-Gstaad-Saanen-Gruyere-Broc.jpg" alt="Gstaad-Saanen-Gruyere-Broc" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>First, let's find out why the rich and famous have made Gstaad their go-to getaway and then, carry on Swiss chocolate and cheese heaven today.</p>
                                        <p>Try to leave Montreux by 7.30 am and take a train to Gstaad (roughly 1.40 hours). On arrival in Gstaad, walk along the town's pedestrian centre with its boutiques, cafes and designer stores. Pop into the 18th-century Gstaad church with its dominating steeple and enjoy a coffee and snack before leaving for your next stop of the day- Gruyeres (roughly 1.20 hours).</p>
                                        <p>Just minutes from the Gruyeres station is the Gruyeres cheese factory  (free with your Swiss Travel Pass), where you can see a live demonstration of the process of cheese making (check the timings of the live demonstrations so you can arrive accordingly). Enjoy the offered samples of a few different kinds of cheese before you start your audio-guided tour of the facility. If hunger strikes, have a cheesy meal in the restaurant at the factory before you walk or take a bus to Gruyeres town. The medieval, pedestrian-only town with its cobble-stoned streets looks just out of a fairytale. Visit the Chateau de Gruyeres, which houses a museum and also offers fantastic views over the surrounding area.</p>
                                        <p>As the announcements in Swiss trains go, “Next halt- Broc”. From Gruyeres, take a train to Broc (roughly 30 minutes). The Maison Cailler chocolate factory (free with your Swiss Travel Pass)  is just outside the train station. Trust me when I say I think I could have followed the divine scent of fresh chocolate to the factory if I had been blindfolded! Once there, you can go on a multimedia tour to learn all about the history and process of chocolate making. You could even opt for a pre-booked chocolate-making course.</p>
                                        <p>Keep a note of the time since you have to make your way back to Montreux (roughly 1.30 hours).</p>
                                    </li>


                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Day 4- Interlaken - Grindelwald- Grindelwald First</b></h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/SWISStours-Blog-Gstaad-Saanen-Gruyere-Broc.jpg" alt="Gstaad-Saanen-Gruyere-Broc" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>After covering the western region from Montreux, we move to <a target="_blank" href="/blog/interlaken-switzerland" class='lnks'>Interlaken</a> and make it our base for the coming days. Not only is Interlaken perfectly located, it is also conveniently connected to all other major towns.</p>
                                        <p>After a journey of roughly 2.30 hours from Montreux, check in or leave your luggage at the hotel and leave for Grindelwald (35 minutes). Walk for a few minutes to the cable car station of Grindelwald First and hop on a cable car to the peak.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class='lnks'>Grindelwald First</a> offers some amazing views from the peak. From there, walk to the Cliff Walk by Tissot, which is a metal bridge along the side of the cliff with a viewing platform in the middle. Take in the stunning views of the surrounding Alpine territory before you head back. Ready to descend down the mountain in the most fun way? Choose some or all four fun activities that take you from the peak back to the base station.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Start off with the Ice Flyer - get strapped into single seats and zip down an 800-metre cable at 84 km/hr.</p>
                                        <p>Next is the First Glider - enjoy soaring down an 800m long route at 72km/hr while being securely strapped face down under the wings of a giant eagle.</p>
                                        <p>After this, get on the Mountain Cart and steer yourself down a three-kilometre route from Schreckfeld to Bort. The three-wheeled low-to-the-ground vehicle has wide tyres and hydraulic brakes, which give you full control of the speed you wish to travel at.</p>
                                        <p>Lastly, the Trotti bike - this motorised two-wheeler with a wide footboard and large tyres will take you down the last leg of the descent back to the base station.</p>
                                        <p>On reaching Grindelwald, walk through this picturesque alpine village, have a meal (there are many food outlets around the station) and head back to Interlaken.</p>
                                        <p>Note: Please check the age/weight requirements and the days of operation of the activities at Grindelwald First</p>
                                        <p>An early start from Montreux today will ensure you have enough time to enjoy the mountain.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Grindelwald-First-medium3.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Grindelwald First</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>


                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Day 5 - Interlaken- Jungfraujoch</b></h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/SWISStours-Blog-Jungfrau-Top-of-Europe.jpg" alt="Jungfrau-Top-of-Europe" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Get ready for the Top of Europe today. <a target="_blank" href="mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch</a>, at 3454 metres, is the highest railway station in Europe.<br />
                                            To reach Jungfraujoch, take a train to Grindelwald, followed by a cable car to the Eigergletscher station, and then, once again, take a train for the last leg of the journey to the peak. This journey takes 1.15 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>You can also take a whole train journey, but that takes a little longer (2 hours).</p>
                                        <p>At the peak, head to the viewing terrace for the most spectacular views. Walk through the Ice Palace with its lifelike ice sculptures and visit the Alpine Sensation to learn a little about the history of the Jungfrau railways. Needless to say, don't forget to stock up on chocolates from the Lindt Chocolate Heaven before you start your descent.</p>
                                        <p>If you have taken the cableway up, you can choose to make the train journey back and choose a train that goes to Lauterbrunnen (not Grindelwald, which you have already visited). This way, you will see one more gorgeous village in the Bernese Oberland region. Lauterbrunnen is also known as 'The Valley of 72 waterfalls'. Visit and find out why.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>


                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Day 6 - Interlaken</b></h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/SWISStours-Blog-Interlaken.jpg" alt="SWISStours-Blog-Interlaken" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            After a few long days packed with adventure and travel, take a break and have a leisurely day in Interlaken. Walk along the Hoheweg, Interlaken’s main street, which stretches between Interlaken East and West stations. The Hoheweg is a 2 km long road with shops and cafes. You can find top jewellery and watch brands, fashion boutiques, souvenir shops and plenty of cafes.<br />
                                            If you crave some Swiss chocolatey stuff, head for the Funky Chocolate Club for some sinfully chocolatey food and beverages. Spend some family-and-friends time sharing a fondue at one of the cafes along the Hoheweg. Interlaken, as the name suggests, is located between the two gorgeous Lakes Thun and Brienz. You can take a boat ride on any one of these.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>There are many picturesque villages to explore around Interlaken. One such village is Iseltwald (roughly 20 minutes by bus) known as the 'Pearl of Lake Brienz'. It is absolutely picture-perfect and has been the location of several scenes from the famous series Crash Landing On You.</p>
                                    </li>


                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Day 7 - Interlaken - Lucerne</b></h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/SWISStours-Blog-Lucerne.jpg" alt="SWISStours-Blog-Lucerne" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Have an early breakfast and set off for the City of Lights- <a target="_blank" href="/blog/lucerne-switzerland" class='lnks'>Lucerne</a>, today. The journey of roughly 1.50 hours can be done on the lovely <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/56-luzern-interlaken-express" class='lnks'>Lucerne-Interlaken Express</a> via some of the most breathtaking scenery. On arrival in Lucerne, head for the boat pier just outside the station and hop on a ferry to reach the <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/35-swiss-transport-museum" class='lnks'>Swiss Museum of Transport</a>, Switzerland's most visited museum.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            Get off at the ferry terminal Verkehrshaus-Lido and make your way to the museum. This museum showcases the history of air, rail, water, road and even space transport in the most fun and interactive way. It also houses a cinema with Switzerland’s largest screen, a planetarium and the lovely Swiss Chocolate Adventure attraction, an interactive activity to learn about the history of chocolate (and get to taste it at the end).<br />
                                            After you have spent a couple of hours at the museum, head back to Lucerne and explore this gorgeous lakeside town.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Walk across the Chapel Bridge, Europe's oldest wooden covered bridge. Read about the history of the bridge on the information boards, marvel at the 30 remaining paintings on the roof panel (almost 120 of these paintings were lost in a fire) and get some perfect pictures at one of Switzerland's most iconic structures (for me this is the most iconic structure).</p>
                                        <p>
                                            After seeing the bridge and the nearby watchtower ( even older than the bridge), visit Lucerne's Altstadt (Old Town) with its narrow cobble-stoned streets, frescoed houses and artsy boutiques.<br />
                                            After lunch at the Old Town or along a lakeside cafe, walk to the Lion Monument, a gigantic sculpture of a lion pierced by a spear. This moving sculpture honours the Swiss Guards massacred in the French Revolution.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>From here, head to the Musegg wall, which was once Lucerne's medieval city wall. Climb one of the towers to get stunning views across the city. See one of Lucerne's oldest working clocks (in the Zyt Tower), which strikes the hour one minute before all other clocks in the town.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            Make your way back to Lucerne Main Station. Don't forget to grab a meal somewhere in town or at the station since you have an almost two-hour journey back to Interlaken.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>


                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Day 8 - Zurich - Rhine Falls</b></h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/day%208.jpg" alt="day%208.jpg" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Bid Interlaken adieu and head to <a target="_blank" href="/blog/zurich-switzerland" class='lnks'>Zurich</a> (depending on the train you take, this journey will take between 2.00 and 2.50 hours). Take an early train so that you can make the most of a full day in Zurich.</p>
                                        <p>On arrival, leave your luggage at either Zurich airport or Zurich Main Station and make your way to Europe's largest waterfalls- the Rhine Falls. You can take a train to the station Schloss Laufen Am Rhein, which is adjacent to the waterfalls. Feel the thunderous roar and refreshing mist of the falls while standing at one of the viewing platforms. The falls, which stand 23 metres high and 150 metres wide, unleash several hundred cubic metres of water per second. In the summertime, you can take a boat and go really close to the falls. If you still have some adventure left in you, climb to the Middlerock towering above the centre of the falls. It stands at roughly 30 meters and requires a climb of over 100 steps.</p>
                                        <p>If you have some time upon your return to Zurich, you can walk along the Bahnofstrasse, the premier shopping street stretching 1.4 kilometres from Zurich Main Station to the lakeside. Stroll through shops showcasing all of Europe's finest watches, jewellery, fashion, and high street brands. Have an al fresco meal at one of the cafes along the lakeside before you head for the airport.</p>
                                        <p>Try to keep some time for shopping at Zurich airport. Besides stocking up on your last-minute chocolate and cheese, you can also indulge in some luxury shopping for Swiss watches, jewellery and fashion before you depart.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            In case you had any doubts about travelling to Switzerland, I hope this has nudged them out.<br />
                                            Don't think twice; grab the woollies, pack the bags and don't forget the most essential Swiss Travel Pass for all the discounts that will get you!
                                        </p>
                                    </li>

                                </ul>
                            </div>

                                            As you are planning

                <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-things-to-do-in-switzerland" class='lnks'>things to do in Switzerland</a>, you may know that this beautiful country offers far more than snow-capped mountains and mesmerising views of lush greenery.

                <br />
                                            <p>Reading a plethora of blogs, articles, or vlogs, it indeed becomes overwhelming to choose things to do in Switzerland, as each of the travellers shares their own experiences and recommendation. But worry not. SWISStours team of Swiss experts - who have travelled across Switzerland many times - have compiled a list of 10 things to do in Switzerland.</p>

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch</a> - is not only on the top of our list but is also recognised as the Top of Europe. Apart from exhibiting the breathtaking view of Swiss Alps, Jungfrau also offers an Ice Palace, Alpine Sensation, shopping, and outdoor snow activities. This majestic mountain checks all the boxes to get the best Swiss experience, be it if you are with your family, spouse, or travelling solo.

                <br />
                                            <p>
                                                Also, do not forget to claim your discount on

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch with Swiss Travel Pass</a>

                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2. Matterhorn</h2>

                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                            Nestled in the cosy village of Zermatt, Matterhorn draws the attention of every elated traveller around the world. Dubbed as the Toberlone mountain, it is the mountain that inspired the makers of Toberlone to introduce the perfect mountain-shaped delectable chocolates to the world. Many say Matterhorn is the world's most photographed mountain.

                <br />
                                            <p>
                                                So, visit

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</a> to view the majestic mountain up close and enjoy many activities atop. If you are the adventurous type, ditch the cable car and hike your way up to the peak. So, aren't you excited already to visit this majestic and mystical mountain?

                                            </p>

                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                                <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">

                                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class='lnks'>Mount Titlis</a> is another worth experiencing mountain on our list. You ascend on Titlis Rotair- the world's first revolving cable car. It is an experience in itself, giving you a 360-degree view of the captivating surrounding. Once you reached the summit, you can walk on Europe's highest suspension bridge- Titlis Cliff Walk, enjoy hiking, mountain biking, climbing, scootering, and the thrilling Titlis Adventure Park.

                                        </p>
                                        <br />
                                        <p>
                                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class='lnks'>Mount Titlis with Swiss Travel Pass</a> too comes at a discounted rate.

                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4. Grindelwald First</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">

                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class='lnks'>Grindelwald First</a> offers exhilarating adventures, fantastic view of Alps, and at the very top, you can also rest in front of a serene lake- Lake Bachalpsee.

                <br />
                                            <p>The four adventure activities are First Flyer, First Glider, Mountain Cart, and Trotti Bike. None of the activities is alike.</p>
                                            <br />
                                            <p>The sheer fun of experiencing these exciting activities will bring out the child in you. If you love adventures, don't make a gross mistake of scrapping it off from your list.</p>
                                            <br />
                                            Spoilers alert! You may keep coming back to Grindelwald first as experiencing it once won't satiate your adventure yearning. Undoubtedly, it will be one of the best things to do in Switzerland.

                                        </p>
                                        <br />
                                        <p>
                                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-ultimate-benefits-of-swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Benefits of Swiss Travel Pass</a> are applicable on Grindelwald First adventure activities.

                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5. Harder Kulm</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/harder-kulm.png" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            The only way to experience the best view of Interlaken is from

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/2-harder-kulm" class='lnks'>Harder Kulm</a> - The Top of Interlaken. At 1,322 meters above sea level, fondly look down upon the Lake Brienz and Lake Thun, or bask in the beauty of the majestically robust Eiger, Monch, and Jungfrau. Ascend to the top in 100 years strong funicular. If famished, indulge your palate at a panoramic restaurant, starkly resembling like a medieval castle.

                                        </p>
                                        <br />
                                        <p>
                                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/2-harder-kulm" class='lnks'>Harder Kulm ticket price with swiss pass</a> comes at discounted rates.

                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6. Pilatus</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/Mount-Pilatus-Blog.jpg" alt="Mount-Pilatus-Blog" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            In a country that's famous for mountains, how can one possibly miss

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class='lnks'>Pilatus</a>: Mountain of Dragons. As the name suggests, legend had dragons with healing powers inhabit the mountain. Once you reach at the top of the mountain in the world's steepest cogwheel railway, you'll get the answer why a dragon would live there.

                <br />
                                            <p>Today, Mt. Pilatus offers more than a majestic view, you can also experience many exciting activities at 2,128 meters above sea level.</p>
                                            <br />
                                            <p>
                                                Discounts on

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class='lnks'>Mount Pilatus with Swiss Travel Pass</a> are applicable.

                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7. Swiss Transport Museum</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/Swiss-Transport-Museum-Blog.jpg" alt="Swiss-Transport-Museum-Blog">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Switzerland's most visited museum and the country's largest museum -

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/35-swiss-transport-museum" class='lnks'>Swiss Museum of Transport</a>, is an ideal place to experience the glorious history of rail, road, air, and space travel. From documentary films in XXL format to modern planetarium offering 360-degree flights to stars, all the interactive activities and experiences are sure to win you over. The DayPass of Swiss Transport Museum includes entry to the museum, interactive experiences, Swiss Chocolate Adventure, Film Theatre, and Planetarium.

                <br />
                                            <p>
                                                Inclusion of the Swiss Museum of Transport in your

                <a target="_blank" href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class='lnks'>Switzerland itinerary</a> is a must!
                                            </p>
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Swiss-Transport-Museum-medium3.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Transport Museum</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/35-swiss-transport-museum" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8. Stanerhorn</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/stanerhorn-switzerland.jpg" alt="Stanserhorn, Switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            The eventful trip to the Stanserhorn starting with the century-old funicular is like a journey through history.

                <br />
                                            <br />
                                            The peak unfolds views over 100 kilometers of the Alps and 10 Swiss lakes.

                <br />
                                            <br />
                                            The Murmeli  plant protection area with enchanting fauna and flora and culinary highlights like the Älplermagronen in the revolving restaurant Rondorama all add to the charm atop the

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/13-stanserhorn" class="lnks">Stanserhorn</a>.

                <br />
                                            <br />
                                            In spite of the numerable things to discover on Stanserhorn, the most memorable moments of the trip are etched whilst riding in the CabriO - the world's first open double-decker cable car.

                <br />
                                            <br />
                                            This one-of-its-kind cable car is a combination of a mighty, luxurious bus with a convertible-car-like open roof, allowing you to enjoy 360-degree panoramic views.

                <br />
                                            <br />
                                            The six and a half minute journey on the CabriO feels like an indulgent ride to paradise while rejoicing in the picturesque, green landscapes of Switzerland.

                <br />
                                            <br />
                                            An unmissable thing to do in Switzerland in summer, Stanserhorn checks all the boxes when it comes to fun, experience, adventure, nature, romance, and even delicious cuisine. No wonder it is amongst the most loved mountains of Switzerland, frequented by not only the tourists but also the locals.

                <br />
                                            <br />
                                            A must inclusion in your

                <a target="_blank" href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class="lnks">Switzerland tour package</a>.

                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9. Glacier 3000</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/Glacier-3000-Blog.jpg" alt="Glacier-3000-Blog">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            As the name suggests,

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/4-glacier-3000" class='lnks'>Glacier 3000</a>
                                            rises high approx. 3000 meters above sea level. Treat your eyes to the glorious alpine views of Jungfrau, Matterhorn, and Mont Blanc.
                Click selfies on the famous peak-to-peak suspension bridge - Peak Walk by Tissot, and also stride on the Quille du Diable Glacier Walk.
                Your ticket also includes a thrilling ride on the Ice Express Chairlift and entry to the freezing snow park.

                <br />
                                            <p>
                                                You just cannot get it out of your

                <a target="_blank" href="/images/blog/SWISStours-Blog-Image-Banner-5.jpg" class='lnks'>things to do in Switzerland</a>.

                                            </p>
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Glacier-3000-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Glacier 300</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/4-glacier-3000" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10.Swissminiatur</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swissminiatur-park.jpg" alt="swissminiatur-park" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Nestled in the cosy village of Zermatt, Matterhorn draws the attention of every elated traveller around the world. Dubbed as the Toberlone mountain, it is the mountain that inspired the makers of Toberlone to introduce the perfect mountain-shaped delectable chocolates to the world. Many say Matterhorn is the world's most photographed mountain.

                <br />
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            So, visit

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</a> to view the majestic mountain up close and enjoy many activities atop. If you are the adventurous type, ditch the cable car and hike your way up to the peak. So, aren't you excited already to visit this majestic and mystical mountain?

                                        </p>
                                        <p>Indeed, it is possible to tour Switzerland in an hour or two's time. All thanks to Swisssminiatur.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/14-swiss-miniatur" class='lnks'>Swissminiatur</a> park - Switzerland's largest open-air miniature museum - is home to 128 intricately-designed hand-made models of attractions, monuments, castles, iconic buildings, and means of transport of Switzerland.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>Located in Melide, on the banks of Lake Lugano, Swissminatur is a 7 mins train ride away from Lugano. </p>
                                        <p>Swissminiatur opened in 1959 with a vision of the founder to indulge people in an unprecedented experience of Switzerland attractions within a few hours. As soon as it opened, people from Switzerland and all over the world feel in an unequivocal love with the park.</p>
                                        <p>working on extending the range of Swiss models at the park.</p>
                                        <p>All the models are fully-functional. A cablecar reaches the mountain from its station. A train runs steadily on the tracks. Waterfalls flow at with a thrusting pressure. A plane takes off at the airport. A boat sails smoothly. Despite being mini in size, the experience is real and magnanimous. </p>
                                        <p>Young ones love the park not only for the miniature models but also for the fun play area, which includes little rides and games for kids.</p>
                                        <p>So, no matter what is your age, indulge in an experience hand-crafted with the minutest attention to details for you. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            In our

                <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-things-to-do-in-switzerland" class='lnks'>things to do in Switzerland</a> list, Swissminiatur is a bonus, however, for many avid travellers, especially with kids, it ranks at the very first position.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3>Things to do at Swissminiatur</h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4>Miniature Models </h4>
                                            Enjoy the mini

                <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class='lnks'>Mount Titlis</a>, view of a boat ride, check out the parliament or marvel at the functioning of a mini train. There are 128 models to see. Take your time.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4>Workshops</h4>
                                            Many workshops are conducted regularly at the park to demonstrate the models in the making. Check out how the experts carefully craft fully-functional models, leaving out no details at all.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4>Play area</h4>
                                            If you are visiting with kids, do not miss the play area. Let your little ones play and enjoy a few rides. Maybe a few minutes for you to sit and relax while kids are at play.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4>Restaurant</h4>
                                            Of course, after all the walking and merriment, your hunger pangs will get better of you. To re-energise, head to the restaurant in the park and savour some delicious delicacies of Swiss.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4>Shop</h4>
                                            Buy something for yourself or pick up some souvenir to take back with you. Shop at Swissminatur will spoil you for choices. Be prepared to lose your purse strings.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3>How to reach Swissminatur</h3>
                                            Swissminiatur recommends reaching the park by public transport rather than a car as there is limited space for parking, especially on the weekends.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4>By Car</h4>
                                            Southern direction: A2 motorway (Chiasso - Italy) - take the Melide exit and follow signs for Bissone.

                <br />
                                            Northern direction: A2 motorway (Chiasso - St Gotthard) - take the Bissone/Campione d'Italia exit and follow signs for Melide.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4>By Train</h4>
                                            From Lugano, it's a 7-min train journey that will take you to Melide station. And from the station, approximately 200 metres walk to the Swissminiatur park.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4>By Boat</h4>
                                            From Lugano, it's a 35-min boat ride that will take you to the landing stage in Melide. And from there, approximately 400 metres walk to Swissminiatur park.

                <br />
                                            Swissminiatur tickets are available on

                <a target="_blank" href="https://www.swisstours.com/" class='lnks'>SWISStours</a>. Kindly note, Swissminiatur entry is not free with Swiss Travel Pass or combines with any discounts or offers of Swiss Pass.

                                        </p>

                                        <h2 class="bdm-title noneIMP">Introduction</h2>
                                        <p>The Swiss Travel Pass offers several benefits for travelers in Switzerland, including:</p>
                                        <p><b>Unlimited Travel:</b> Offers unlimited travel on consecutive or flexible days across the Swiss Travel System network in 90 urban areas.</p>
                                        <p><b>Flexibility:</b> Available in flexible or consecutive durations, such as 3, 4, 8, or 15 days within a month.</p>
                                        <p><b>Comprehensive Access:</b> Covers trains, buses, and boats on an extensive network of routes.</p>
                                        <p><b>Scenic Routes:</b> Includes some of the most scenic train routes in Switzerland, like the Glacier Express and Bernina Express.</p>
                                        <p><b>Museum Entries:</b> Free admission to over 500 museums throughout Switzerland.</p>
                                        <p><b>Discounts:</b> Provides up to 50% discounts or free travel on many mountain railways and cable cars, along with other activities and attractions.</p>
                                        <p><b>Family Friendly:</b> Children under 16 travel free with a parent holding a Swiss Travel Pass.</p>
                                        <p><b>Convenience:</b> Eliminates the need to purchase individual tickets, simplifying travel planning.</p>

                                        <p>This is a big advantage especially for tourists who are looking to explore Switzerland in depth during the limited number of days they have. Without the benefits of Swiss Pass, travellers would have to pay for every train, bus or tram ride from point to point. This not only becomes a time-waster while you're on a tight schedule but also turns out much more expensive. </p>

For non-pass holders, the price would range from CHF 87 to CHF 115 per Adult.

                                        <p>Another one of the other most popular attractions in Switzerland is Europe's highest train station: the Jungfraujoch, at 3454 m above sea level. The observatory is located at 3571 m. Being the most popular peak amongst people visiting Switzerland, it is also the most expensive. </p>

The prices range from CHF 118 to CHF 155 per Adult if you are holding a Swiss Travel Pass. For non-pass holders, the price would range from CHF 185 to CHF 235 per Adult.

Imagine having this experience free of cost. Non-pass holders have to pay full price.
					
                                        </p>

Rigi Kulm is the highest point (1798 m) and offers great views of Lake Lucerne, the Alps in the south and the plains in the north, all the way to Germany.</p>

However you need to pay a compulsory seat reservation fee regardless of whether you are holding a travel pass or point to point ticket. This means, the pass covers the cost of your full price point-to-point ticket, which is a massive saving. 
						
                                        </p>

Unlike the Bernina Express and Glacier Express, the Golden Pass is not a direct train. You pass three mountain passes, the famous 4000-metre Alpine peaks, 8 lakes and unforgettable views. 
						
                                        </p>

You do not even need seat reservations in 2nd class, although reservations are recommended for some legs of the train. In any case, it comes down to the same principle as the other two panoramic trains; you pay only for the seat reservation and not the full price of the point-to-point ticket.</p>

                                        <p>Let's suppose you intend to travel outside your base in Switzerland only for 4 out of the 8 days, you can benefit from the Flexi Pass option. </p>
                                        <p>This option is valid on 3, 4, 8 or 15 freely selectable days within one month rather than 3,4,8 or 15 consecutive days offered in a continuous pass. The Flexi Swiss Travel Pass holders can enjoy the same benefits as that of the consecutive passholders but only on the chosen days of travel.</p>
                                        <p>Travellers who want the comfort of a car but also want the best deals on the mountains and other benefits of the pass should opt for the Flexi option. That way, they can use the pass on certain days and get the best deals on those days.</p>

                                    <li data-index="1">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Popular Mountain Excursions discounts with the Swiss Travel Pass</b></h2>
                                        <h3><b>Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe - 35% discount</b></h3>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Jungfrau-Top-of-Europe-medium1.webp" alt="Jungfrau-Top-of-Europe" />
                                            </div>

                                            The Jungfraujoch at 3454 metres is the highest train station in Europe. The exciting journey to the top can be done by train or a combination of train & cableway. The views of the lush Grindelwald valley, the towering north face of the Eiger and eventually the stark white glacial world as you approach the peak are just stunning.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Enjoy the Sphinx viewing terrace, the Ice Palace, the Alpine Sensation and the Jungfrau panorama (cinematic experience) at the peak. Visit the Snow Fun Park for fun activities like ziplining and snow tubing, and end on a sweet note at the Lindt Chocolate Heaven.</p>
                                        <p>This is definitely one of the priciest mountain excursions but you get a roughly 35% discount on <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfrau with Swiss Travel Pass</a>. In addition, your kids under 16 travel free with the Swiss Family Card.</p>


                                        <h3><b>Mount Titlis- World’s First Revolving Cable Car - 50% discount</b></h3>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Mount-Titlis-medium1.webp" alt="Mount-Titlis" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Travel by the Titlis Xpress cable car, followed by the Titlis ROTAIR, the world’s first rotating cable ca,r passing stupendous views as you make your way to Mount Titlis. The ROTAIR rotates on its own axis once during the 5-minute journey, giving stunning views of snow-covered peaks, glaciers and crevasses.</p>
                                        <p>There is so much to do at the peak. Start with a walk through the 150-metre-long Glacier Cave, dug 10 metres below the glacier. Reach Glacier Park and enjoy snow activities with a ride on the Ice Flyer Chair Lift. Brave the 100 steps to walk over the Titlis Cliff Walk, Europe’s highest suspension bridge, for a real thrill with views from 500 metres above ground level. If you still have some more time, stop by the SnowXpark at Trubsee either along your ascent or descent from the peak.</p>
                                        <p>You get an almost 50% discount on <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class='lnks'>Mount Titlis with the Swiss Travel Pass</a>. Children under 16 travel free with the Swiss Family Card.</p>


                                        <h3><b>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise - 50% discount</b></h3>
                                        <p>Who doesn’t want to get a good view and photo of the World’s most photographed mountain?</p>
                                        <p>Travel to Zermatt and take a short walk or bus to the cable car station of the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise for great views of the mighty Matterhorn Massif. It is also said to be the inspiration for the unique triangular shape of Switzerland’s most popular chocolate, Toblerone.</p>
                                        <p>At the peak, get some great pics from the viewing platform, walk through the Glacier Palace with its ice sculptures and a slide-through ice tunnel, and the Cinema Lounge, Europe’s highest cinema.</p>
                                        <p>You get a 50% discount on <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise with Swiss Travel Pass</a> and your kids travel free with the Swiss Family Card.</p>


                                        <h3><b>Mount Pilatus - 50% discount</b></h3>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Mount-Pilatus-medium1.webp" alt="Mount-Pilatus" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Take a Golden Round Trip, a great 4-part journey, to visit Mount Pilatus:<br />
                                            1. Bus from Lucerne to Kriens.<br />
                                            2. Cable car from Kriens gondola station to the peak.<br />
                                            3. The World’s steepest cogwheel train to Alpnachstad.<br />
                                            4. Boat cruise from Alpnachstad pier back to Lucerne.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>This is a mountain full of fun with a rope park and a toboggan run at the midway point of Frakmuntegg.</p>
                                        <p>Stunning views of Lake Lucerne and the surrounding mountains await you at the peak. On a clear day, you can even see as far as the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau. Learn about the legend of the dragon with a walk through the Dragon World and have a meal with a great view.</p>
                                        <p>You get a 50% discount on <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class='lnks'>Mt. Pilatus with Swiss Travel Pass</a>, and your kids travel free with the Swiss Family Card.</p>


                                        <h3><b>Grindelwald First - 50% discount</b></h3>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Grindelwald-First-medium1.webp" alt="Grindelwald-First" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>If you are looking for adventure, you will definitely find it here. A short cable ride from the Grindelwald (just 30 minutes from Interlaken) cable car station to the peak takes you to an altitude of 2166 metres for amazing views.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            Walk along the Cliff Walk by Tissot and be rewarded with fantastic views from the viewing platform. Take a short hike and enjoy a picnic at the picturesque Bachalpsee (lake).<br />
                                            Do one or all of 4 amazing activities to make your descent truly enjoyable. The First Flyer, First Glider, Mountain Cart and Trotti bike are all super exciting and bring you back to Grindelwald.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Depending on the activities chosen, you get great discounts and combo offers on the <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class='lnks'>Grindelwald First with Swiss Travel Pass</a>. Children also have special discounted rates.</p>


                                        <h3><b>Glacier 3000 - 50% discount</b></h3>
                                        <p>A short bus drive from the beautiful village of Gstaad is the Glacier 3000. A cable car from the base station at Col Du Pillon takes you to the peak via stunning views.</p>
                                        <p>At the peak, walk over the Peak Walk by Tissot suspension bridge. This unique bridge connecting two mountain peaks offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding mountains.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            Get adventurous on the Alpine Coaster, the world’s highest toboggan run at 2925 metres.<br />
                                            The one-kilometre track with its waves, curls, and jumps is an exhilarating treat for adults and kids alike.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            You get a 50% discount on <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/4-glacier-3000s" class='lnks'>Glacier 3000 with Swiss Travel Pass</a> and your kids travel free with the Swiss Family Card.
