                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Popular panoramic train journeys discounts with the Swiss Travel Pass</b></h2>
                                        <h3><b>Glacier Express</b></h3>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/glacier-express-medium3.webp" alt="glacier-express" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Connecting the towns of Zermatt and St, Moritz, the Glacier Express, also lovingly called the slowest express train in the world, is arguably the most popular scenic train journey in Switzerland. The 7.45-hour journey passes by some of the most breathtaking scenery and iconic structures.</p>
                                        <p>Leaving Zermatt, the train travels past 4000-metre-high mountain peaks, winds its way via the Rhone Valley and reaches its highest point at the Oberlap Pass. It then goes over the iconic Landwasser viaduct with its six limestone arches. Along the route, the Glacier Express passes through an astounding 91 tunnels and across 291 bridges!</p>
                                        <p>To travel on the <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/43-glacier-express" class='lnks'>Glacier Express with the Swiss Travel Pass</a>, you only need to purchase a reservation (and not the pricey ticket).</p>


                                        <h3><b>Bernina Express</b></h3>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/bernina-express-medium1.webp" alt="Bernina Express" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            The Bernina Express connects the towns of Chur and St Moritz to Tirano in Italy.<br />
                                            The UNESCO World Heritage-listed train journey covers a spectacularly scenic route crossing 55 tunnels and 196 bridges.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Depending on your chosen segment, the journey takes 2.5 to 4.5 hours. In the summer, the journey extends via bus from Tirano back to Lugano (3 hours).</p>
                                        <p>Along it’s route, the Bernina Express travels past some stunning scenery and iconic structures like the iconic Landwasser Viaduct, the Brusio Spiral Viaduct, Alp Grun and the Bernina Pass with views over the Morteratsch Glacier.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            You only need to purchase a reservation to travel on the <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/42-bernina-express" class='lnks'>Bernina Express with the Swiss Travel Pass</a>.
                                        </p>


                                        <h3><b>Gotthard Panorama Express</b></h3>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/gothard-panorama-express-medium3.webp" alt="gothard-panorama-express" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>The train and boat combination makes the Gotthard Panorama Express unique. The journey connects the beautiful lakeside town of Lucerne to sunny Lugano in the south.</p>
                                        <p>A steamboat journey of 2.45 hours from Lucerne to Fluelen is like stepping into a world of bygone fairytales. This is followed by a 2.30-hour trip on the train to Lugano.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            On its way to Lugano, the train goes through the famous Gotthard tunnel and keeps you entertained with some stories about the history of the tunnel and the Gotthard Railways while passing through it.<br />
                                            After exiting the tunnel, it passes by Bellinzona, famous for the three medieval and now UNESCO World Heritage-listed castles, before reaching Lugano.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>To travel on the <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/58-gotthard-panorama-express" class='lnks'>Gotthard Panorama Express with the Swiss Travel Pass</a>, you only need to purchase a reservation for the train. You can hop on to the boat since it does not require a reservation.</p>

                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title"><b>Popular Museums and Cruises discounts with the Swiss Travel Pass</b></h2>
                                        <h3><b>Swiss Museum of Transport - 30% discount</b></h3>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Swiss-Transport-Museum-medium3.webp" alt="Swiss-Transport-Museum" />
                                            </div>

                                        <p>Switzerland’s most visited museum in Lucerne will be a day well spent with the family. This museum provides education and entertainment for all, regardless of age. It showcases the history of all types of transport ( road, air, rail and space) but that is definitely not all it offers.</p>
                                        <p>The Swiss Transport Museum also houses a planetarium, a cinema with the country’s largest screen and the Swiss Chocolate Adventure, a fun and interactive activity that takes you through the history and process of chocolate making….and yes, you get to taste some in the end.</p>
                                        <p>You get an almost 30% discount on the <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/14-swiss-miniatur" class='lnks'>Swiss Transport Museum with the Swiss Travel Pass</a>. Children get attractive discounts too.</p>


                                        <h3><b>Chillon Castle</b></h3>
                                        <p>Perfectly perched on an outcrop along the shores of Lake Geneva is the Chillon Castle; Switzerland’s most visited monument. A short bus ride from Montreux will get you to the castle in 20 minutes. Visit its dungeons, storage rooms, banquet halls and more with an audio-guided tour. The castle was also the inspiration behind Lord Byron’s famous poem The Prisoner of Chillon.</p>
                                        <p>The Chillon Castle is Free with the Swiss Travel Pass.</p>

You can opt for a snack or beverage from the snack bar and relax on the open-air top deck or the unique water-level aqua terrace.</p>

                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 1: Arrive at Zurich Airport and visit Rhine falls</h2>
                                        <p>Arrive at Zurich Airport keep your luggage at the Zurich Airport locker where you get small, medium and large sizes lockers and that can be used for up to 72 hours. </p>
                                        <p>Small lockers start at CHF6 for the first 12 hours and then cost another CHF3 for every 12-hour period up to 72 hours and proceed to visit Rhine falls. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Take a train for Neuhausen Rheinfall from Zurich Airport using your 
		
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a>. The journey time will be approximately 1 hour with 1 change in between. 
	
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Once you reach explore The Rhine Falls at your leisure. It is at 23 metres high and 150 metres wide, the Rhine Falls is one of the largest and most water-rich waterfalls in Europe. It is one of the great attractions in this region. It lies to the west of Untersee in Switzerland and attracts numerous travellers who have a fascinating view of the water masses between the rocks from several platforms. </p>
                                        <p>Another vantage point is the little castle of Wörth, which lies on an island in the Rhine. There are boat trips which can be taken up the Rhine to the falls and the Rheinfallfelsen. Shorter and longer boat trips are offered. The cost will be approx. 10CHF per person depending on the duration of the boat ride. </p>
                                        <p>There are also viewing platforms with views of the falls built on both sides of the Rhine. These are reached via steep and narrow stairs (access by fee on the Schloss Laufen side).  </p>
                                        <p>Later after completing the Rhine fall tour board the train for Zurich Airport from Neuhausen Rheinfall to collect your luggage. After collecting take a train to Lucerne from Zurich airport (time taken roughly 1 hr). </p>
                                        <p>After reaching check-in to your apartment/hotel. Move out to explore the Lucerne city which is the gateway to central Switzerland, situated beside the beautiful Lake Lucerne. </p>
                                        <p>Visit the Chapel bridge which is a covered wooden footbridge spanning the river Reuss diagonally in the city of Lucerne in central Switzerland. Named after the nearby St. Peter's Chapel, the bridge is unique in containing a number of interior paintings dating back to the 17th century. The Chapel Bridge is the oldest wooden covered bridge in Europe, as well as the world's oldest surviving truss bridge. It serves as the city's symbol and as one of Switzerland's main tourist attractions. </p>
                                        <p>With a few minutes of walk you can also visit the Lion Monument, or the Lion of Lucerne, which is a rock relief in Lucerne, Switzerland, designed by Bertel Thorvaldsen and hewn in 1820-21 by Lukas Ahorn. It commemorates the Swiss Guards who were massacred in 1792 during the French Revolution, when revolutionaries stormed the Tuileries Palace in Paris. </p>
                                        <p>Overnight at Lucerne.</p>

                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 2: Lucerne: Mt. Titlis</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">

                                            Today visit 
							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class='lnks'>Mount Titlis</a> which is a mountain of the Uri Alps, located on the border between the cantons of Obwalden and Bern, located at 3,238 metres (10,623 ft.) above sea level. 
						
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Travel directly from Lucerne to Engelberg on the "Zentralbahn" railway. The journey from Lucerne takes around 45 minutes. The route from Engelberg train station to the TITLIS valley station takes just ten minutes on foot or you can hop on the free shuttle bus. Exchange your voucher for the tickets. </p>
                                        <p>To go up the mountain the 8-seater TITLIS Xpress cable car will transport you all the way up from Engelberg to Stand station. You can hop on or off at Trübsee middle station where the TITLIS ROTAIR cable car will then take you on the final leg of the ascent from Stand to the summit station at 3,020 metres above sea level. The journey from Engelberg to TITLIS mountain station takes around 30 minutes</p>
                                        <p>Use the Ice Flyer which will fly you from the mountain station to the TITLIS glacier park. And in winter, the chair lift will take you all the way up to the fantastic ski slopes on the summit. </p>
                                        <p>Also visit the TITLIS Cliff Walk which is just one metre wide and over 100 metres long. The views into the abyss below are breathtaking! The TITLIS Cliff Walk holds the record for being the highest suspension bridge in Europe. </p>
                                        <p>All kinds of exhilarating snow activities await in the glacier park in summer. </p>
                                        <p>Whiz down the snow toy run on one of our fun sit-skis, snake gliss or minibobs and let our magic carpet conveyor belt whisk you quickly and easily back to the top. </p>
                                        <p>Snowtubing is the ultimate alternative sledding experience that will see you skimming the glistening snow as you hurtle down the piste on a rubber tyre. You're sure to spin full circle several times before reaching the end of this bumpy yet exhilarating ride. It is specially designed run will keep you safely on track. </p>
                                        <p>There are restaurants at the top: Panorama Restaurant or Terrace. On your descent you can visit Engelberg a small village. There is a monastery that you can visit. </p>

                                        <p>Interlaken is a base town for anyone who wishes to see a lot of the Bernese Oberland. It is surrounded by the Alps covered by snow. The town is situated in between two beautiful lakes that is Lake Thun and Lake Brienz.</p>
                                        <p>Interlaken has two rail stations. Interlaken Ost is the main one, Interlaken West is smaller. The street connecting both stations is the main shopping street with all the brands. The Interlaken Ost stations offer frequent train, bus and boat services to all attractions.</p>

                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/19-jetboat-interlaken" class='lnks'>Jetboat </a>Ride. This exciting boat trip takes you from the jet port in Bönigen to the majestic and famous Giessbach Waterfalls, thundering 500 meters down over 14 cascades into the lake. The boat captains knows the lake inside out and give you information about the surroundings and the region.
										
                                        </p>

This is the best activity that you will never forget.</p>

                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch-top-of-europe.jpg" alt=" Jungfraujoch" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Wake up to one of the most exciting days of your 6 days Switzerland itinerary. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Hop on to a train from Interlaken Ost to 
												
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch</a> - Top of Europe with 2 changes at Lauterbrunnen or Grindlewald and last change Kleine Scheidegg. Then ascend by the Jungfrau Railway from Kleine Scheidegg to the magnificent mountain world of eternal ice and snow, Jungfraujoch-at 3454mts, the highest railway station in Europe.
											
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Once on top see the Ice Palace the tunnels of ice, which offers a frosty at minus 3°C. Mountain guides created the aisles and halls in the 1930s with picks and saws in the middle of the Jungfraufirn. Now they are adorned with frozen sculptures of eagle, penguin or bear. </p>
                                        <p>The Sphinx Terraces offer a panoramic view of the Alps. Enjoy the wonderland of ice, snow and rock around the Aletsch Glacier, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. </p>

                                        <p>Snow clad mountains, shimmering lakes, cozy chalets, romantic panoramic restaurants, and spas that's what makes honeymoon in Switzerland the ultimate romantic holiday - and a honeymoon deserves nothing less!</p>
                                        <p>Planning your honeymoon in Switzerland package just right gives you the opportunity to return with memories for a lifetime</p>
                                        <p>The list of reasons to spend your honeymoon in Switzerland is endless. Every little town and village is so picturesque and offers so many experiences. To make the planning simpler, here are our top choices of honeymoon places that you can visit and things that you can do in Switzerland to make this time special.</p>

                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1. Interlaken </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/interlaken.jpg" alt="Interlaken, Switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>The wallpaper worthy snow-capped mountains and lakes make Interlaken a perfect place to start exploring this country on your honeymoon in Switzerland. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Lose yourselves in the picturesque beauty of the Alps as you board some of the finest railways in the world using your 
							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a> and travel through the heart of the famous Jungfrau Region.
						
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            You can take an exclusive romantic boat ride on Lake Brienz by hopping on to the Donna Anna which is an original Venetian taxi boat. Of course, if you and your better half are the adventurous type, then maybe a faster ride on the 
							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/19-jetboat-interlaken" class='lnks'>Jetboat</a> on Lake Brienz will be your thing. If you are adventure seekers, look no further. Interlaken is an adventure-heaven. From rafting, to skydiving or a romantic tandem paragliding flight, Interlaken offers it all.
						
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Don't forget, you have the Alps all around you. Visit the 
							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch</a> for the most spectacular views over the Aletsch Glacier, the 
							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class='lnks'>Grindelwald First</a> for some fun activity (zipliner, mountain kart, trottibiking) and top off a day with a romantic dinner at the Panorama Restaurant atop the 
							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/2-harder-kulm" class='lnks'>Harder Kulm</a> gazing over the twinkling lights of Interlaken. 
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2. Lucerne</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/mount-titlis.jpg" alt="Mount Titlis" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>A romantic walk along the lake and a photo on the iconic Chapel Bridge will add to the charm of your honeymoon at Switzerland. </p>
                                        <p>Visit the Lion Monument and Lucerne's Old Town - one of the prettiest and best preserved. Walk along its largely pedestrian only paths, visit the church of St Leodegar with its twin spires and have a romantic meal at one of the lakeside cafes. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            In the evening, sail off into the sunset on a cruise and see the amazing views along the shore. You can also opt for a 
											
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/21-lake-lucerne-dinner-cruise" class='lnks'>Lake Lucerne dinner cruise</a> and raise a toast to your future with the best Swiss wines of course! 
										
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Central Switzerland also has some amazing mountain excursions. Visit 
											
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class='lnks'>Mt Titlis</a> with its revolving cable car- Rotair, or 
											
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/13-stanserhorn" class='lnks'>Stanserhorn</a> with a unique open top double decker cable car.  
										
                                        </p>
                                        <p>If you want to indulge in spa related activities look no further than  Mt Rigi which has one of the best baths and spas in the country. Bathing in a fairy tale setting with a breathtaking view of the Alps will surely make your honeymoon in Switzerland unforgettable. </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/titlis-rotair.jpg?ver=1" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mt Titlis</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3. Zurich</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/zurich.jpg" alt="Zurich - Switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Zurich - a vibrant city with countless museums, theaters, Opera house and Art cafes. Visit Altstadt (Old Town) and walk down the beautiful narrow cobblestoned lanes with countless cafes.</p>
                                        <p>Definitely visit the Mühlesteg Bridge to lock your love with a Love-lock before tossing the key into the river. This is the time to impress your loved one. </p>
                                        <p>Indulge in some retail therapy at Bahnofstrasse, the city's famous shopping street with watch, jewelry and fashion brands of every brand that you can think of.  </p>
                                        <p>Zurich also has a vibrant nightlife centered around the Niederdorf area. You will be spoilt for choice between the numerous clubs, bars and cafes available.  </p>
                                        <p>If you have decided on a couple of days in Zurich, you can also visit the romantic medieval town of Stein Am Rhein. This can be done as a day trip including the Rhine Falls- Europe's largest waterfall. </p>
                                        <p>Zurich has some really picturesque panoramic points with amazing views over the city. Make your way to Uetliberg or take the Dolderbahn to the Dolder recreational area. Once there, you can have a romantic meal at the legendary Dolder Grand Hotel.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4. Geneva</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jet-d-eau.jpg" alt="Jet D Eau, Geneva" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Geneva is so much more than International Organizations and Watches. It has Europe's largest Alpine lake and the iconic Jet d'Eau, the most distinctive symbol of the city. </p>
                                        <p>Take a romantic ride on a boat and get closer to the fountain for a better view. Walk through Geneva's Old Town (called Vielle Ville in French). This ancient maze of small streets and picturesque squares, are filled with homey cafés, restaurants, galleries, museums and historical buildings adorned with beautiful masonry facades. </p>
                                        <p>A romantic day in the Lavaux valley vineyards along with lunch and wine of course, will add a real nice touch to your stay in Geneva.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5. Lugano</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/lake-lugano.jpg" alt=" Lake Lugano" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Lugano is at the Southern tip of the country bordering Italy. With its palm-lined lakes, beautiful valleys and Mediterranean climate, Lugano in the Ticino region is a year round destination.  </p>
                                        <p>The Parco Civico in Lugano is a 63,000 square metre park to wander around and gaze at the amazing flora and centuries old trees. Head to one of the mountains San Salvatore or Monte Bre for stunning views over the town. </p>
                                        <p>You could also go to romantic lakeshore village of Morcote which was voted Switzerland's most beautiful village in 2016. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There's a mini-version of Switzerland located just 7min train ride away from Lugano known as 
																									
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/14-swiss-miniatur" class='lnks'>Swiss Miniatur</a> With more 120 models and attractions of entire country, you can boast to have completed entire honeymoon in Switzerland in one day. 
																								
                                        </p>
                                        <p>You can also visit Gandria, another charming fishing village at the foot of Monte Bre.  End the day by renting a paddleboat and spending some cozy time on the serene lake.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Swiss-Miniature-medium3.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Miniatur</p>

                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6. Lausanne</h2>
                                        <p>Lausanne along the shores of Lake Geneva is a picturesque town surrounded by sloping vineyards.  </p>
                                        <p>It has beautiful parks and an almost vehicle-free old Town with winding alleyways abounding with cozy cafes and boutiques. </p>
                                        <p>The most prominent feature of the Old Town is the cathedral which is known to be Switzerland's most impressive gothic cathedral. </p>
                                        <p>Walk along the beautiful waterfront Ouchy, visit a vineyard or take a romantic boat cruise to make your stay truly special. </p>
                                        <p>Lausanne is also a cultural capital with lots of museums, public concerts and markets year round.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7. St. Moritz</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/diavolezza-cable-car.jpg" alt="Diavolezza Cablecar" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>A honeymoon in Switzerland is incomplete without visiting the beautiful St. Moritz, which is also known for its healing mineral springs. </p>
                                        <p>Visit the Kulm Spa and unwind with your better half while enjoying a marvelous view of Lake St. Moritz.  </p>
                                        <p>Take a walking trail of Blumenweg and experience beautiful wildflower and see the famous Heidi Hutte. Go skiing or take a few lessons together with your loved one. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Visit the 
																													
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/40-diavolezza" class='lnks'>Diavolezza</a> for stunning views of the Aletsch Glacier and if you really want to notch it up, prebook the open air hot tub for the most romantic experience ever!
																												
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Depending on your 
																													
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class='lnks'>Swiss itinerary</a>, try to take the Glacier Express or the Bernina Express out of St. Moritz.   																	
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/diavolezza-cable-car.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Diavolezza</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/40-diavolezza" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>

                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8. Montreux</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/chillon-castle-montreux.jpg" alt="Chillon Castle, Montreux" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Montreux is resort town on Lake Geneva. It is situated between a lakeside and steep hills. </p>
                                        <p>Take a walk down the lakeside promenade and visit the 12th century Chillon Castle to learn about its history. </p>
                                        <p>The gorgeous terraced Lavaux wine valley too can be visited from here. </p>
                                        <p>A visit to nearby Vevey to see the Charlie Chaplin museum and learn about the life and works of this comical genius.  </p>
                                        <p>Since Switzerland is synonymous with chocolates, cheese and world class rail system, they have combined these 3 into one and created the Chocolate Train.  </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Add a ‘sweet touch' to your holiday with this day excursion from Montreux which takes you to the cheese factory in Gruyeres and the world famous Nestle- Cailler chocolate factory in Broc.  Both activities are most of the time are either free or come at a 
																																		
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>discount with Swiss Pass.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>You can taste the chocolates and ofcourse buy some for family and friends back home.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/swiss-travel-pass.jpg" alt="Swiss Travel Pass">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Travel Pass</p>
                                                <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9. Zermatt</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/zermatt-cafe-switzerland.jpg" alt="Zermatt Café Switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Zermatt, a quintessentially Swiss town and probably the most popular one. This world famous ski resort is dominated by the mighty massif of the 
																																						
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn </a>- the world's most photographed mountain. 
																																					
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Visit the 
																																						
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise </a>for some amazing views of the Matterhorn and be prepared to take the most stunning photographs with it as a backdrop. Don't forget to enjoy a steep offer with a 
																																						
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>discount on Swiss Travel Pass</a> on your visit to Matterhorn.
																																					
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Walk through the buzzing village centre with its cozy cafes and the ancient Hinterdorf area with its narrow cobbled streets.  </p>
                                        <p>If you want to add some active time, make sure to do the Five Lakes Walk that is probably the most popular hike in Zermatt. The five mountain lakes along the route are stunning and if you are lucky, you will get amazing views of the Matterhorn reflected in them.  </p>
                                        <p>A honeymoon in Switzerland is the perfect time to indulge yourselves and there is no better way to do that than with a helicopter ride from Zermatt</p>
                                        <p>The ride will take you over the Matterhorn for an unforgettable indelible view of the peak. If you are lucky and the weather permits it, the pilot may even make a short landing on the top. Where experiences go, there are none to beat this one! </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Zermatt offers some really beautiful 
																																						
                            <a target="_blank" href="/apartments" class='lnks'>Switzerland apartment</a> accommodations with great views especially of the Matterhorn, which is a plus point in any honeymoon.
																																					
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Matterhorn-Glacier-Paradise-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10. Leukerbad</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/thermal-spa-leukerbad.jpg" alt="Thermal Spa Switzerland " />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Switzerland is known for its mineral springs and their healing powers. Some towns in Switzerland have become famous for their spas, which have channelized these springs into their pools and wellness centres.</p>
                                        <p>Leukerbad is the largest thermal spa resort in the Alps with 3.9 million litres of bubbling water up to 51 degrees centigrade. If you are making a day trip, you can visit the Leukerbad Therme that is a public spa or else stay at one of the hotels which has its own private spa.  </p>
                                        <p>The feeling of being submerged in bubbling hot water and gazing out at snow covered peaks will definitely be one of the highlights of your honeymoon in Switzerland.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>

                            <%--10-reason-to-visit-things-to-do-in-switzerland-in-winter--%>
                            <div class="bd-padding" id="div10_reason_to_visit_things_to_do_in_switzerland_in_winter" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <p>Switzerland may be small but it's big on what it offers to its visitors all year round. It is arguably the most popular summer and winter destination in all of central Europe. </p>
                                        <p>Switzerland in winter not only attracts tourists from across the world, but also has a huge chunk of domestic and European tourists especially from neighboring countries like Germany due to its amazing winter activities - and skiing is just one of them!  </p>
                                        <p>Switzerland is beautiful all year round but in the winter, when the mountains turn totally white and there is a fresh crispiness to the air, the charm is only doubled. </p>
                                        <p>The unbelievable miles of pistes, the white valleys that the train journeys take you through and the sight of snowy peaks, which you can gaze at from a hot tub of natural mineral springs, can all blow your mind.  </p>
                                        <p>Other than nature, Switzerland in winter is abuzz with events, Christmas markets, winter sports and events that make for an amazing holiday. Here are just some of the fun things that you can do if you are travelling to Switzerland in winter.  </p>
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1. Glacier Express from Zermatt to St Moritz </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/glacier-express.jpg" alt="glacier express" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>The most popular train journey in Switzerland also connects the two most popular winter destinations of the country - St. Moritz and Zermatt. This train, also known as the "Slowest Express train in the World" and the "Window to the Alps" takes you across mountains, valleys, tunnels and 291 bridges and will have you mesmerized throughout the almost 8-hour journey. </p>
                                        <p>Sit back and gaze through its panoramic windows, order a 3 course meal and feel at one with nature. </p>
                                        <p>If you really want to notch up the experience and have the pockets for it, try the Excellence Class in which every seat is a window seat. The Excellence Class also includes a 7 course meal, champagne and has a concierge service. Live it up! </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: If you hold the 
						
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a>, you only have to pay for seat reservation on the Glacier Express.  
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/swiss-travel-pass.jpg" alt="Swiss Travel Pass">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Travel Pass</p>
                                                <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>

                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2. Visit Jungfrau </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfrau-swiss-flag.jpg" alt="jungfrau swiss flag" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch</a> - Top of Europe is one of the most popular Alpine excursions come summer or winter.  
									
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The Jungrau is a heaven clad in white the full year round but in winter fresh, downy snow just adds to the beauty. </p>
                                        <p>Visit the Ice palace, try some sledding and grab a delicious meal while on top.  </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: Jungfrau is one of the more expensive mountain excursions in Switzerland. However, 
										
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch with Swiss Travel Pass</a> comes at discounted fares.  
									
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3.  Christmas Markets </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/christmas-market-switzerland.jpg" alt="christmas market switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Christmas comes early to Switzerland! By mid-November, many small and big towns put up their Christmas markets that are a huge tourist draw…and justifiably so!</p>
                                        <p>These markets with their Christmas trees, twinkling lights and Christmas music (sometimes choirs) just make the already beautiful surroundings more magical. The markets have all kinds of stalls selling locally produced foods and drinks (amazing cheese, and dairy products, preserves, gingerbread and of course wines!) </p>
                                        <p>There is an amazing array of Christmas buntings, clothes, artefacts and jewelry. There are skating rinks and other entertainment rides that the kids can enjoy as well.  </p>
                                        <p>Among the more popular markets to visit in Switzerland in the winter are the ones in Basel, Bern, Montreux and Zurich. </p>
                                        <p>However smaller towns like Rapperswiil, Murten and Stein Am Rhein also hold beautiful Christmas markets.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4. Thermal Spas</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/thermal-spa-leukerbad.jpg" alt="thermal spa leukerbad" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Don't forget your swimming gear in winter! Yes, you heard right. Switzerland's mountains have blessed her with an unending supply of rich mineral healing waters that have been channelized into amazing thermal spas. </p>
                                        <p>The spa's of Switzerland are popular throughout the year but just imagine the allure of soaking up in an outdoor pool, in waters that can range somewhere near 23 to 43 degrees C and gaze out at white vistas and snowy peaks. And like everything Swiss, these spas are in wonderfully scenic places. </p>
                                        <p>Some of the most popular ones are Leukerbad Thermal Spa - Europe's largest Alpine Thermal Spa, Mineralbad, Spa Rigi Kaltbad, the Thermalbad and Spa-Zurich. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5. Fondue in the Alps -  Gstaad </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/glacier-3000-peak-walk.jpg" alt="glacier 3000 peak walk" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Head for Gstaad in the Bernese Oberland. Gstaad is the centre of the jet setting crowd and known for its small and exclusive pedestrian town centre with high end luxury outlets. </p>
                                        <p>Gstaad and its neighbouring villages offer a wide number of winter activities like skiing, snowboarding, tobogganing and winter walking trails. There is also a trail which takes the hikers up to a mountain to have a high altitude fondue. Hot cheese with toasty flavors surrounded by winter landscape? What more can you ask for.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            You can also visit the 
																			
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/4-glacier-3000" class='lnks'>Glacier 3000</a> from Gstaad. A short bus ride from Gstaad main station to Col Du Pillon and you are ready to board the cableway to this snow-clad mountain with its unique summit station designed by architect Mario Botta. 
																		
                                        </p>
                                        <p>From the top you can see 24 snowcapped mountains including the Jungfrau and even the Mont Blanc. Glacier 3000 has the highest toboggan run and the world's first suspension footbridge spanning 2 mountains.  </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: Like all other mountains, Glacier 3000 will also offer you a passholder discount if you hold the 
																			
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Pass</a>.  
																		
                                        </p>
                                    </li>

                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6. Zermatt and the Matterhorn  </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/zermatt-cafe-switzerland.jpg" alt="zermatt-cafe-switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>The small car free town of Zermatt nestled at the foothills of the Matterhorn is Switzerland's winter paradise. Every winter sports enthusiast heads to the place. </p>
                                        <p>Zermatt offers 200kms of pistes making it a skiing heaven. However, that is not all…Zermatt also offers sledding, paragliding and more.  </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Try a romantic nights stay at the Igloo Village (December to mid-April) at 2727 metres above sea level with glorious views of the 
																							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn</a>. Each igloo is lined with lambskin making sure that you are perfectly warm while it snows outside. A cheese fondue and some mulled wine will make this a highlight of your winter holiday. 
																						
                                        </p>
                                        <p>No trip to Zermatt is complete without visiting the Matterhorn.  </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A cable car ride to the 
																							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</a> or a cogwheel train ride to the Gornergrat will give you stunning views of the massive triangular peak of the Matterhorn, said to be the most photographed mountain in the world. See it for yourself and you will know why.    
																						
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: 
																							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Discount on Swiss Travel Pass</a> is applicable on Matterhorn Glacier Paradise.  
																						
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Matterhorn-Glacier-Paradise-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7. St Moritz</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/grand-tour-switzerland-st-moritz.jpg" alt="grand-tour-switzerland-st-moritz" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>St Moritz has twice hosted the winter Olympics so it is no wonder that it's the prime winter sport destination that tourists travel to. </p>
                                        <p>However, other than skiing St Moritz also has ice skating rinks, bob sledding, curling and tobogganing for non skiers. </p>
                                        <p>It is also famous for its natural springs, which were discovered over 3000 years ago and are today sought after via its spas.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8. Lucerne </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/interlaken-lucerne-train.jpg" alt="interlaken-lucerne-train" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>One of the most popular towns in Switzerland, Lucerne is known for its beauty and nearby mountains that are popular in summer and winter. </p>
                                        <p>The lakeside town itself with its famed wooden covered Chapel Bridge, Lion Monument and beautiful Old Town is worth exploring.  </p>
                                        <p>A short bus or train ride from Lucerne and you can reach one of Central Switzerland's many mountains. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class='lnks'>Mount Titlis</a> can be reached from Engelberg. Mt Titlis is snow bound all year round and amazingly beautiful in the winter especially as you travel upwards in the ROTAIR, the revolving cable car which gives you 360 degree views of the snowy fairytale landscape all around you. 
																														
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Other peaks like 
																															
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class='lnks'>Mount Pilatus</a>, Mt Rigi with its spa at Rigi Kaltbad, and  
																															
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/13-stanserhorn" class='lnks'>Stanserhorn</a> are all close by.  
																														
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: 
																															
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-ultimate-benefits-of-swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Benefits of Swiss Travel Pass</a> apply on many mountain excursions and activities across Switzerland.
																														
                                        </p>

                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/titlis-rotair.jpg?ver=1" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mt Titlis</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9. Ice Rinks in Interlaken</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/interlaken.jpg" alt="interlaken" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>From mid-December to February, you can skate right in the center of Interlaken thanks to the "Top of Europe Ice Magic" which creates 5 interconnected ice skating rinks. </p>
                                        <p>Ice paths that you can walk on from one to the other connect the rinks. </p>
                                        <p>There are also amazing food stalls to help with the hunger that you will no doubt feel after using up some energy at the rinks.  </p>
                                        <p>Despite what most people think, you do not need to know your way on the ice since most skating rinks offer skating aids that help non-skaters to try their hand at the sport too. </p>
                                        <p>Interlaken is also one of the prettiest places in the country situated between the 2 lakes of Thun and Brienz (thus the name Interlaken- meaning between 2 lakes).   </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10. Montreux Noel </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/rochers-de-naye-switzerland.jpg" alt="rochers-de-naye-switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>This one is particularly for families with kids (although we know adults enjoy it just as much). Along with the Montreux Christmas market (which is one of the best), from around 24th of November to the 24th of December, you can visit the Rochers De Naye mountain and see the real Santa Claus at his home and workshop. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Take a cogwheel train to the 
																																							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/8-rochers-de-naye" class='lnks'>Rochers De Naye</a>, which is at 2032m above sea level and has amazing views over Montreux and Lake Geneva. 
																																						
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Once on top, you walk through a beautifully decorated tunnel to reach the house of Father Christmas. The kids get a chance to talk to him, take a photograph and also get a certificate for the visit. With that certificate, you walk to his office where one of his helpers will present you with a gift bag. </p>
                                        <p>The train departs every hour from around 9 am to 3 pm but operates from Wednesday through Sunday so make sure you plan your itinerary accordingly. Also there are limited seats so it is best to book in advance.  This is truly one to add to the bag of "amazing holiday memories". Ho Ho Ho </p>
                                        <p>These are just a few of the things that one can do in the winter. Of course Switzerland has loads more if you have the time. </p>
                                        <p>Plan well so that you can include as much as possible during your next visit to Switzerland in winter.   </p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>

                            <%--foods-and-drinks-to-try-in-switzerland--%>
                            <div class="bd-padding" id="divfoods_and_drinks_to_try_in_switzerland" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <p>
                                            Other than its small size, there is nothing small about Switzerland. Not its mountains, adventure activities, railway network and definitely not its food scene.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Each canton has taken the best of home-grown produce, added a mix of neighbouring influences (don't forget Switzerland shares its borders with Germany, Italy, Austria, and France), and, like everything Swiss, created perfection even with its food. From comforting and homey dishes to refined meals and mouth-watering desserts, this country has it all.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Here are our top 10 must-try food dishes and drinks in Switzerland.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b><u>Summary</u></b>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Cheese Fondue - Delectable melted cheese dish to dip into with friends.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Raclette - Melting cheese poured directly onto baby potatoes and more.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Rosti - Crispy golden brown grated potato pancake with yummy toppings.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Basler Mehlsuppe - Steaming bowl of hot browned flour soup topped with cheese.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Alpermagronen - Everyone's favourite mac and cheese made better the Swiss way.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Zürcher Geschnetzeltes - Veal and mushroom ragout, originally from the Zurich area.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Muesli - invented by a Swiss doctor and now the world's favourite breakfast.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Swiss Desserts - Bündner Nusstorte, Lackerli, cakes and more.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Swiss chocolate - From local artisanal chocolatiers to global brands like Caillers and Lindt.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Swiss beverages - Bubbly, fizzy, foamy or fruity, Switzerland has it all
                                        </p>

                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1. Cheese Fondue</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swiss-fondue.jpg" alt="swiss-fondue" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Only the Swiss can turn a simple cheese and bread dish into a social ritual. This typical Swiss dish of melted cheese (the word Fondue comes from the French verb 'fondre'- to melt) can be found across Switzerland and in almost all types of restaurants.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The dish itself comes in a sort of communal dish of melted cheese (Gruyere and Emmental) around which fellow foodies dip their bread. Don't forget to keep stirring the cheese to keep it smooth and creamy. Pair this with a nice white wine for a good balance of flavours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            This is generally on every traveller's <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-things-to-do-in-switzerland" class='lnks'>things to do list in Switzerland</a>.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2. Raclette</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/raclette-swiss-food.jpg" alt="raclette-swiss-food" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Here's one more typically Swiss way to enjoy melted cheese. Raclette (once again derived from the French verb 'racler'- to scrape) is melted cheese poured directly from a melting wheel of cheese onto baby jacket potatoes, pickled onions, gherkins and fruit. Almost all traditional Swiss restaurants will have Raclette on offer.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3. Rosti</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/rosti-swiss-delicacy.jpg" alt="rosti-swiss-delicacy" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Made of pan-fried grated potatoes with toppings of bacon, fried egg and cheese, Rosti is like a potato pancake. The sliced or grated potato is closely packed and brought to a heavenly golden brown exterior with a soft centre. It is typically found in most traditional restaurants and even more so in the German-speaking part of Switzerland.
                                        </p>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4. Basler Mehlsuppe</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/basel-flour-soup-switzerland.jpg" alt="basel-flour-soup-switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            This earthy brown broth combines browned flour, beef stock, butter and onions topped with grated Gruyere cheese. Sometimes, it is enhanced with red wine. The name, which literally means Basel flour soup, is native to Basel and is traditionally served at the Fasnacht (Basel's annual celebration that comes before Lent in the Christian calendar).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            It is said that a chatty cook once burnt the flour while preparing soup and, instead of starting from scratch again, decided to take the wrong and make it right somehow. He decided to continue roasting the flower in butter, added the beef stock to it and in doing this, turned it into the phenomenally popular dish that it is today.    
                                        </p>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5. Alplermagronen</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/alplermagronen-switzerland.jpg" alt="alplermagronen-switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Alplermagronen, or Alpine macaroni, is like mac and cheese, only better. It was originally a dish meant to help local farmers gain the energy needed to work on harsh Alpine terrain. It's made of macaroni and potato cubes in a cheesy, creamy sauce and served with apple sauce and fried onions. While the addition of apple sauce may seem odd to mac and cheese buffs, trust me, it takes the dish to another level.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6. Zürcher Geschnetzeltes</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/zürcher-geschnetzeltes.webp" alt="zürcher-geschnetzeltes" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Made of pan-fried veal strips, cream, beef stock, mushrooms and wine, this ragout has a rich flavour of herbs, parsley and lemon zest. Said to have originated in the Zurich area, this popular dish is now available in restaurants throughout the region. It is typically served with a side of rosti; a must-include in your <a target="_blank" href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class='lnks'>Switzerland itinerary</a>.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7. Muesli</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/swiss-muesli.webp" alt="swiss-muesli" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Today, the world has accepted muesli as a healthy breakfast meal. However, not many know that it was invented by a Swiss physician named Maximilian Bircher-Benner, who came up with it as an optimally beneficial breakfast for his patients. It is made of oats, seeds, nuts like walnuts and almonds, soaked overnight in yoghurt or milk. It is best enjoyed chilled and topped off with seasonal fruits and honey.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8. Swiss Desserts</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swiss-desserts-and-gelatos.jpg" alt="swiss-desserts-and-gelatos.jpg" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Each canton in Switzerland may have it's favourite local dessert but some are now more popular than others and can be found in most places.<br />
                                            The Bundner Nusstorte from the Graubünden region is a shortbread pastry tart filled with caramel and nuts (most typically walnuts). You will probably see a slice of these being enjoyed along with a coffee or tea.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Basler Lackerli which as the name suggests, hails from the town of Basel. It's a spiced  biscuit made of flat baked dough. It gets its flavour from ingredients like hazelnut, almonds, honey, candied orange peel and kirsch (cherry brandy).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There are also seasonal and festive desserts. In summer, look for raspberry or apricot cakes. The Swiss really enjoy their 'Kaffe und Kuchen' (coffee and cake) and so will you. Come Christmas, keep an eye out for the pretty Spitzbuben biscuits made from a buttery dough with a layer of jam. They come beautifully decorated in various festive shapes.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9. Swiss Chocolate</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swiss-chocolate-must-try-foods-in-switzerland.jpg" alt="swiss-chocolate-must-try-foods-in-switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
