                                            By far, Switzerland's most famous food is chocolate. The average Swiss person consumes over 10 kilograms of chocolate per year, making them the world's biggest chocolate consumers! Known for its high standards of ingredients, smooth creamy texture and striking innovative combinations of flavours, Swiss chocolate is renowned worldwide.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Many brands like Lindt, Sprungli, Toblerone and Cailler are now global names, but there are so many smaller local artisanal chocolatiers that one must try when in Switzerland. My favourites are Max Chocolatier and Laderach in Lucerne.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            If you would like to learn more about chocolate and its making process, you can visit one of the many chocolate factories around the country. The most popular places, though, are the <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/47-lindt-chocolate" class='lnks'>Lindt Chocolate Museum</a> in Zurich and the Nestle-Caillers factory, which you can visit on the Chocolate Train from Montreux and on which you get a sizable <a target="_blank" href="/blog/top-discounts-on-swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>discount with your Swiss Travel Pass</a>.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/swiss-travel-pass.jpg" alt="Swiss Travel Pass">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Travel Pass</p>
                                                <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10. Swiss beverages</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/spiced-red-wine-switzerland.jpg" alt="spiced-red-wine-switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <u>Wines</u>: Switzerland has 15,000 hectares of vineyards, and the locals consume almost all of it (the average consumption is 34 litres per person). Some of the more famous wine growing regions are Ticino, Valais and Vaud (you have likely come across pictures of the UNESCO protected terraced vineyards of Lavaux in this region). These regions are known for their wines like the Pinot Noir, Chasselas (made from the rarer Chasselas grape celebrated for its light notes), Gamay and Chardonnay.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There are tours that show you around the vineyards, where you can meet the families who cultivate them, and of course, sample and purchase the wines. Make sure you buy some to take home with you. Like I mentioned, Swiss wine is not easy to find abroad because almost all of it is consumed locally.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            If you would like to learn more about chocolate and its making process, you can visit one of the many chocolate factories around the country. The most popular places, though, are the <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/47-lindt-chocolate" class='lnks'>Lindt Chocolate Museum</a> in Zurich and the Nestle-Caillers factory, which you can visit on the Chocolate Train from Montreux and on which you get a sizable <a target="_blank" href="/blog/top-discounts-on-swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>discount with your Swiss Travel Pass</a>.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            We recommend trying a glass of wine at the mighty <a target="_blank" href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe</a>, gazing at the snow-covered mountains in your sight.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <u>Beers</u>: Switzerland has over 650 breweries (arguably the most significant number of breweries per capita in the world). Like everything in Switzerland, each region has its own speciality, which you must try. However, among the more popular names are Feldschlosschen, Chopfab Amber,  Vienna Lager and Calanda Lager. Make sure a steaming cup of hot chocolate is on your list while you are on your <a target="_blank" href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class='lnks'>Switzerland trip</a>.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <u>Popular non-alcoholic beverages:</u>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Rivella:  Made of whey ( a by-product of cheese making),  fruit and fruit extract, Rivella comes in many flavours and is probably the most popular drink in Switzerland.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <u>Vivi Kola</u>: Another favourite summer drink made with all-natural ingredients.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <u>Passaia:</u> A soft drink with a refreshing passion fruit flavour that is very popular all over the country.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Well, there you have it. If you have started planning your next trip to Switzerland, think beyond the mountains, trains and activities. Make sure you have some leisure time to sample some or all of these excellent food, drinks and desserts too. As they say in Switzerland, "En Guete".    
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>

                            <%--things-to-do-in-zurich--%>
                            <div class="bd-padding" id="divthings_to_do_in_zurich" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <p>Very often travelers to Switzerland skip to explore Zurich and use it only to arrive or depart from the country. Unfortunately, these travelers have no idea of what they are missing, since they don't take the efforts to experience things to do in Zurich. </p>
                                        <p>Zurich is far from the just the commercial and financial hub that it is made out to be. One can easily spend a few nights exploring the town and its surroundings and still be left wanting for more. </p>
                                        <p>To help you make up your mind on spending time in this city, here are the Top 10 things that you can do on your next visit to Zurich. </p>
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1.	Altstadt (The Old Town)</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/altstadt-old-town-zurich.jpg" alt="altstadt-old-town-zurich" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Spanning both banks of the Limmat is the medieval historic Old Town of Zurich. Hidden in the meandering cobblestone streets, you will find quaint one-of-a-kind stores, restaurants and family run businesses. Alongside this, are some of the jewels of the citys architectural and religious landmarks. The area houses 4 medieval churches including the famed Grossmunster and Fraumuster and Zurich's 17th century Town Hall. </p>
                                        <p>Don't be deceived by all the culture and religion that you see around here. Come sundown, the Old Town is alive and throbbing with nightclubs. In fact, this part of town has the highest concentration of nightclubs where you can relax with your favourite tipple after a day in town. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2.	Swiss National Museum</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swiss-national-museum.jpg" alt="swiss-national-museum" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Swiss National Museum looks more like a fairy tale castle than a museum. It houses Switzerland's largest collection of historical and cultural artefacts which will give you an insight into the country's past. </p>
                                        <p>Marvel at the different eras of history that are masterfully represented. From prehistoric pottery and tools, Medieval Gothic art and wood carvings from the Renaissance period there is an amazing number of captivating exhibits. You can rent an audio guide or even download one on the museums app. Usually, visiting museum is popular thing to do in Zurich in one day.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            Moreover, Swiss Travel Pass holders enjoy free entrance at Swiss National Museum, Zurich - just one of the many 
				
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-ultimate-benefits-of-swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>benefits of Swiss Travel pass</a>.
			
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Remember to visit the souvenir shop to pick up a few exquisite handcrafted souvenirs made by Swiss artisans.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3.	Zurich Zoo</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/zurich-zoo.jpg" alt="zurich-zoo" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Nothing fascinates kids more than a trip to the zoo. Visit the Zurich Zoo spread over 27 hectares and home to over 4000 animals representing over 300 species. </p>
                                        <p>The enclosures are among the best that you can hope to find in any zoo. If you are an animal lover demanding that the animals and the attractions must adhere to the highest ethical standards, then this zoo sets the highest standards. </p>
                                        <p>Make sure to spend some time at the Kaeng Krachan Elephant Park, where you even have the chance to see the elephants taking a dip thanks to the underwater viewing areas.  Walk through the African Savannah, Himalayan heights and South American grasslands, all perfectly created ecosystems to allow the animals to roam freely and fearlessly in the heart of Switzerland.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4.	Uetliberg</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/uetliberg-zurich.jpg" alt="uetliberg-zurich" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Often called Zurich's own little mountain, Uetliberg panoramic point is a must-do thing to do in Zurich on any given day. </p>
                                        <p>Standing 2850 feet above sea level, Uetliberg offers you stunning views of the surrounding lakes, Alps and the city and it is still very easily accessible from the city by train or tram. You can also decide to walk to the peak and back. It is a very gentle climb and will not require any hiking equipment or experience. There is a lookout tower and a restaurant at the top where you can have a nice meal. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Uetliberg is an unmissable attraction that every elated traveller makes it a part of its 
						
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class='lnks'>Switzerland itinerary</a>.
					
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5.	A Cruise on the Limmat</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/cruise-on-limmat-zurich.jpg" alt="cruise-on-limmat-zurich" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Get a different perspective of the city from the water. Just walk to the pier in front of the Swiss National Museum and get into one of the boats that depart every half an hour. You get amazing views of Zurich's Old Town which spans both banks of the river. The cruise will pass by historic guild houses, the Town Hall and the imposing facades of the Grossmunster and the Fraumuster.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6.	Walk the Bahnofstrasse</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/bahnofstrasse-street-zurich-switzerland.jpg" alt="bahnofstrasse-street-zurich-switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The Bahnofstrasse, Zurich's famous shopping street and one of the highest priced real estate in the world, is home to every luxury brand that you can imagine. </p>
                                        <p>Whether you are interested in some retail therapy or just want to window shop, this is one street that you have explore. Other than the luxury brands, there are numerous high street brands, watch shops and restaurants. The street stretches from the main station to the lake and is just 1.4 kms. The street is like a year round attraction, but particularly delightful in December when the Christmas decorations are out. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7.	FIFA Museum</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/fifa-museum-zurich.jpg" alt="fifa-museum-zurich" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Since its opening in 2016, the FIFA museum has quickly become one of the must-do attractions of Zurich. Its modern layout and numerous interactive attractions has made it a favourite for football enthusiasts and others alike. The museum displays the history of football and every one of its world cups since the very first one in 1930.  </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Entry to Fifa Museum, Zurich is free with 
									
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>free with Swiss Travel Pass</a>. 
								
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/swiss-travel-pass.jpg" alt="Swiss Travel Pass">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Travel Pass</p>
                                                <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8.	Dolderbahn</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/dolderbahn-zurich.jpg" alt="dolderbahn-zurich" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Take a ride up in the single cabin rack railway that takes you up to the Dolder recreation area and the amazing Hotel Dolder Grand. The ride takes just under 6 minutes and once on top, gives a lovely view over the surroundings. There are hiking trails, a wave pool and mini golf courses at the top. It is also a winter attraction when it offers ice-skating and ice hockey. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9.	Zurich's Munsters</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/grossmunster-church-zurich.jpg" alt="grossmunster-church-zurich" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>No visit to Zurich is complete without visiting its famous churches. </p>
                                        <p>The Grossmunster: The twin towers of this famous church are one of Zurichs most recognizable landmarks. The church which has been built, rebuilt and renovated several times has stained glass windows, a Romanesque crypt and bronze doors that are all worth seeing. You can even try climbing the 187 steps to the top of one of the towers for a bird's eye-view over the city. </p>
                                        <p>The Fraumunster: Founded in the 9th century this church is particularly noteworthy for its 5 stained glass windows by Marc Chagall. The church is situated on the west bank of the Limmat and can be distinguished by its green steeple. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10.	Zurich Street Parade</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/zurich-street-parade.jpg" alt="zurich-street-parade" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Young, restless, and in love with electronic music? Head to Zurich in August. </p>
                                        <p>Every year, the Zurich parade is a crowd puller that takes place on the second Saturday in August. May reckon the lively Zurich parade as the world's largest electronic parties on the street! The parade draws almost million people who all find some party or the other in the street. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Alpine country hosts many parades throughout the year in different regions. It is one of the most popular 
												
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-things-to-do-in-switzerland" class='lnks'>things to do in Switzerland</a>, other than the regular attractions.
											
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>

                            <%--things-to-do-in-interlaken--%>
                            <div class="bd-padding" id="divthings_to_do_in_interlaken" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <p>Interlaken, which literally means between two lakes, is nestled between Lake Thun and Lake Brienz and is an essential part of every <a target="_blank" href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class='lnks'>Swiss itinerary</a>. The many things to do in Interlaken offers an amazing number of attractions due to its proximity to the lakes, and the formidable Alps that surround it.</p>
                                        <p>Make sure you have slotted at least 3 to 4 nights in Interlaken if you want to cover all the major attractions, which are all easily doable with your <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a></p>
                                        <p>Here are the best things to in Interlaken that Swiss locals would suggest:</p>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">Jungfraujoch</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">Harder Kulm</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">Jetboat Ride</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">Boat rides on the lakes</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">Adventure sports</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">St. Beatus Caves</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">Interlaken town</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">Giessbach Falls</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">Ballenberg Museum</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">Grindelwald First</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1.Jungfraujoch</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch-train.jpg" alt="jungfraujoch-train" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Travel from Interlaken Ost station via 3 trains that take you to the highest railway station of Europe. With your <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch tickets</a>, make your way to the open-air platform to get the best views of the Aletsch glacier surrounded by four thousand metre peaks.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Make sure to visit the Ice Palace with its amazing ice sculptures and try some sledding if you have the time. You can either travel independently with your or take a Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe guided tour.</p>
                                        <p>Travel Tip: Make sure to get out at the viewing stops that the train makes along the way. This helps you to be acclimatized to the rarer air as you go higher. Chewing on a few sour sweets also helps in case you feel a bit giddy headed.  </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2.   Harder Kulm </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/harder-kulm-interlaken.jpg" alt="harder-kulm-interlaken" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Get the best view over Interlaken, its lakes and the imposing trio of the Eiger, Monch and Jungfrau.Often called Interlaken's own mountain, the funicular to the 
				
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/2-harder-kulm" class='lnks'>Harder Kulm</a> can be accessed from Brienzerstrasse just a short walk away from the Interlaken Ost station. 
			
                                        </p>
                                        <p>It takes just 10 minutes to take you to the peak at 1322 metres above sea level. The lovely Panorama restaurant offers a great selection of local cuisine, which you can enjoy whilst enjoying the breathtaking views. </p>
                                        <p>Walk along the Two Lakes Bridge and take a photo with the luckiest cow in Switzerland who stands there mesmerized by the view. Visiting Harder Kulm is one of the best things to do in the Interlaken area.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                            <img src="/images/Mountains/Harder-Kulm-small.webp" alt="">
                                        </div>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                            <p class="bookButton">Harder Kulm</p>
                                            <a href="/mountain-excursion/2-harder-kulm" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3. Jetboat Ride</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jetboat-ride-interlaken.jpg" alt="jetboat-ride-interlaken" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>

                                        </p>
                                        <p>Enjoy 45 minutes of high-speed cruising and 360 degree spins that will have you holding on to your seats. </p>
                                        <p>The ride passes by some beautiful scenery and gives you a close up view of the cascading Giessbach Falls. You will be provided with a splash coat and life jacket so all you need are your courage and your wits! </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4. Boat ride on the Lakes </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/boat-ride-in-interlaken.jpg" alt="boat-ride-in-interlaken" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The best way to see the small surrounding towns around Interlaken would be via a boat cruise. </p>
                                        <p>Both lakes Thun and Brienz have regularly departing boats that take you on a leisurely journey of the surrounding areas. </p>
                                        <p>Get off in Thun and walk through the medieval town and visit the lakeside castle, visit Ringgenberg and take a dip in its very own little Burgseeli and walk along the wooded areas.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5. Adventure Sports</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/adventure-in-interlaken.jpg" alt="adventure-in-interlaken" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Interlaken is a mecca for adventure sports enthusiasts. There is a plethora of activities to do in Interlaken, and you will be sure to find something that caters to your level of skill and thrill. </p>
                                        <p>Whether your preference is the sky or the water, you will have plenty to choose from. </p>
                                        <p>White water rafting, canyoning, hang-gliding, paragliding and skydiving are some of the activities that you can opt for. </p>
                                        <p>A day reserved for the thrill of sport is sure to be one of the highlights of your stay in Interlaken.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6. St. Beatus Caves  </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/st-beatus-cave-interlaken.jpg" alt="st-beatus-cave-interlaken" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Walk through a kilometer of well-lit pathways through this geological site. Walk into the depths of the mountain and discover an ethereal world of stalactites and stalagmites formed by nature millions of years ago. </p>
                                        <p>Legend has it that a dragon took residence in these caves whilst being pursued by the 6th century monk St Beat. </p>
                                        <p>Nevertheless, dragon or not, the caves and the cascading waterfalls around it are definitely worth a visit. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            You can take a bus, which you can travel for 
								
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>free with Swiss Pass</a>, from Interlaken and then walk a short way to the caves or take a boat and climb your way up if you feel more energetic.
							
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7. Interlaken Town </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/interlaken-town.jpg" alt="interlaken-town" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The town of Interlaken is an attraction in itself. Spend some time walking the beautiful Hoheweg, the main street that links Interlaken East and West stations and abounds with watch, jewelry and souvenir shops and plenty of cafes and restaurants that suit any taste and budget. </p>
                                        <p>Walk through the Hohematte, a green centre of town spread over 14 hectares of land. The green park is also a favorite spot for the landing of hang gliders and para gliders. </p>
                                        <p>Visit the Garden of Friendship, which is the first Japanese garden in Switzerland. </p>
                                        <p>If you feel it's your lucky night, visit the Casino Kursaal and try your hand at table games, or blackjack - one of the most exciting things to do at night in Interlaken. Wish you luck! </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8. Giessbach Falls  </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/giessbach-falls-swisstours.jpg" alt="giessbach-falls-swisstours" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Giessbach falls is another attraction that will have you gasping at its beauty. Take a short boat cruise and then a funicular up to the Grand Hotel Giessbach to get a full view of these falls. </p>
                                        <p>To see the falls up close you can even hike all the way. Some sections even take you behind the waterfalls where you can actually feel the spray and hear the roar of the falls as they thunder downward.  </p>
                                        <p>If your kids are not up to the hike, there is also a small playground nearby. Instead of taking the funicular down, you can also walk back so that you get a good view of the falls from a lower level.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9. Ballenberg Museum</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/ballenberg-museum-interlaken.jpg" alt="ballenberg-museum-interlaken" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>A unique living history museum, the Swiss Open Air Ballenberg museum is a must visit for adults and children alike - it's a thing to do in Interlaken with family. </p>
                                        <p>The museum started in 1978, with just 16 characteristic Swiss buildings. Today the museum stands over 66 hectares and houses authentic Swiss bake houses, barns, shops and residences most with their original equipment and amenities. </p>
                                        <p>Since almost the last 50 years any old structures that are to be destroyed due to development are dismantled stone by stone or brick by brick and brought to the museum to be recreated.  </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The museum offers a unique insight into Swiss culture, traditions and rural ways of life. Added bonus: It is free with the Swiss Travel Pass, one of the many 
											
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-ultimate-benefits-of-swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>benefits of Swiss Travel Pass</a>.
										
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10.	Grindelwald First</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/grindelwald-first.jpg" alt="grindelwald-first" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Last but definitely not the least is a thing to do in Interlaken in one day trip by visiting the Alpine village of Grindelwald, which can be accessed via train in just 35 minutes from Interlaken. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Once in Grindelwald, spend some time exploring the little village and then head off for some excitement to the 
												
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class='lnks'>Grindelwald First</a>. 
											
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Reach the peak at 2166m above sea level and take in the amazing views. Then be prepared for the most exciting descent down any mountain! </p>
                                        <p>Take the First Glider or the First Flyer (zip line) to Schreckfeld, then continue downwards by mountain cart and finally trottibike back down to the village. </p>
                                        <p>No other mountain descent is as thrilling as this one. </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Grindelwald-First-medium3.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Grindelwald First</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <p>One has to visit Lucerne to find out why it is one of the most popular places to visit, not just in Switzerland, but also in Europe. </p>
                                        <p>Among the many things to do in Lucerne, you can simply begin with sitting on a charming lake and surrounded by mountains Lucerne - the stuff that sweet dreams are made off. Its centralized location, well-preserved Old Town, and the iconic Chapel Bridge are just some of the things that add to the charm of this gateway to Central Switzerland.    </p>
                                        <p>Here are the best 10 things to do in Lucerne:</p>

                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1.	Mt Pilatus</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">

                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>A visit to the Dragon Mountain will leave you mesmerised. The journey to the mountain is as exciting as the peak itself. </p>
                                        <p>In summer, you can take the famed Golden Roundtrip which will take you by boat from Lucerne to Alpnachstad. From here, you can ascend by the world's steepest cogwheel train with a maximum gradient of 48 degrees. </p>
                                        <p>Then make your way down by the aerial gondola. You can also stop at a mid-point to enjoy Switzerland's longest summer toboggan run and let the kids hone their balancing skills in the rope park harnessed by safety nets.  </p>
                                        <p>Medieval legend has it that this mountain was inhabited by dragons with healing powers. Notwithstanding legend and folklore, this mountain excursion remains one of the highlights of central Switzerland. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Remember, that you stand to get an almost 50% discount on the excursion If you hold the 
			
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a>. 
		
                                        </p>

                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mount Pilatus</p>

                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2.	Swiss Museum of Transport</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swiss-museum-of-transport-in-lucerne.jpg" alt="swiss-museum-of-transport-in-lucerne" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A day of fun and edutainment for the family awaits you on your 
				
                            <a target="_blank" href="https://www.swisstours.com/" class='lnks'>Swiss tour</a>. Do not be fooled by its name, this museum is the most visited museum in Switzerland and deserves to be. 
			
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Other than showcasing the history of transport by road, rail, water, air and space, this museum houses so much more.  </p>
                                        <p>It has the country's largest cinema screen which showcases some amazing documentaries. </p>
                                        <p>There is a planetarium where you can relax and watch shows on its huge dome and the most exciting for adults and kids alike, is the Swiss Chocolate Adventure - an interactive attraction, which showcases the history and production of chocolate. </p>
                                        <p>Other than this, there are plenty of virtual reality attractions that are really fascinating. Do not miss this one for sure! </p>
                                        <p>
                                            If you are holding a 
				
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-ultimate-benefits-of-swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Pass benefit</a> from it's discounts on Swiss Museum of Transport.
