                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3.	Chapel Bridge</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/chapel-bridge.jpg" alt="chapel-bridge" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Your 
					
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class='lnks'>Switzerland itinerary</a> is incomplete is you miss - Chapel Bridge. This landmark of Lucerne was built in the 14th century and is considered to be Europe's oldest covered bridge. 


				
                                        </p>
                                        <p>It crosses the Reuss from the New Town on the Southbank to the Old Town. </p>
                                        <p>Along the 200 metres, you can see paintings depicting Lucerne's history. These triangular paintings in the ceiling pediments were introduced in the 17th century. </p>
                                        <p>Some of them were fully destroyed in a fire in 1993 but you can still see many of them.  </p>
                                        <p>The octagonal water tower was part of the city's fortification and over the years has been used as an archive, torture chamber and treasury.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4.	The Lion Monument</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/lion-monument-in-lucerne.jpg" alt="lion-monument-in-lucerne" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>This sculpture of a dying lion is carved into a former sandstone quarry. </p>
                                        <p>The lion represents the Swiss soldiers who died while trying to protect Louis XVI during the French Revolution in 1792.  </p>
                                        <p>The sculpture is symbolically rich and shows a shattered shield with the symbol of French Royalty and another intact shield with the Swiss coat of arms.  </p>
                                        <p>Mark Twain had called the monument the saddest and most moving piece of rock in the world.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5.	Hofkirche St. Leodegar</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/hofkirche-st-leodegar.jpg" alt="hofkirche-st-leodegar" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Lucerne's parish church founded in the 8th century was destroyed during the 30 year war in 1633 leaving only its 2 towers with their Romanesque elements, St Mary's altar and a few other objects intact. </p>
                                        <p>Worth seeing are the exceptionally carved choir stalls, ornate wooden pews and the imposing organ which weighs 30 tons and has 7374 pipes making it one of the largest organ in Europe.</p>
                                        <p>The church is located on a little hill overlooking the Old Town of Lucerne.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6.	Cruise on the Lake  </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/boat-cruise-on-lake-lucerne.jpg" alt="boat-cruise-on-lake-lucerne" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>After a day in the surrounding Alps, head off for a cruise on the Lake. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There are various types of cruises that you can take. Some of them are also free with your 
								
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>free with your Swiss Travel Pass</a>. 
							
                                        </p>
                                        <p>If you are looking for something to spend your evening, a good choice would be a Lake Lucerne Dinner Cruise. </p>
                                        <p>The cruise normally leaves the pier at around 7.30 pm and gets back at 9.00 pm after you have had a sumptuous meal while gazing at the amazing scenery that you pass by. </p>
                                        <p>There are also smaller more exclusive yachts like the Saphir which operate at regular intervals in the day and give you an amazing perspective of Lucerne from the water.  </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Including a boat ride is one of the unmissable 
								
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-things-to-do-in-switzerland" class='lnks'>things to do in Switzerland</a>.
							
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7.	 Mt Titlis </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/mount-titlis-best-thing-to-do-in-lucerne.jpg" alt="mount-titlis-best-thing-to-do-in-lucerne" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Though 
									
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class='lnks'>Mount Titlis</a> is to be done from Engelberg, almost every traveller would rather stay and visit it from Lucerne. 
								
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Ascend by the world's first revolving cable car and get blown away by the breath-taking 360 degree panorama as you make your way to the peak at 10,000 feet above sea level. </p>
                                        <p>Once on top there is literally a "mountain" of things to do. Ride the Ice Flyer chairlift and visit the Glacier Park where you can indulge in some snow fun with tubing or sledding, walk into the Glacier Cave and challenge your nerves and walk along the Titlis Cliff Walk the spectacular suspension bridge. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Don't forget to apply your 
									
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/top-discounts-on-swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass discount</a>. 
								
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/titlis-rotair.jpg?ver=1" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mt Titlis</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8.	Old City Wall ( Musegg Wall) </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/musegg-wall.jpg" alt="musegg-wall" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The water tower, the Chapel Bridge and the Musegg Wall are the dominant landmarks that define the historic townscape of Lucerne. </p>
                                        <p>The Musegg Wall and its nine towers are part of Lucerne's historic fortifications and once upon a time, it stood as a symbol of Power. </p>
                                        <p>Today, you can visit and walk along the wall, part of which is original. </p>
                                        <p>4 of the 9 towers are open to the public and give an amazing birds eye view of Lucerne. </p>
                                        <p>One of them, the Zyt Tower also has the oldest city clock in Lucerne which, in keeping with its age, is allowed to chime one minute ahead all the rest of the city clocks. </p>
                                        <p>While visiting the Musegg wall and towers one can also take some time to visit the Hinter Musegg farm and spend some time there. </p>
                                        <p>Children will be particularly fascinated and can see various animals like alpacas and mini pigs and also learn about farm life and animal husbandry.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9.	Stanserhorn</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/stanserhorn.jpg" alt="stanserhorn" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/13-stanserhorn" class='lnks'>Stanserhorn</a> will leave you wondering which century you live in. Ride the old time funicular from Stans to Kalti - this funicular has been chugging up since 1893 and was once considered the longest funicular.
										
                                        </p>
                                        <p>From there, you switch to the CabriO , the world's first double decker ‘roofless' cable car. Feel the wind in your hair and marvel at the amazing scenery as you ride up to the Stanserhorn at 1850 metres above sea level. Apart from the stunning views and experience riding up, the best part is that this amazing excursion can be experienced free of cost if you have a Swiss Travel Pass.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10.	Mt Rigi</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/rigi-bahn.jpg" alt="rigi-bahn" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>One more excursion, which is free with your Swiss Travel Pass, Mt Rigi can be reached from Vitznau or Arth Goldau from where you take the cogwheel train to Rigi Kulm. Infact the Vitznau - Rigi Kulm railway has been running since 1871 which makes it Europe's first mountain railway.  </p>
                                        <p>Mt. Rigi is a very popular summer and winter attraction and offers miles of hiking, skiing and tobogganing depending on the weather. In essence, it's a thing to do in Lucerne in all seasons. </p>
                                        <p>So start packing, purchase the super handy Swiss Travel Pass and head off to Central Switzerland to experience all the "firsts" - the revolving cable car, open double decker cable car, Europe's first mountain railway and the elegant old lady who is allowed to chime one minute prior to all her peers! </p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>

                            <%--10-things-to-do-in-switzerland-in-summer--%>
                            <div class="bd-padding" id="div10_things_to_do_in_switzerland_in_summer" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">

                                        <p>
                                            Switzerland is an all-year-round destination with every season offering a different palette of activities. Having said that, there are certain 
		
                            <a target="_blank" href="/blog/10-things-to-do-in-switzerland-in-summer" class='lnks'>things to in Switzerland in summer</a>, which can only be enjoyed at to the hilt in the sunny climate. 
	
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The summers are stunningly colourful with green valleys full of yellow and white flowers, clear blue skies, emerald lakes and snow-capped peaks (yes, even in summer). </p>
                                        <p>There's influx of tourists in the months of May, June, and July to make the most of their summer travel in Switzerland, as many believe the alpine country is most vibrant in this season.</p>
                                        <p>Keeping in mind that you would love to cover some mountain trips, lakesides, castles and the best choice of towns, here are few must-see-and-do activities that can help you plan your summer holiday in Switzerland.</p>

                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1. Matterhorn Glacier Paradise - Zermatt</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/matterhorn-in-july.jpg" alt="matterhorn-in-july">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>One of the main tourist attractions of Switzerland is the Matterhorn. Located in Zermatt, this one mountain has become one of the most recognisable symbols of the country. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There are various points from which one can try to get the best views of this mountain and one such is the 
			
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</a>. 
		
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Reach 
			
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class='lnks'>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</a> via cable car. It offers guaranteed snow throughout the year. The view of the pyramid shaped peak of the Matterhorn reveals itself in all its majestic glory and tells you exactly why it is the most photographed mountain in the world. 
		
                                        </p>
                                        <p>You can also marvel at a panorama of numerous other 4000-metre high peaks.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            If your 
			
                            <a target="_blank" href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class='lnks'>Switzerland itinerary</a> permits, try to spend at least a couple of nights in Zermatt. This charmingly Swiss village is car free and filled with quaint chalets, a buzzing village centre and numerous hotels and apartments for every budget. 
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Matterhorn-Glacier-Paradise-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2. Jungfraujoch - Interlaken</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfrau-in-may.jpg" alt="jungfrau-in-may" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            No traveller to Switzerland can resist a stay in Interlaken and a trip to the 
				
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class='lnks'>Jungfraujoch-Top of Europe</a>, the most popular excursion in the Bernese Oberland. 
			
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The excursion begins with a train journey from Interlaken to the mountain resort of Grindelwald.</p>
                                        <p>Once there, you'll board the cogwheel train for a spectacular ride to the Europe's highest railway station at 3454 metres via Kleine Scheidegg.</p>
                                        <p>The Great Altesch Glacier begins at Jungfraujoch and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Once at the peak, take time to check out the attractions like the Ice Palace, Ski & Snowboard Park, the Sphinx observation terrace and the various restaurants.  </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Like most peaks, you will get a discount on the ticket if you hold a 
				
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Pass</a>. Jungfrau is one of the more expensive mountains, so holding the Swiss Travel Pass really helps, especially since your kids under 16 years of age will travel free if you hold the pass.
			
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Junfraujoch is one of the most popular things to do in Switzerland in summer as it guarantees snow at the peak even during this time of the year.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3. Mt. Pilatus - Lake Lucerne Region</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/mount-pilatus-cog-wheel-train.jpg" alt="mount-pilatus-cog-wheel-train" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Central Switzerland has a lot of tempting peaks but the Dragon Mountain Pilatus is unique.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            The peak rests right in the city and besides Lake Lucerne. If you are travelling in summer, you may get to experience the Golden Round Trip of 
					
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class='lnks'>Mt. Pilatus</a>.
				
                                        </p>
                                        <p>This includes a trip by Boat on Lake Lucerne up to Alpnachstad. After the scenic boat ride, you can take the world's steepest cogwheel railway from Alpnachstad to the summit and for your descent, choose the Aeriel Cable way to Kriens. </p>
                                        <p>Spend some time at the peak and have a meal at one the restaurants with an amazing panoramic view of the surrounding Alps.</p>
                                        <p>On your way down, you can also stop at Frakmuntegg to try out the longest toboggan run and then try the Dragon Glider from Frakmuntegg to Drachenalp which will give you an amazing aerial view of the forests below.</p>
                                        <p>If you still have some time, you can spend the evening discovering the lakeside town of Lucerne with its iconic symbols of the Lion Monument and the Chapel Bridge.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Mount-Pilatus-medium2.webp" alt="Mount Pilatus">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mount Pilatus</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4. Zurich</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/zoo-in-zurich.jpg" alt="zoo-in-zurich" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Zurich is often overlooked in itineraries or used just as an entry or exit point. Zurich is a vibrant city with lots to offer. </p>
                                        <p>Spend a night or two in Zurich and discover its amazing Old Town with narrow cobbled streets, small family run cafes, artisan shops and churches. </p>
                                        <p>Spend time walking along the lake side and the Bahnofstrasse, Zurich's main shopping street, with outlets of every famous watch, jewellery and fashion label that you can think of. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Zurich has amazing museums dedicated to art, natural history, trams, money and even football. Everyone likes a zoo and Zurich's zoo is not to be missed.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>In the evening, head for Uetliberg- a local mountain, which will give you panoramic views of the city.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            Some of the museums are included in your 
						
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a> cost and some offer reduction with pass.
					
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5. Rhine Falls - Schaffhausen</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/rhine-falls-near-zurich.jpg" alt="rhine-falls-near-zurich" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>If you are staying in Zurich or even in Lucerne, you can make a day trip to the Rhine Falls - the biggest waterfalls in Europe. </p>
                                        <p>You can reach the falls within an hour with a train from Zurich (the nearest station to the falls is Schloss laufen am Rheinfall). </p>
                                        <p>It is one of the best things to do in Switzerland in May and July since the glaciers melt during this time and the density of water peaks.</p>
                                        <p>You can also take a boat trip which takes you closer to the falls and feel the icy refreshing splash of the water. The cost of the boat trips vary depending on their duration (from CHF 8 to CHF 20). </p>
                                        <p>
                                            One of the many 
							
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>benefits of Swiss Pass</a> is that the ride up to Rhine Falls is included in the pass cost.
						
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6. Jet boat ride - Interlaken</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jetboat-ride-in-switzerland.jpg" alt="jetboat-ride-in-switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>



                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Interlaken, which means between two lakes, is set between Lake Thun and Lake Brienz. These beautifully serene lakes offer all kinds of cruises.</p>
                                        <p>You can just hop on to a public transport boat and explore various lakeside villages, or take an evening cruise that may also have dinner included.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            The best, however, is an adrenaline pumping 
								
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/19-jetboat-interlaken" class='lnks'>Jetboat ride</a> on Lake Brienz. This exhilarating ride gives you 45 minutes of full  360-degree spins, twists and turns during which it will cover an approximately 30 km route. 
							
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The ride takes you close to the imposing Giessbach Falls, which add a bit of adrenaline to a scenic sightseeing trip.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            On the same day, you can also cover an excursion to 
								
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/2-harder-kulm" class='lnks'>Harden Kulm</a>. It's just a small walk from Interlaken Ost train station to the Harder Railway Valley Station.
							
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The modern funicular takes you to the summit in just 10 minutes. You may enjoy your lunch/dinner at the viewing platform, which gives you the bird's eye view of the Jungfrau Region and the scenic city of Interlaken!  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7. Chateau de Chillon, Montreux </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/chillion-castle-switzerland.jpg" alt="chillion-castle-switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Switzerland has numerous castles but none as famous as the Chateaux De Chillon. This castle, beautifully perched on an outcrop on lake Geneva is Switzerland's most visited historical monument attracting over 4,00,000 guests per year. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Lord Byron was so fascinated by the castle he penned the poem The Prisoner of Chillon. He also carved his name on one of the pillars of the castle!
The castle can take almost half a day to cover and can be done either as an independent or a guided tour. Make sure you take the audio guide so that you learn about the 14th century paintings, subterranean vaults and parade halls.  
                                        </p>
                                        <p>In case you are not staying in Montreux, you can also do this as a day trip from Lausanne or Geneva.</p>
                                        <p>Tip: The entrance to the castle is free for holders of the Swiss Travel Pass holders.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8. Gstaad</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/gstaad-in-summer.jpg" alt="gstaad-in-summer" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Gstaad is pure paradise. It is a resort that attracts the rich and famous to either holiday or even settle down there. </p>
                                        <p>Gstaad offers a beautiful village centre with numerous boutiques, an amazing range of hotels to suit all budgets and the most stunning Alpine surrounding.</p>
                                        <p>It is a year-round resort famous for skiing in the winter, and many prefer walking/hiking as a thing to do in Switzerland in summer.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            One of the main attractions around Gstaad is the 
										
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/4-glacier-3000" class='lnks'>Glacier 3000</a>, a summit covered in snow all year round. You can get to the Glacier 3000 by taking a short bus ride from Gstaad (bus stop just outside the station) to Col Du Pillon and then a cable car from there to the peak.
									
                                        </p>
                                        <p>It is known for the special attractions like Peak Walk by Tissot - the world's first suspension footbridge spanning two summits along with an Alpine Coaster - the highest bobsleigh track, Husky dog sled rides & the snow bus.   </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Including Gstaad in your 
										
                            <a target="_blank" href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class='lnks'>Switzerland tour package</a>, will give you an ultimate feel of vacationing in the Swiss country, and of course, because summer is among the best time to visit Switzerland.
									
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9. Glacier express </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/passage-brusio-helicidal-viaduct-bernina-red-train.jpg" alt="passage-brusio-helicidal-viaduct-bernina-red-train" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Switzerland is famous for its trains, which run with clockwork precision just like their watches. The most famous of these trains is the Glacier Express also lovingly called the World's Slowest Express Train. </p>
                                        <p>This train connects the two famous mountain resort towns of Zermatt and St Moritz and traverses the amazing landscape between the two.</p>
                                        <p>The journey from one town to the other takes just under 8 hours passing through 91 tunnels and over 291 bridges.</p>
                                        <p>The huge panoramic glass windows ensure that you get the unobstructed views of the beautiful landscapes and make you feel one with nature.</p>
                                        <p>This one is not to be missed.</p>
                                        <p>If your program does not allow you to fit in a full day on the train, you can also do a part of the journey from Zermatt to Chur and then continue to Zurich from there.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: The journey on Glacier express is included in your 
											
                            <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a> but a separate seat reservation is mandatory at an additional cost.
										
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/glacier-express-medium1.webp?v=12" alt="Glacier Express">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Glacier Express</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/43-glacier-express" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10. Lugano</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swiss-miniatur-summer.jpg" alt="swiss-miniatur" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The largest town in the Italian-speaking canton of Ticino, Lugano offers all the advantages of a world-class city with its Mediterranean flair.</p>
                                        <p>Due to its geographic position at the Southern tip of the country bordering Italy, Lugano offers a completely different look and feel with its warmer climate and palm tree lined lakeside promenade.</p>
                                        <p>Monte Bre and San Salvatore, the two mountains closest to Lugano offer stunning views of the town. Morcote and the fishing village of Gandria can be visited via boat.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            The 
												
                            <a target="_blank" href="/mountain-excursion/14-swiss-miniatur" class='lnks'>Swiss Miniatur</a> is Melide is a perfect place to spend time with the family.
											
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="11">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">BONUS!</h2>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="12">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">11. Shopping</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/shopping-in-switzerland.jpg" alt="shopping-in-switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Everyone likes a good bargain! After you have had your fill of all that nature has to offer, head off to Foxtown in Mendrisio (20 minutes from Lugano). Foxtown Factory Stores has 160 outlets that offer 30 to 70 percent discounts on branded goods all year round. The complex has bars, restaurants and even a casino so make sure its your lucky day! </p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>

                            <%--11-things-to-do-in-zermatt--%>
                            <div class="bd-padding" id="div11_things_to_do_in_zermatt" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title noneIMP">Introduction</h2>

                                        <p>A trip to Switzerland can never be complete without visiting the foothills of Matterhorn and experiencing all the things to do in Zermatt. </p>
                                        <p>Zermatt is a typical Swiss town. Its winding streets filled with all kinds of small and big historical chalets, all levels of hotels and innumerable cafes, restaurants, sportswear and souvenir shops are buzzing with activity all year round. </p>
                                        <p>The car free resort is one of the most visited places in the country and destination for all kinds of winter sports, and of course skiing.</p>
                                        <p>However, there are many attractions for non-skiers in Zermatt. Let's go through all of them.</p>
                                        <p>
                                            Top Things to do at Zermatt 
		
                            <br />
                                            1. Matterhorn Glacier Paradise 
		
                            <br />
                                            2. Gornergrat 
		
                            <br />
                                            3. Zermatt Village Walk
		
                            <br />
                                            4. Gorner Gorge
		
                            <br />
                                            5. Europabrucke
		
                            <br />
                                            6. Zermatt by bike
		
                            <br />
                                            7. Sunnegga
		
                            <br />
                                            8. Paragliding
		
                            <br />
                                            9. Helicopter flights
		
                            <br />
                                            10. Five lake walk tour
		
                            <br />
                                            11. Forest fun park
	
                                        </p>
                                    </li>

                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1.Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/matterhorn-glacier-paradise-in-zermatt.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The first thing one wants to do in Zermatt is get the best views of the Matterhorn. </p>
                                        <p>Head off to the highest cable car station in Europe (3883 metres) for just that. </p>
                                        <p>Get amazing views of the famous triangular peak said to be the inspiration behind the triangular shape of the famous Swiss Toblerone chocolate. </p>
                                        <p>The summit lift takes you to the viewing platform with a 360º panoramic view of 38 Alpine peaks. Then visit the world's highest glacier palace with its amazing ice sculptures. </p>
                                        <p>There are various restaurants in which you can enjoy a meal while looking out at the icy panorama outside.  </p>
                                        <p>If you are travelling with the Swiss Travel Pass, you get get a discount on the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise excursion.   </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Matterhorn-Glacier-Paradise-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2.Gornergrat</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/gornergrat-matterhorn.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Europe's first electric and highest open air cog railway will take you on an unforgettable 40 minute journey to the top station at 3100 metres passing over bridges, forests, tunnels and stunning views. </p>
                                        <p>On a clear day you get a view of twenty nine 4000 metre peaks including the Matterhorn, Breithorn, Monte Rosa and if lucky, even Mont Blanc which is Europe's highest mountain at 4810 metres.  </p>
                                        <p>There are umpteen hiking trails of all levels that originate from here. One can even decide to walk a part of the way down and then once again hop to the train for the remainder of the journey.  </p>
                                        <p>Unique activities like sunrise/sunset visits or dining under the stars are also possible. </p>
                                        <p>The trains leave from a small station opposite Zermatt's main train station. </p>
                                        <p>Gornergrat is one of the best things to do in Zermatt in summer.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3.Zermatt Village Walk </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/zermatt-village-switzerland.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Walk on your own through this car free village. Start at the buzzing and popular station area and cover the town.  </p>
                                        <p>Don't miss Hinterdorf with its original old chalets, barns and stables that date back to the 16th century. These ancient structures have roofs made of stone slabs to withstand the weight of the snow. </p>
                                        <p>Zermatt is one of the very few places where you can see such well-preserved ancient buildings.  </p>
                                        <p>See the Church Square and the nearby Matterhorn Museum. The museum showcases life in the mountains and also a history of climbing which is so closely tied to the town.  </p>
                                        <p>A walk around town can take anything from one hour to half a day depending on what you want to cover.  </p>
                                        <p>Recommended direction - Bahnhofplatz (by station) - Obere Matten sports field - Zum Steg bridge - Hinterdorf - Kirchplatz (church square) - Kirchbrücke bridge - Kirchplatz - up the road by GramPi's - Englischer Viertel ("English quarter") - Bodmenstrasse - Bahnhofplatz.</p>
                                        <p>Walking around old towns and in villages is a typical thing to do in Switzerland.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4.Gorner Gorge</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/gorner-gorge-switzerland.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Different Rock formations formed over thousands of years due to the incessant and fast running waters of the Gornervispe have created this stunning natural spectacle. There are wooden pathways all along the gorge to help get as close to nature as possible. </p>
                                        <p>You can even hear the gurgling sound of water coming behind rocks as you walk. </p>
                                        <p>Reaching the gorge would take a roughly 20 to 30 minute walk from the main station.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5.	Europabrucke</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/europabrucke-matterhorn.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>If you have some time to spare and are fit enough to do it, hike to the Europabrucke. Though technically not in Zermatt, this is an activity that you can do from here. </p>
                                        <p>Take a train to Randa (17 minutes) to start the hike and reach the world's longest hanging suspension bridge. </p>
                                        <p>The 494 metre suspension bridge also known as the Charles Kuonen Suspension Bridge hangs 85 metres over the Grabengufer ravine.  </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6.	Zermatt by bike</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/zermatt-by-bike.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>If you have had enough of walking, grab a bike and start exploring the town. </p>
                                        <p>Since cycles can be taken on to the cable cars, it would be nice to go up a mountain by cable car and come down cycling via dedicated cycling paths which will give you the option of coming at your own pace and the time to stop and enjoy the scenery. </p>
                                        <p>Bikes are easily available for rent. These cycles can be taken on rent from 1 to 7 days. </p>
                                        <p>What's more…..you get discount with Swiss Travel Pass. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7.	Sunnegga</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/sunnegga.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>The Sunnegga-Rothorn valley station is a comfortable 10 minute walk away from Zermatt train station. </p>
                                        <p>Just hop on to the funicular which takes you to the Sunnegga sun terrace at 2289 metres in under 5 minutes. This place is a famous picnic spot in the summer and very popular with families. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            At the Wolli Adventure Park you can have a dip in the lake and the kids can cross it on secured rafts. There are plenty of nice picnic and barbeque spots as well. 

                                        </p>
                                        <p>You can also rent a bike for the return. Sunnegga offers amazing views of the Matterhorn and tons of hiking and walking trails. Remember to watch out for its local residents, the Marmots. </p>
                                        <p>If lucky, you might just get to see them when they peek out of their burrows. As always, make sure you have a valid Swiss Travel Pass the day you want to go up to the Sunnegga so that you can avail of the special pass holder discount. </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Sunnegga-Matterhorn-medium3.webp?v=12" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Sunnegga</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/25-Sunnegga" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8.	Paragliding</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/paragliding-in-zermatt.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Zermatt is not just for skiing. It also offers paragliding for the adventure enthusiasts. </p>
                                        <p>Imagine a birds eye view of the town and its surroundings as you take off from one of the mountains (Rothorn, Gornergrat or Klein Matterhorn) with a professional Swiss tandem pilot.  </p>
                                        <p>This thing to do at Zermatt is available all year round depending on weather conditions. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9.	Helicopter Flights</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/helicopter-ride-zermatt.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Nothing can compare to an aerial view of the beautiful Swiss Alps. </p>
                                        <p>Fly past some of the famous peaks. See the mighty peak of the Matterhorn as it looms over the Zermatt, which looks like a tiny speck nestled at its foothills. </p>
                                        <p>Of course, this is one of the more expensive activities but one that can make your holiday truly special. </p>
                                        <p>These rides are weather dependent and have an option of 20, 30 or 40 minutes. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="11">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10.	Five Lake Walk Tour</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/five-lake-walk-tour-matterhorn.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <span></span>
                                        <p>This is amongst the most famous hikes in Zermatt. </p>
                                        <p>The path leads you past the 5 mountain lakes of Stellisee, Grindjisee, Grünsee, Moosjisee and Leisee. </p>
                                        <p>Each of the lakes offers its own charm and stunning scenery. </p>
                                        <p>Grab the perfect pictures of the reflection of the Matterhorn as you will see it in the Stellisee, Grindjisee and Leisee. </p>
                                        <p>This is not a difficult hike and can also be done by kids of over 6 years </p>
                                        <p>It may take around 2.5 hours to complete but that would depend on your speed and the stops that you make along the way. </p>
                                        <p>There are refreshment centres, picnic spots along the way and a children's playground at the Leisee. Route maps and GPS tracking are also available. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A definite thing to do in Zermatt for non-skiers. 
 
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="12">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">11.	Forest Fun Park</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/forest-fun-park-zermatt-switzerland.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                        <p>
                                            <span></span>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>This a fun filled activity place for the full family. </p>
                                        <p>The Forest Fun Park is home to the longest kids adventure course in Switzerland. </p>
                                        <p>The park allows you to test your skills on the high ropes and zip lines. </p>
                                        <p>There are various courses that start from the Green Course for beginners and first time visitors all the way to the Black Course for experienced rope course adventurers to test their strength and balancing skills.  </p>
                                        <p>All in all, the quaint village of Zermatt is definitely worth a visit to soak in typical Swiss life at its leisurely best! </p>
                                        <p>You can always visit Zermatt as a day trip from central Switzerland if you do not want to stay overnight. </p>
                                    </li>

                            <%--is_swiss_travel_pass_worth_it--%>
                            <div class="bd-padding" id="divis_swiss_travel_pass_worth_it" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <p>
                                            [Answered] Is Swiss Travel Pass worth it? 
		
                            <br />
                                            In-depth analysis by Swiss Travel Expert

	
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            If you have already done your fair bit of research for Switzerland, you have now come across the words 
		
                            <a target='_blank' href='/swiss-travel-pass' class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a> far too many times. So what is this and why are 90% of tourists opting for this famous pass?
	
                                        </p>
                                        <p>So, is Swiss Travel Pass worth it? </p>
                                        <p>Yes!</p>
                                        <p>The Swiss Travel Pass is not just a piece of paper but rather your key to every door in Switzerland. This key of course doesn't come cheap, but the best things in the world come at a cost. Let's find out if opting for a Swiss Travel Pass is worth your dime.  </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/swiss-travel-pass.jpg" alt="Swiss Travel Pass">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Travel Pass</p>
                                                <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1. It is not just a rail pass</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swiss-pass-is-not-just-a-rail-pass.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Your Swiss Pass is valid on all public modes of transport in Switzerland i.e. buses, boats, trains and trams. </p>
                                        <p>That means once you have the pass, you don't pay for any travel within this beautiful country. </p>
                                        <p>What's more? There is no limit to the number of times you can travel within the set number of days chosen (3, 4, 8 or 15 days). </p>
                                        <p>
                                            As if that wasn't enough, you get massive discounts on the mountain cable and trains so you never end up paying full price for these. 
Still not convinced? You have free entry to 500 museums in Switzerland. Most of the included museum entries cost between CHF5 and CHF10 without the pass, although a few are closer to CHF20. 
                                        </p>
                                        <p>All in all this is a great deal according to us. Continue reading if you're still not persuaded. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2.	Free travel for your child under 16 years</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swisspass-free-travel-for-children.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>If you're travelling with family and have children under 16 years, taking the Swiss Travel Pass is worth it as it ensures your children travel free on the public transport within Switzerland. </p>
                                        <p>The children get their very own "Family Card" which is a zero value Swiss Pass issued to you when you book your paid adult Swiss Travel Pass.</p>
                                        <p>Once you have a family card, your kids under 16 years also go free on 90% of the Mountain Excursions. This in itself is a super sweet deal for your family and you. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3.	Discount for youth between 16 to 26 years</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swiss-rail-pass-discount-for-youth.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>It's okay if your child missed the 16-year cut off for a free family pass. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The 
					
                            <a target='_blank' href='/swiss-travel-pass' class='lnks'>Swiss Pass</a> offers a youth aged 16 to 26 years a 15% discount on the Adult Swiss Travel Pass. The other benefits though, are the same as an adult Swiss Travel Pass. 
				
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4.	Flexi or Continuous Days Option</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/swiss-rail-pass-flexi-or-continuous-option.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Why 
						
                            <a target='_blank' href='/blog/is-swiss-travel-pass-worth-it' class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass is worth it</a> is because it doesn't tie you down to consecutive days travel. 
					
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Let's suppose you intend to travel outside your base in Switzerland only for 4 out of the 8 days, you can benefit from the Flexi Pass option. </p>
                                        <p>This option is valid on 3, 4, 8 or 15 freely selectable days within one month rather than 3,4,8 or 15 consecutive days offered in a continuous pass. </p>
                                        <p>The Flexi Swiss Travel Passholders can enjoy the same benefits as that of the consecutive passholders but only on the days of travel chosen.</p>
                                        <p>Travellers who want the comfort of a car but also want the best deals on the mountains and other benefits of the pass should opt for the Flexi option. That way, they can use the pass on certain days and get the best deals on those days. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5.	No need to stand in Lines for single-fare tickets thus saving your precious time</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/no-need-to-stand-in-line-swiss-pass.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Once you have the Swiss Travel Pass, you can totally skip the long queues for single fare tickets. </p>
                                        <p>Simply hop onto your preferred mode of transport (bus, boat, train or tram) and show your pass when asked by the Ticket Checker. </p>
                                        <p>There is no hassle of scanning your pass through a machine before getting into the mode of transport chosen. </p>
                                        <p>Although non-financial, this point is necessary to consider for tourists who travel in peak seasons. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6.	Freebies on the Swiss Travel Pass</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/freebies-with-swiss-pass.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Certain mountains and famous attractions are completely free with the pass and it only increases the worth of Swiss Pass, which would otherwise attract a fee. </p>
                                        <p>Mountains and attractions free with Swiss Travel Pass are:</p>
                                        <p>
                                            1.	Mt. Rigi in Lucerne which is also known as the Queen of Mountains
								
                            <br />
                                            2.	Mt Stanserhorn which has an open double decker cable car (The CabriO) 
								
                            <br />
                                            3.	The Swiss Ballenberg Open Air museum, 
								
                            <br />
                                            4.	La Maison du Gruyère (cheese factory), 
								
                            <br />
                                            5.	Maison Cailler (chocolate factory) , 
								
                            <br />
                                            6.	Chillon Castle in Montreux. 

							
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7.	Comparison with Individual Tickets</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/comparision-with-individual-tickets.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            If the above 
									
                            <a target='_blank' href='/blog/ultimate-benefits-of-swiss-travel-pass' class='lnks'>benefits of Swiss Pass</a> haven't convinced you, let's go through some numbers:- 
								
                                        </p>
                                        <p>It really does depend on your itinerary as to whether the Swiss Travel pass will ultimately be of value to you. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            When comparing the 
									
                            <a target='_blank' href='/swiss-travel-pass' class='lnks'>Swiss Pass cost</a> vs Self Drive vs Individual public transport tickets, you will have to calculate the per day cost of what you will spend on car rental, gas, parking, individual tickets, etc. 
								
                                        </p>
                                        <p>Once you do such a calculation, you will realize that the Swiss Travel Pass is definitely of value, 98% of the time. However, if you think you're in the 2%, we list down below examples for you. </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>2ND CLASS Continuous Swiss Travel Pass Prices* </b>
                                            <br />
