                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <p>Spending 3 Days in Switzerland may not be enough, but if that’s all one has, it would be wise to make the best of it. So follow this power-packed <a href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-3-days" class="lnks" target="_blank">3 days Switzerland itinerary</a> and see your vacation stretch farther than you could imagine.</p>
                                        <p>Luckily Switzerland’s small size allows you to cover a lot of it even with a minimal time frame. And the amazing <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">Switzerland Train Pass</a> that has a 3-day version ties in perfectly with this.</p>
                                        <p>This itinerary is done with staying in Lucerne and moving around from there so that there is no time wasted in check in-check outs whilst transiting from place to place.</p>
                                        <span>The 3 days Swiss Itinerary is as:</span>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>Day 01: Lucerne - Mount Titlis, City Tour, and Lake Lucerne</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>Day 02: Interlaken - Jungfrau, Top of Europe</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>Day 03: Zurich City Tour and the Rhine Falls</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <p>Now let’s see in detail what to do with our 3 days in Switzerland.</p>
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 1: Lucerne - Mt Titlis, City Tour, Lake Lucerne</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-3-days-boat-ride-lake-lucerne-swiss-itinerary.jpg" alt="boat ride lake lucerne swiss itinerary" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Arrive early morning into Zurich or Basel and head straight for Lucerne. Your transfer will barely take you 60 to 90 minutes. Check in to your Lucerne apartment or hotel, freshen up and head back out.</p>
                                        <p>Today, you visit one of the many mountains that surround Lucerne. You can choose from Mount Pilatus, Mt. Titlis, Mount Rigi or the Stanserhorn. I prefer Mount Titlis here since it is the most popular and also my favourite.</p>
                                        <p>To get to Mount Titlis, you need to travel to Engelberg (45 minutes by train from Lucerne) so make sure you have your Swiss Travel Pass handy.</p>
                                        <p>Next, you need to have purchased the excursion ticket (which comes at a discounted price with the Swiss Travel Pass). Again, it’s a good idea to have bought your <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="lnks" target="_blank">Mount Titlis ticket</a> in advance.</p>
                                        <p>On arrival at Engelberg, take a leisurely 10-minute walk to the Titlis valley station (some buses depart from just outside the station). Once you have your tickets exchanged, you will take the first gondola, the Titlis Xpress, from the base station to Trubsee and on to Stand.</p>
                                        <p>Then change over to the next gondola Titlis Rotair - The rotating cable car - which will give you a 360-degree view of the Alps as you make your way to the peak. </p>
                                        <p>Mount Titlis is a fun mountain and has snow throughout the year. Once on top, enjoy the Cliff walk (you get to walk on the highest suspension bridge in Europe!), Ice Flyer chair lift and Glacier Park.</p>
                                        <p>For adventure lovers, there are also various activities, including a zipline at Trubsee. </p>
                                        <p>If the activities have had you build up an appetite, head for one of the many restaurants. There is a choice of restaurants with different cuisines (even an Indian menu that includes tea).</p>
                                        <p>Once you have had your fill of the mountain, head down and make your way back to Lucerne.</p>
                                        <p>Some of the main sights of Lucerne are located close to the station. You can start your walking exploration of Lucerne from here.</p>
                                        <p>The Chapel Bridge (Kapellbrücke) - A symbol of Lucerne city and the oldest wooden pedestrian bridge is visible from the station itself.</p>
                                        <p>The bridge has several paintings under the roof. A part of it also has the Water Tower (Wasserturm) standing 34 meters in height.</p>
                                        <p>The Lion Monument (Löwendenkmal), another symbol of Lucerne, is a dying lion carved out of sandstone rock in memory and honour of the Swiss soldiers.</p>
                                        <p>A small glacier garden is located nearby. Then, time permitting, make your way to the Clock tower (Zytturm), the city’s oldest colourful clock or walk towards the pier to take a cruise on Lake Lucerne.</p>
                                        <p>You can either take one of the public boats (one of the free <a href="/blog/10-ultimate-benefits-of-swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Rail Pass benefits</a>) or take a Dinner Cruise on Lake Lucerne and enjoy the scenery as you have a sumptuous meal.</p>
                                        <p>After you enjoy the views on this cruise, it’s time to head back to your accommodation, marking the end of the first day of your 3 days <a href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class="lnks" target="_blank">Switzerland itinerary</a>.</p>
                                        <strong>Tips:</strong>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>1.	The city tour will take about one and a half hour.</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>2.	The dinner cruises depart at 7 pm, so plan accordingly.</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>3.	Both Zurich and Lucerne stations have several stores, eating outlets and grocery stores, so you can always have a meal or pick up some groceries from there.</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/titlis-rotair.jpg?ver=1" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mt Titlis</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 2: Interlaken - Jungfrau</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-3-days-jungfrau-cable-car.jpg" alt="jungfrau cable car" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Head to Interlaken this morning. A significant part of the day will be spent visiting the Jungfrau, popularly known as "The Top Of Europe".</p>
                                        <p>Interlaken lies between Lake Thun and Lake Brienz and is the perfect combination of lakes and mountains. Other than the mountain excursions, Interlaken is also a hub of adventure sports. If you are interested in paragliding, sky diving, white water rafting or kayaking, it would be best to make your bookings in advance, though.</p>
                                        <p>The journey from Lucerne to Interlaken OST station is approximately 2 hours by train so ensure you have an early start.</p>
                                        <p>The journey to Europe’s highest railway station at an altitude of 3454 metres used to be entirely by train. However, effective the end of 2020, Jungfrau has also introduced the Eiger Express. This brand new cable car route takes you part of the way and effectively cuts down travel time to the top.</p>
                                        <p>Train buffs can still continue to travel the old train route if they wish. If you have purchased your <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="lnks" target="_blank">Jungfrau tickets</a> in advance, all you have to do is exchange your voucher at Interlaken OST station (Jungfrau counter) and proceed towards the first leg of the journey from Interlaken OST</p>
                                        <p>If you have opted for the train route (2 hours), you will make the journey to the top via 2 changes - Lauterbrunnen and Kleine Scheidegg. The way gives some spectacular views of the glaciers and the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau.</p>
                                        <p>The train also makes a few stops for you to get off and enjoy the sights and acclimatize yourself to the rarer air as you ascend higher.</p>
                                        <p>If you choose the new Eiger Express cable car route, you can take the train from Interlaken to Grindelwald, then the cable car from Grindelwald to the Eiger Glacier Station and lastly the train to the peak.</p>
                                        <p>This route has cut down the journey time by a significant 47 minutes (I don’t think the Swiss would like anyone rounding up the times and saying close to 50 minutes)!</p>
                                        <p>Once you arrive on top, walk to the iconic Sphinx, which contains restaurants, souvenir stores, the ice palace, and Lindt chocolate heaven.</p>
                                        <p>You will also have access to the viewing platforms from where you can see the Aletsch Glacier- the longest glacier in the Alps. Try a few snow activities and then proceed to one of the restaurants for lunch (there is self-service, fine dining and even an Indian restaurant).</p>
                                        <p>Making your descent after lunch will give you some time to explore the town of Interlaken. Take a walk along the famous Hoheweg promenade, a street filled with cafes, hotels, stores and the Interlaken Casino. For Bollywood fans, this Casino’s garden has a bronze statue of Yash Chopra too. Make your way back to Lucerne.</p>

                                        <strong>Tips:</strong>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">1.	You can either stop at Grindelwald and explore the town or else stop in Lauterbrunnen and visit the famous Trummelbach Falls on the descent from Jungfrau.</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">2.	The train journey between Interlaken - Lucerne or vice versa is on the Lucerne Interlaken Express panoramic train, a part of the Golden Pass Line. Reservation is not compulsory on this route. The Swiss Pass takes care of it.</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">3.	Leave Lucerne no later than 8 am to make the best of this day.</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">4.	If you have the Swiss Pass, you can avail yourself of the Jungfrau ticket price. On its own, Jungfrau is one of the more expensive mountains.</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 3: Zurich and the Rhine Falls</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-3-days-bahnhofstrasse.jpg" alt="bahnhofstrasse" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Make your way to Zurich (1 hour) for a day in the city.
                                You can cover the city with your Swiss Travel Pass. 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>
                                            Start with Bahnhofstrasse – a very popular street in Zurich flanked by boutiques, coffee shops, stores that sell jewellery, watches, chocolates, and many big brands. 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>
                                            This is “The shopper’s paradise”. From there, walk towards the Old Town. On your way, you will see Zurich’s landmarks – The Fraumunster Church, Zurich Lake (Limmat) and the Grossmunster. You can also cover one of the points that offer views of the city from an elevation. 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>
                                            Lindenhof hill offers breathtaking views of the Old Town, the lake, the churches, and the city hall. And serves as a public park and picnic spot (They have GIANT chess sets here). 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>
                                            Alternatively, go to Üetliberg, a small mountain that offers Zurich's panoramic views, the lake, and the alps from the top. It’s a short train ride from the central station and a steep walk to the top. 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>Next, head for the Rhine falls, which is easily accessible by train. </p>

                                        <p>
                                            You can take the train to Neuhausen or Schloss Laufen and then follow the signboard and walk to the Rhine Falls. 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>
                                            If you are visiting in summer, try a boat ride to the centre of the waterfalls (at a nominal cost). 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>
                                            Since Zurich is a big city, you can also opt for a <a href="/Sightseeings" class="lnks" target="_blank">guided city tour</a> to make the most of the limited time. Some tours range from 2-hour city tour to almost 8 hours (combining city tours with the Rhine Falls or the medieval village of Stein Am Rhein). 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>
                                            These day tours are top-rated and best purchased in advance. Some of these tours even drop you at the airport on completion. 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>
                                            You may think this seems like a lot to do in 3 days <a href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class="lnks" target="_blank">Switzerland package</a>. Still, the public transport system of Switzerland is just so easy to use. Of course, it works with Swiss precision, so if you have a well-planned itinerary, you will cover everything suggested here with ease and comfort. 
                                        </p>

                                        <p>So get ready for a power-packed 3 days in this beautiful country and return with memories of a lifetime!</p>
                                        <strong>General tips:</strong>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">1.	Always check the last train back to the city you’re staying at. This way, you won’t miss your connection and will also make it a point to rule out things you’re not interested in. </li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">2.	If you’ve decided to stay at an apartment, remember to stock up some groceries or eatables for the rest of your trip from the nearest supermarket on Day 1. That way you will not waste time doing some shopping each day.</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">3.	If you think heights will make you light-headed or dizzy, chew on some sour sweets on the way up to the mountains.</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">4.	If you have missed out on your shopping, make sure to reach the airport early. Zurich airport shopping centre and its duty-free shops offer a fantastic choice of retail outlets for clothes, accessories, apparels, chocolates, cheeses and of course, watches.</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">5.	Carry a water bottle with you. There is no need to purchase water in Switzerland. Every town has water fountains from where you can fill up on super clean alpine water. </li>
                                        </ul>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>

                            <div class="bd-padding" id="divswitzerland_itinerary_9_days" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <p>Switzerland may look like a tiny country on the map, but there is so much to do and see that you have to keep coming back.</p>
                                        <p>You can never finish the main highlights of Switzerland if you don't stay for a longer duration. Therefore, choosing a 9 days Switzerland itinerary is near perfect for covering all the iconic Swiss mountains and destinations.</p>
                                        <p>Those who wish to sneak peek into the "not so usual" <a href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class="lnks" target="_blank">Switzerland tour</a> can consider this a complete travel package. </p>
                                        <span>Places covered:</span>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">1.	Montreux</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">2.	Zermatt</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">3.	St Moritz</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">4.	Lugano</li>
                                            <li style="margin: 0 0 15px 15px;">5.	Zurich</li>
                                        </ul>

                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 1: Arrival - Travel to Montreux - Chillon Castle and Promenade:</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day1-chillion-castle.jpg" alt="chillion castle" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Your first destination in this <strong>9-day itinerary</strong> is Montreux. Your point of arrival in Switzerland should be via Geneva, as it is the closest airport to Montreux. However, if you're flying into Zurich as your entry point, you still have good train connections to Montreux. It would take approximately between 1.30 hours from Geneva Airport or 2.50 hours from Zurich Airport. Don't forget to keep your Swiss Travel Pass and passport in hand before you board your train. </p>

                                        <p>Montreux is located on the western side of Switzerland and is also a part of the Lake Geneva region. You will experience this when your train arrives closer to Montreux, and you pass by villages and vineyards located around the lakes. </p>

                                        <p>
                                            Make your way to the hotel, freshen up and relax. After lunch, proceed to Château de Chillon. The Chillon Castle is a fortress on a rocky island and houses many medieval frescoes and dungeons. There are various rooms at multiple levels and interconnected pathways with wooden staircases to explore within the castle. Some rooms have interactive areas, and some have great audios and videos, which makes it easier to understand the history behind the castle and make it come alive.
                                After you finish your visit to Chillon Castle, take the bus to Montreux promenade (towards the central station) and walk along the lakeside. You will come across huge parks, a boat pier, and many metal art sculptures on the way. You cannot miss out on Freddie Mercury's bronze statue here. Enjoy the sunset here with a light snack or a cup of coffee at one of the restaurants nearby.
                                        </p>

                                        <p>Make your way back to your hotel or <a href="/apartments" class="lnks" target="_blank">apartment</a> overnight in Montreux. </p>
                                        <p><strong>Note: </strong>A proper lunch/dinner in the Montreux region could be pretty expensive, so it's best to buy smaller meals or snacks from the grocery store.</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 2: Montreux - Gstaad - Glacier 3000</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day2-glacier-3000.jpg" alt="glacier 3000" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Today you will take a train to Gstaad, which is around 1.30 hours away. If you've ever come across posters/photographs of Switzerland, they have most probably been shot here.
                                Once you move out of Gstaad station, you will find yellow buses parked outside.
                                        </p>

                                        <p>Take the one which reads Les Diablerets , and get off at Col-du-Pillon, which is the base station for the <a href="/mountain-excursion/4-glacier-3000" class="lnks" target="_blank">Glacier 3000</a>. Exchange your mountain voucher at the base station and proceed towards the cable car up. After changing a cable car at a midway point, you will reach the peak. </p>

                                        <p>The highlight here is the "Tissot Peak walk", a suspension bridge that connects two mountains (Included in your mountain voucher). You get a great view of the Alps from here. The Alpine coaster - the highest bobsleigh track and many other activities like the Snow Bus, Dog Sled rides are available at an additional cost (Operation depends on weather conditions). </p>

                                        <p>Have lunch at one of the restaurants on top and take the cable car back down. Make sure you check restaurant timings as soon as you're on top, so that you walk in for lunch much before they close for the day. You can take a stroll around the village of Gstaad, look at cows grazing over the meadows, an alpine experience for all ages. Take the train back to Montreux. Overnight in Montreux. </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Glacier-3000-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Glacier 300</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/4-glacier-3000" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 3: Montreux - Zermatt - Leisure (Or Gornergrat)</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day3-zermatt-village.jpg" alt="zermatt village" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                        <p>After breakfast, take the train to Zermatt. Zermatt is a car-free resort, so you would have to either walk or take an electric bus to your hotel. Check in to your hotel or apartment. </p>

                                        <p>After settling into your hotel or apartment, start your day 3 of the itinerary by exploring the village. Take a walk on the Bahnhofstrasse - Zermatt's main street, where you will find a lot of restaurants, pubs, bakeries, small boutiques, and hotels - both modern and traditional, at every step of the way. Visit the Matterhorn Museum and stop by at the church of St Mauritius too. A lot of picture-perfect locations with the Matterhorn in the background.</p>

                                        <p>Alternatively, you can take a trip to the Gornergrat, a viewing platform where you'll get the best views of Matterhorn and Monte Rosa. The Gornergrat railway is right opposite Zermatt main station. So make sure you leave early from the hotel if you'd like to do the Gornergrat excursion.</p>


                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 4: Zermatt - Matterhorn Glacier Paradise:</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day4-matterhorn-switzerland-itinerary.jpg" alt="matterhorn switzerland itinerary" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Today, visit one of the most iconic Swiss mountains - Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, which is a must include in your 9 days itinerary for Switzerland. A leisurely walk to the base station of <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="lnks" target="_blank">Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</a> will take about 15 mins from the main station. The triangular peak of the Matterhorn is the inspiration behind the unique shape of the Toblerone chocolate. Once you reach the base station, you take the 3- stage gondola ride to the peak. </p>

                                        <p>Try the "Crystal ride" cabins, decorated with Swarovski crystals, and a transparent floor, which gives you a view of the glaciers below. This is only available for a small leg of the journey and is at an additional cost, but is worth it. </p>

                                        <p>After a 50-minute gondola ride, you will be at the highest cable car station in Europe, at the height of 3883 meters. On days when the skies are completely clear, you'll be able to spot Mont Blanc (France) and Gran Paradiso (Italy). Try the Glacier palace, the highest in Europe, which has beautiful ice sculptures, ice benches and ice tunnels. </p>

                                        <p>Drop-in at a restaurant for lunch, and take the gondola back to the base station. In the evening, try one of the pubs on the main street of Zermatt, or walk in to a small dessert outlet and have something to satisfy your taste buds. </p>

                                        <p>Day 4 of your 9 days Switzerland itinerary ends here. Overnight in Zermatt. </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Matterhorn-Glacier-Paradise-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 5: Zermatt - St Moritz via Glacier Express:</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day5-glacier-express-train.jpg" alt="glacier express train" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                        <p>Since we have an early train to board, you will have an early breakfast, check out and reach the train station around 08.40 am. Reservation on this train is mandatory, so keep your reservation ticket and Swiss Pass ready, as you board the 08.52 am Glacier Express train to St Moritz. </p>

                                        <p>The reservation ticket purchased is at a discounted rate in conjunction with your <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Travel Pass cost</a>, so it is important you have both documents with you.</p>

                                        <p>The Glacier Express train, although called an "express" train, is the slowest express and the most popular train in Europe. It will take you approximately 7 and a half hours to complete the entire journey to St Moritz. </p>

                                        <p>You will be comfortably seated in a coach with large panoramic windows reaching right to the top. As your train moves over spectacular 291 bridges and several tunnels, you will enjoy an unobstructed view of the Matterhorn, the Rhine Gorge, Oberalp pass (Highest point) and the Landwasser viaduct - a UNESCO World Heritage Site not to be missed! </p>

                                        <p>The train also comes with a pantry compartment. So you have the option of ordering a meal or a snack. Or even a glass of wine or a cup of coffee that you can enjoy on your seat with a beautiful view outside.</p>

                                        <p>You will reach St Moritz at around 4.45 pm. Make your way to the hotel, check-in and relax at your hotel. Overnight in St Moritz.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/glacier-express-medium1.webp?v=12" alt="Glacier Express">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Glacier Express</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/43-glacier-express" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 6: St Moritz - Diavolezza </h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day6-diavolezza.jpg" alt="diavolezza" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                        <p>St Moritz is located in the western part of Switzerland, in the Engadin valley and Europe's premier winter sports destination. </p>

                                        <p>Today, you make your way to <a href="/mountain-excursion/40-diavolezza" class="lnks" target="_blank">Diavolezza</a>, a vantage point 3000 meters high. Take the train from St Moritz to Bernina Diavolezza, and then a cable car to the top. </p>

                                        <p>With the sun shining over the glaciers, Diavolezza makes an ideal spot to lay back and feel close to mother nature. Try some snowboarding activity here, or move to Berghaus Diavolezza for lunch. Then, make your way back down. </p>

                                        <p>Take the train back to St Moritz, get off, and start walking towards the iconic St Moritz lake. The amazing view will have you looking at the lake, the forest, beautiful houses and a mountain in the backdrop - all in one frame. Then, walk for another 15 - 20 mins to the 33-meter high leaning tower (Originally a part of a church). The Engadiner Museum and Segantini Museums are located 10 - 15 mins away by bus from the main station. </p>

                                        <p>
                                            Have dinner at one of the restaurants nearby, and make your way back to the hotel.
                                Overnight in St Moritz.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Diavolezza-medium1.webp?v=12" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Diavolezza</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/40-diavolezza" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 7: St Moritz - Lugano</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day7-lugano-of-switzerland-itinerary.jpg" alt="lugano of switzerland itinerary" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>After breakfast, check out of the hotel. Then, take the 4-hour train journey to the Lugano. Lugano is located on the southernmost part of Switzerland. It has a Mediterranean feel because it is located close to Italy. </p>

                                        <p>
                                            You will arrive into Lugano by afternoon. Check-in, have lunch and relax.
                                (Lugano Paradiso is a great area to stay at, and is surrounded by numerous take away joints, restaurants, bars & supermarkets.)
                                        </p>

                                        <p>Around 4.30 pm, take a bus ride to Parco Ciani - located right by the Lake of Lugano. This huge park has a lot of fountains and statues is divided into 2 parts, one which has an English - Italian feel with flower beds, trees, typical English lawns, fountains and the second part which features the local plants, oaks, and sycamore trees, along with a children's play area. </p>
                                        <p>As the sun sets, the hues of the sun are overtaken by Lugano's city lights reflecting off the lake. You will be awe-struck by the panoramic view of the city, the lakes, Monte Bré and Monte San Salvatore. Lugano Casino is also 5 mins away (Be sure to dress appropriately if you'd like to go in) </p>

                                        <p>After dinner, make your way to the hotel, marking an end to your Day 7 of your <strong>Switzerland itinerary for 9 days.</strong>Overnight in Lugano.</p>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 8: Lugano - Swiss Miniatur</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day8-swiss-miniatur.jpg" alt="swiss miniatur" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Take a short train ride to Melide and walk to <a href="/mountain-excursion/14-swiss-miniatur" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Miniatur</a>- the theme park that showcases models of Switzerland in miniature form. </p>

                                        <p>A visual delight for young and old, Swiss Miniatur has an impressive set of models ranging from aeroplanes to ships, castles to buildings, funiculars to cable cars ascending and descending a small mountain, to trains including the Glacier Express, which moves on rail tracks around the park. Around 128 models, in the 1:25 scale traditionally made by artisans of the park, can be seen here. This is one of the most popular inclusions in a <a href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class="lnks" target="_blank">Switzerland itinerary</a> by people travelling with kids. </p>

                                        <p>Have lunch at the restaurant located within the park. The park has a kid's play area and a mini train to ride around the park.  </p>

                                        <p>You can either make your way back to the hotel or take the train to Fox Town in Mendrisio. Fox Town is the largest factory outlet with over a hundred stores offering 30 to 70 per cent discount on branded goods. Fox Town also has beauty salons, restaurants and a Casino too, all under one roof. </p>

                                        <p>You can have dinner at the restaurants in Fox Town or closer to your hotel (Try an Italian meal today if you haven't already - maybe some Lasagna or Ravioli? Or Pizza maybe). Then, return back to the hotel. Overnight at Lugano.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Swiss-Miniature-medium3.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Miniatur</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/14-swiss-miniatur" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 9: Lugano - Zurich</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day9-zurich-itinerary.jpg" alt="zurich itinerary" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Moving to the last city in the itinerary, take the train to either Zurich Airport or Zurich HB, depending on your hotel's location. You will arrive at your hotel by 1 pm. Have lunch, and head out to the Zurich city centre. Depending on your time and interest, you could choose to do either of the options below, all accessible with the Swiss Travel Pass.</p>

                                        <p>
                                            1.	A basic <strong>city tour</strong> can be done on your own using the Switzerland train pass. You can start with Bahnhofstrasse - a trendy street in Zurich flanked by boutiques, coffee shops, stores that sell jewelry, watches, chocolates, and a lot of big brands too. From there, you can walk towards the old town.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            On your way, you will see Zurich's landmarks - The Fraumunster Church, Zurich Lake (Limmat) and the Grossmunster. If you're willing to walk a little more to an elevated area, you can visit the Lindenhof hill, which offers breathtaking views of the old town, the lake, the churches, city hall etc. This spot also serves as a public park and picnic spot.
                                        </p>

                                        <p>2.	You can go to <strong>Üetliberg, </strong>a small mountain that offers Zurich's panoramic views, the lake, and the Alps from the top. It's a short train ride from the main station and a steep walk to the top.</p>

                                        <p>3.	You can also visit the <strong>Rhine Falls,</strong> which is easily accessible by train. You can take the train to Neuhausen or Schloss Laufen and then follow the signboard and walk to the Rhine Falls. A boat ride in the centre of the waterfalls is possible at an additional cost.</p>
                                        <p>If you do not want to cover the city on your own, you can opt for seat- in- coach tours too. However, this depends on what time you arrive in Zurich as the tours have fixed timings and have to be booked in advance. Also, check out <a href="/blog/things-to-do-in-zurich" class="lnks" target="_blank">10 things to do in Zurich</a>, penned by Swiss travel experts. </p>


                                        <p>Have dinner at the nearest restaurant (If you're at the airport, try the food court there) and move to your hotel. Overnight at Zurich. </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 10: Zurich - Departure:</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/switzerland-itinerary-9-days-day10-departure.jpg" alt="departure" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>After breakfast, check out from the hotel and head towards Zurich International airport for your flight back home. </p>


                                        <p>Hope this plan covering varied areas of Switzerland from glitzy St Moritz to sporty Zermatt, Mediterranean Lugano and cosmopolitan Zurich is a good fit for you. Enjoy your <a href="/" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss holiday</a>!</p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>

                                <ul>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title noneIMP">Introduction</h2>
                                        <p>Europe is a vast continent and very well connected by its modern and efficient public transport. Most travelers including myself would want to cover multiple countries and keep the best-connected ones in mind.</p>
                                        <p>Switzerland with its perfect location will invariably feature in this.The following <a href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-5-days" class="lnks" target="_blank">5 days Switzerland itinerary</a>  was a part of our longer tour to Europe covering Paris, Switzerland and Austria.</p>
                                        <p>What strikes you as soon as you reach Switzerland is the ease of travelling around it.No other country has as integrated a public transport system as Switzerland.And certainly no other country has a transport pass that allows you to just use all kinds of transport.</p>
                                        <p>We’d purchased our  <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Rail Pass.</a> in advance;so we could just get on our first train on arrival from Paris to Basel.Trying to maximize a 5 day stay in Switzerland while basing ourselves in one place (we rented a short stay apartment in Lucrne), was largely possible due to the pass and the <a href="/blog/10-ultimate-benefits-of-swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">benefits of the Swiss Travel Pass.</a></p>
                                        <p>Here’s what we did and what you can do with your 5 days in Switzerland.</p>
                                        <span>Day 1:Lucerne Town</span>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-    Chapel bridge</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-    Lion Monument</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-    Old town</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Musegg Wall</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <span>Day 2: Mount Titlis</span>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Ice Flyer</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Ice Cave</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Titlis Cliff Walk</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Engelberg town</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <span>Day 3: Jungfraujoch</span>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Ice Palace</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Observation Deck</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Aletsch Glacier</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Stores</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <span>Day 4: Zermatt or Montreux and Gstaad</span>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Matterhorn Museum</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Zermatt Village Tour</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Gstaad</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Montreux Town</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Chillon Castle</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <span>Day 5: Zurich and Rhine Falls</span>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Rhine Falls</li>
                                            <li style='margin-left: 15px;'>-	Zurich City and Old Town</li>
                                        </ul>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 1: Lucerne</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/lion-monument-lucerne-switzerland.jpg" alt="Lion Monument Lucerene Switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Whether entering Switzerland by air,rail or cruise,you will most likely arrive into Zurich or Basel.From here, head straight to Lucerne (1 hour),which is generally well connected with direct trains.</p>
                                        <p>Lucerne is a popular tourist town with plenty of accommodation options from budget to luxury hotels and <a href="/apartments" class="lnks" target="_blank">apartments in Switzerland.</a></p>
                                        <p>It would be best to take it easy on the first day after a long day of travel so you could just head out to cover the main sights of this lakeside town</p>
                                        <p>Nothing like starting with Lucerne’s most striking Chapel bridge – a wooden covered bridge which has come to be a symbol of the town.</p>
                                        <p>Continue along the cobbled stone streets to make your way to the Lion Monument – a massive and poignant figure of a dying lion carved out of a sandstone rock ledge.</p>
                                        <p>The Old town of Lucerne should be the next stop. Walk along this fairytale-like area with its timber framed buildings and Lucerne’s oldest church St. Peter’s chapel.</p>
                                        <p>The north end of the Old Town has the striking Musegg wall with its 9 different looking towers.Four of these towers are open to the public.If you are ready for a climb, you will be rewarded with an amazing view over the town.</p>
                                        <p>Pro Tip: On your way back to the hotel,make sure to visit some of the famous local chocolatiers.The most tempting window displays of chocolates just tempt you to walk in and try.</p>
                                        <p>Remember that the Swiss Travel Pass will allow you to just hop on to a bus to take you from place to place in case you are tired and don’t wish to walk.</p>
                                        <p>Time to rest well on your first of the 5 days in Switzerland!</p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 2: Mount Titlis – Lucerne</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/5-days-switzerland-itinerary-titlis-cliff-walk.jpg" alt="itinerary titlis cliff walk" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>The best way to cover a mountain is to dedicate a full day to it. Today head to one of the most famous mountains of Switzerland – <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="lnks" target="_blank">5-mount-titlis</a></p>
                                        <p>Take a train from Lucerne train station to Engelberg (45 minutes) a beautiful Swiss village located at the base of Mount Titlis.</p>
                                        <p>From here either walk for 15 minutes to the cable car valley station for Titlis or opt for a bus from just outside the station.The journey to the top is done by 2 cable cars. First, the Titlis Xpress, and then the Titlis Rotair – a Rotating Cable car that gives a spectacular 360-degree view of the surrounding Alpine landscape.</p>
                                        <p>There are tons of activities that can be enjoyed here. Some like the Ice Flyer, the Ice cave and the famous Titlis Cliff Walk are at the peak.But there are also lots of things including a zipline that you can do at the midway point in Trubsee.</p>
                                        <p>After your descent from Titlis,take some time to wander around Engelberg town and also visit he Benedictine Monastery there.We did not have the time for it,but the monastery also has a small cheese making unit where you can see how the local cheese is produced.</p>
                                        <p>Return back to Lucerne to mark an end of the second day of 5 days  <a href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-8-days" class="lnks" target="_blank">Switzerland itinerary.</a></p>

                                        <h3>Alternative Day 2 Itinerary</h3>
                                        <p>Lucerne is famous for its museums and none more so than the<a href="/mountain-excursion/35-swiss-transport-museum" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Museum of Transport</a>.Don’t let the name fool you,it’s an amazing place for adults and kids alike and other than the history of transport,it has a huge arena where kids can enjoy, a planetarium and the interactive 	Swiss Chocolate Adventure. People, particularly travelling with kids, always include it in their <a href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss package.</a></p>
                                        <p>The Swiss Museum of Transport is partly open-air so please check weather beforehand.</p>
                                        <p>Other mountains near Lucerne: Lucerne is home to other mountains like the Mount Pilatus, Mt. Rigi and Mt. Stanserhorn. Some of these are also totally free with the Swiss Travel Pass.We chose to do Mt Titlis because it is snowbound throughout the year and we wanted to experience the rotating cable car</p>
                                        <p>Pro tip: If you’d like to explore more in this town, read our dedicated blog on <a href="/blog/10-things-to-do-in-lucerne-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">things to do in Lucerne.</a></p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/titlis-rotair.jpg?ver=1" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mt Titlis</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 3: Jungfraujoch – Lucerne</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/5-days-switzerland-itinerary-glacier.jpg" alt="switzerland itinerary glacier" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Switzerland is all about heights and superlatives.Get ready to visit the Jungfraujoch – The top of Europe and the highest train station in Europe! Make an early start from Lucerne (latest by 8am) and hop on to the Lucerne – Interlaken Express scenic train to reach Interlaken.</p>
                                        <p>From here one can opt for the old and traditional route with 2 train changes to the top or the new Eiger route that is partly by cableway.</p>
                                        <h3>Route 1</h3>
                                        <p>Once you exchange tickets for Jungfrau at the Interlaken Ost Jungfrau counter head to Lauterbrunnen by train.Change trains at Lauterbrunnen and proceed to Kleine Scheidegg from where you travel on the final journey to the peak.</p>
                                        <p>The route is very scenic and on the last journey the train stops a couple of times for people to get off for a few minutes and enjoy the scenery.These stops also help to acclimatize yourself to the thinner air as you ascend.This traditional route takes 2 hours</p>
                                        <h3>Route 2</h3>
                                        <p>Take the train to Grindelwald,then a cable car to Eiger Glacier Station and lastly the train to Jungfrau.A person saves roughly 45 minutes on this route.</p>
                                        <p>At the top of Jungfrau, make your way outdoors into the snow, enjoy sweeping views of the Aletsch Glacier- the longest in the alps,walk into the eerily blue Ice Palace with various ice sculptures and visit the Lindt Chocolate Heaven.</p>
                                        <p>If you have made an early start to the day,you will be able to visit the beautiful town of Interlaken and spend some time on its Hoheweg (main street) before you head back to Lucerne.</p>
                                        <p>Pro Tip: As it’s one of the most expensive mountains in Switzerland,buy <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="lnks" target="_blank">Jungfraujoch tickets with Swiss Pass</a> Jungfraujoch tickets with Swiss Pass to avail a discounted price and free entry for your kids.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 4: Lucerne to Zermatt or Lucerne to Montreux and Gstaad</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/5-days-switzerland-itinerary-gondola.jpg" alt="switzerland itinerary gondola" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>Staying in a well-connected place like Lucerne gives you the advantage of doing day trips to almost every place in the country.We had to decide between Zermatt, Basel and Montreux.</p>
                                        <p>In our Switzerland itinerary for 5 days, we decided on Zermatt simply because we could not imagine going to Switzerland and skipping the Matterhorn – the most famous of all mountains!</p>
                                        <p>This choice made it a very long day, but it was worth it.</p>
                                        <p>Zermatt is reached via 2 train changes and a travel time of just over 3 hours.This alpine village is car free – one has to get around by electric buses or horse drawn carriages!</p>
                                        <p>On arrival into Zermatt, you can take a leisurely walk through the center of town to reach the valley station of the<a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="lnks" target="_blank"> Matterhorn Glacier Paradise.</a>The Matterhorn is said to be the most photographed mountain in the world (remember this country is all about superlatives).</p>
                                        <p>If you have had your share of Swiss chocolates by now, you will have figured out the connection between the unique shape of the Toblerone chocolate and the almost geometrically-perfect peak of the Matterhorn.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/5-days-switzerland-itinerary-peak-Matterhorn.jpg" alt="switzerland itinerary peak Matterhorn" />
                                                />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p></p>
                                        <p>Once on top you get brilliant views of the alps and on a clear day can see as far as the Mont Blanc in France.</p>
                                        <p>If you have some time on the return back to town,the Matterhorn Museum and the historical Hinterdorf area of Zermatt are worth visiting too</p>
                                        <p>In case, you decide to go to Montreux or Gstaad instead of Zermatt,here is what you can do.</p>
                                        <h3>Lucerne to Montreux and Gstaad</h3>
                                        <p>Leave early morning and head to Gstaad roughly 3 hrs 45 minutes.Gstaad is one of the most expensive and beautiful villages in Switzerland.The rolling hills,green mountains and snowcapped peaks make it a place frequented by the rich and the famous who decide to descend onto the town for their annual vacations.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/5-days-switzerland-itinerary-Gstaad.jpg" alt="chillion castle" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p></p>
                                        <p>The village is so small that a walk along the central pedestrian area takes you from one end to the other in just a few minutes!</p>
                                        <p>From Gstaad proceed by train to Montreux, a beautiful village on the shores of Lake Geneva surrounded by beautiful Swiss Alps.</p>
                                        <p>One can walk alongside the lake, visit the statue of Freddie Mercury or visit the Chillon Castle. Later proceed back to Lucerne in the evening.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Matterhorn-Glacier-Paradise-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>

                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Day 5: Lucerne to Zurich and Rhine Falls</h2>
                                        <p>Today is the day you end your <a href="/switzerland-tour-packages" class="lnks" target="_blank">Switzerland tour</a> so the activities mentioned below will largely be dependent on your departure time.</p>
                                        <p>Depart Lucerne for Zurich Airport or Zurich Main Train Station (direct train and time taken roughly 1 hr 15 mins).At Zurich Airport you can deposit your bags at the baggage counter and proceed to Rhine Falls.</p>
                                        <p>Take the train to Neuhausen Rheinfall or the Schloss Laufen train station and make your way on foot to the falls</p>
                                        <p>There is a lift that takes you to an up-close viewing point from where you can actually feel the thunder and spray of the falls.</p>
                                        <p>You can also take a boat ride that takes you up close to the falls.The lift and the boat ride come at nominal costs that range between 5 to 10 Swiss francs.</p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/5-days-switzerland-itinerary-Rhine-Falls.jpg" alt="chillion castle" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p></p>
                                        <p>On return to Zurich,get out of the main entrance of the station and continue walking down Bahnhofstrasse (main street) and walk past the outlets of every major watch and jewelry brand.Now’s your chance to splurge and indulge yourself.</p>
                                        <p>The end of Bahnhofstrasse will lead you to the lakeside and a good view of Zurich City.</p>
                                        <p>On the way back, you can choose to walk through Zurich old town.</p>
                                        <p>If you are departing by flight,collect your luggage from the lockers and make your way to the airport.</p>
                                        <p>If you have the full day in Zurich, it would be wise to opt for a <a href="/Sightseeings" class="lnks" target="_blank">guided sightseeing</a> by coach.There are various city tours to choose from.The ones that cover the city along with the Rhine Falls or the Black Forest area are a good choice.</p>
                                        <p>Doing all of this may seem a bit intimidating but it was all possible in a short span because we had the Swiss Travel Pass and had also pre-purchased some of the mountains (of course at the relevant<a href="/blog/top-discounts-on-swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank"> discounts with Swiss Pass).</a></p>
                                        <p>You could also choose to move from town to town instead of making a base in one place. Our decision to stay in one place was based on cost (we found a relatively inexpensive apartment) and not wanting to waste time in check-in-check-out procedures</p>
                                        <p>When it comes to spending 5 days in Switzerland, one really does not have to think long and hard. Just start packing and let the country work its magic on you.</p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>
