                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Classes:</b> You can opt for either 2nd class, 1st class or Excellence Class.<br />
                                            The first and second classes have panoramic windows, so you will not really miss any of the scenery from either. In both classes, you can call for meals at your table. The only difference is the seating, which is plusher and more spaced out in 1st class. The 2nd class has two columns with two seats each on either side of the aisle, and the 1st class has a column of two and a column of one.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Excellence Class is an all-window-seat cabin and includes an aperitif, a 5-course meal and bar service. I have not travelled in it myself, but if you are feeling exceptionally splurgy or are celebrating a special event, this would be a great way to do so. A ride on the Glacier Express Excellence Class would definitely take one of the <strong>most scenic train journeys in Switzerland</strong> to a new elevated level.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Duration:</b> The journey from Zermatt to St Moritz takes 7.45 hours. If you are pressed for time, you can also make the trip from Zermatt to Chur, which takes 5.30 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Frequency:</b> There are four trains in the summer (though 2 of them do not cover the full route from Zermatt to St Moritz) and one or two trains in the winter. Between the two seasons, the train does not typically operate from mid-October to the first week of December.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Reservation:</b> You need to have a ticket and a reservation for the train. However, if you hold a Swiss Travel Pass, you only need to purchase the reservation since the pass covers the journey. You can buy the pass and the reservation <a href="/mountain-excursion/43-glacier-express">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Along the Way:</b><br />
                                            <b>Zermatt:</b> This typically Swiss town is home to the most photographed mountain in the world. Whether you are arriving, departing, or in Zermatt, you will see the towering triangular massif of the Matterhorn. If you are in Zermatt for a day or more, you should visit the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise (Klein Matterhorn) to get the best views and photographs of the Matterhorn.<br />
                                            Walk the quaint streets packed with souvenir shops, boutiques and cafes and visit the historical quarter of town called Hinterdorf.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Oberalp Pass:</b> Connecting the towns of Andermatt and Disentis, this pass is where the Glacier Express reaches it highest elevation of 2044 metres.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Rhine Gorge:</b> Travelling between Disentis and Chur, the train passes the Rhine Gorge, also known as the Swiss Grand Canyon. The area offers some of the most stunning scenery, including limestone cliffs and the winding Rhine River.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Chur:</b> Known to be Switzerland's oldest town with a history of over 5000 years, this town has a beautiful cathedral and a charming Old Town. If your journey ends here, you can spend some time exploring before your onward journey. Chur is very well connected to other towns like Lucerne and Zurich.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Albula Line:</b> This is probably the most exciting part of the journey. Along this UNESCO Heritage Site, the train passes over sights that have become the most iconic images of the Glacier Express route.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <u>The Landwasser Viaduct:</u>  At 65 metres and with six limestone arches, this is arguably the most photographed viaduct and leads directly into a tunnel.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <u>Solis Viaduct:</u> The Highest bridge on the Rhaetian Railway, this viaduct stands at 85 metres height and has 11 limestone arches.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>St Moritz:</b> One of the most sought-after destinations, this town offers abundant glitz, glamour and natural beauty. Whether it's walking, hiking, skiing, or just taking in the views of the beautiful Lake St. Moritz, there is something for everyone here.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2. Bernina Express</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/BerninaExpress2.webp" alt="Bernina Express" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Go from snow-clad Alpine terrain to the balmy warmth of Italy on the Bernina Express. This instantly recognizable scarlet train connects the towns of Chur and St Moritz in Switzerland to Tirano in Italy. In the summer months, they also have the added journey from Tirano back to Lugano in Switzerland by bus.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Classes:</b> The train offers 2nd and 1st class cabins. Both classes have panoramic windows, ensuring you don't miss out on the great views. The 2nd class has two seats on either side of the aisle, and the first class has a column of two and a column of one.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Duration:</b> The route from Chur to Tirano (144 kms) is called the Bernina Express long route and takes around 4 to 4.30 hours.<br />
                                            The route from St Moritz to Tirano (122 km) takes 2.30 hours and is called the Bernina Express short route.<br />
                                            The bus journey from Tirano to Lugano takes 3 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Frequency:</b> The number of trains operating differs with seasons and routes, which can get tricky. However, typically, it goes like this-<br />
                                            Chur to Tirano - two trains in the summer and one in winter.
                                            <br />
                                            St Moritz to Tirano - three in summer and 1 in winter. However, in winter, it is not a daily operation. 
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Tirano to Lugano bus operates one daily service from March to October and Thursdays to Sundays from mid- February to March and October to November.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Reservation:</b> Like other scenic trains, you need to have a ticket and reservation for the Bernina Express. However, if you hold a Swiss Travel Pass, you only have to purchase the reservation. This can cost between SFr 25 to 40 with an additional SFr 14 to 16 for the bus. You can check the current costs and purchase the reservations <a href="/mountain-excursion/42-bernina-express" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Along the way:</b><br />
                                            The Bernina Express route from Chur to St Moritz is the same as the Glacier Express, so you travel across the amazing Solis and Landwasser viaducts.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Bernina Pass:</b> Located between St Moritz and Poschiavo, the train reaches its highest point at Ospizio Bernina station at 2253 metres with amazing views over the Lago Bianco.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Alp Grum:</b> An almost 15-minute halt at this station (2091 metres) made out of limestone gives the opportunity to get out and take some photographs of the stunning surroundings, including the Palu See (lake) and the Piz Palu (glacier).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Brusio Spiral Viaduct:</b> Just before crossing over into Italy is one more marvellous piece of engineering. The Brusio Spiral viaduct enables the train to do a 360-degree turn, effectively crossing over itself. This viaduct has nine arches that span 10 metres each.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Lugano:</b> If you take the Bernina Express bus from Tirano to Lugano, you will see a totally different side of Switzerland. Lugano has a sunny Mediterranean climate and palm-lined promenades. If you have some time here, you can visit the lovely <a href="/mountain-excursion/14-swiss-miniatur">Swiss Miniatur</a>, and the Parco Ciani (a park spanning 63000 sqm) near the lake. You can also visit Foxtown, the luxury outlet mall in Mendrisio.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3. Golden Pass Express</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/goldern-pass6.webp" alt="Goldern Pass Express" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Slightly lesser known than the previous two trains covered but just as beautiful a journey, is the one on the <a href="/mountain-excursion/57-goldenpass-express" class="lnks" target="_blank">Golden Pass Express.</a> Connecting Interlaken in the Bernese Oberland to <a href="/blog/montreux-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">Montreux</a> on Lake Geneva, this journey takes you past Alpine peaks and shimmering lakes to the palm-lined shores of Lake Geneva.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Classes:</b> There are three classes on offer- 2nd class, 1st class and Prestige class.<br />
                                            The 2nd class cabins have panoramic windows and two seats on each side of the aisle.<br />
                                            The 1st class cabins have slightly larger panoramic windows and two seats in one column and one seat in one column giving it a more spacious feel.<br />
                                            The Prestige class also has a 2+1 seating, but the seats have an elevation, giving a better view. In addition, the seats can be rotated to face the direction of travel and are leather-bound and heated for ultimate comfort.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Duration:</b> The journey from Interlaken to Montreux takes roughly 3.15 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Frequency:</b> There are 4 services in each direction all year round.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Reservation:</b> The train journey is covered by the Swiss Travel Pass. If you already hold the pass, then all you need is a reservation. The reservations cost Sfr 20 (1st and 2nd class) and SFr 49 (Prestige class).<br />
                                            1st and 2nd class cabins do not mandatorily require a reservation. However, a reservation is highly recommended in the high season and can be purchased <a href="/mountain-excursion/57-goldenpass-express" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Along the way:</b><br />
                                            <b>Interlaken:</b> Set between the two lakes of Thun and Brienz, this picturesque town is one of the most popular resorts in the country. It is the base for mountain excursions like the <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="lnks" target="_blank">Jungfraujoch</a> and <a href="/mountain-excursion/3-schilthorn" class="lnks" target="_blank">Schilthorn</a> and a hub for adventure activities like paragliding and skydiving.<br />
                                            One can also visit picturesque Swiss villages around Interlaken, such as Lauterbrunnen, Iseltwald, and Grindelwald(the base for the <a href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class="lnks" target="_blank">Grindelwald First</a> excursion).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Spiez:</b> This beautiful town along Lake Thun is known for the Schloss Spiez (castle), a picturesque bay and vineyards. If you are doing a day trip on the Golden Pass Express, you can choose to do the return on regular trains and get off to explore Spiez.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Gstaad:</b> This town with its beautiful chalets and flower bedecked balconies has been known to attract the rich and famous to holiday and even stay there. It has a lovely pedestrian main street dotted with designer boutiques, gourmet restaurants and cafes. In winter, it is a much sought-after skiing destination.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Montreux:</b> The lakeside town along the shores of Lake Geneva can be a base from which to travel to nearby regions. Visit the Chillon Castle, Switzerland's most visited monument, take a photo with the statue of Freddie Mercury that proudly stands along the lake promenade, or even make a day trip to Lausanne or Geneva.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4. Gotthard Panorama Express</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/Gotthard5.webp" alt="Gotthard" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            The <a href="/mountain-excursion/58-gotthard-panorama-express" class="lnks" target="_blank">Gotthard Panorama Express</a> is probably the most unique Swiss panoramic journey. It is a combination of a boat and train which connects the town of <a href="/blog/lucerne-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">Lucerne</a> in central Switzerland to  Lugano in the country's south.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Stepping onto the historical steamboat gives a sense of stepping into the pages of a Mark Twain novel. Once you step off at Fluelen, you will transfer to the Gotthard Panorama Express, which will take you via the famous Gotthard tunnel to Lugano.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Classes:</b> The boat offers both 1st and 2nd class but the train offers only 1st class seating.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Duration:</b> The boat journey from Lucerne to Fluelen takes 2.45 hours and the train journey from Fluelen to Lugano takes 2.30 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Frequency:</b> There is only one service per day (excluding Mondays) in each direction, typically from mid-April to mid-October.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Reservations:</b> The Swiss Travel Pass covers the entire route. The boat can be boarded without a reservation. However, the train needs a reservation, which costs SFr 24 and can be purchased <a href="/mountain-excursion/58-gotthard-panorama-express" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a> Since it is a 1st class train, you will also need to buy a 'class upgrade' if you hold a 2nd class pass.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Along the way:</b><br />
                                            <b>Lucerne:</b> This charming town known as the 'Gateway to Central Switzerland' is home to some of the most iconic structures of the country - the gorgeous wooden Keppelbrucke (Chapel Bridge) which is the oldest covered wooden bridge in Europe and the Lion Monument; a giant sculpture of a dying lion pierced with a sword.<br />
                                            Lucerne is also the starting point of the very popular mountain excursions- <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="lnks" target="_blank">Mt. Titlis</a> and <a href="/mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class="lnks" target="_blank">Mt. Pilatus.</a> It is also home to the <a href="/mountain-excursion/35-swiss-transport-museum" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Museum of Transport</a>,  Switzerland's most visited museum.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Church of Wassen:</b> Before the train enters the Gotthard Tunnel, it makes two turning loops that give you a view of the church of this little town called Wassen. The church is seen from 3 different angles and elevations and has become a symbolic image of this portion of the journey.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Gotthard Tunnel:</b> The reason for mentioning a tunnel in this section may seem a bit odd. However, as you pass by the tunnel, you are entertained with some storytelling via illustrative panels and light effects that tell you the history of the Gotthard Railways and the engineering feat of the tunnel. I found this really unique.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Bellinzona:</b> Soon after exiting the tunnel,  you reach the capital of Ticino, Bellinzona. The place is known for its three medieval castles- Castelgrande, Montebello and Sasso Corbaro- part of the UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Lugano:</b> As already described under the Bernina Express.<br />
                                            In addition, if you have some time in Lugano, you can visit Bellinzona (roughly 20 minutes by train) as a day trip from here.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5. Lucerne-Interlaken Express</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/lucerne-and-titlis-snow-experience-5.webp" alt="Lucerne and Titlis Snow Experience" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Connecting Interlaken, surrounded by mountains, to the lakeside town of Lucerne, the premium <a href="/mountain-excursion/56-luzern-interlaken-express" class="lnks" target="_blank">Lucerne-Interlaken Express</a> is probably one that every traveller can easily fit into their program. Unlike other panoramic trains, it offers great frequency and does not require any expensive reservations to be made well in advance. It may be a smallish journey in terms of duration, but it is so big on the views!
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Classes:</b> The train offers 1st and 2nd class cabins. Both classes offer panoramic windows and are equally comfortable (in my opinion). However, if you prefer a slightly quieter atmosphere and a little bit more legroom, you can opt for 1st class.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Duration:</b> The journey from Luzern to Interlaken Ost takes roughly 1.50 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Frequency:</b> There are hourly trains in each direction from around 6 am to 8 pm all year round.  You can also consider combining the Lucerne-Interlaken Express with the Golden Pass Express and continue onward from Interlaken to Montreux.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Reservations:</b> The Swiss Travel Pass covers the journey. Reservations are not necessarily required but recommended in high season. If you wish to reserve, costs differ per season, range from SFr 12 to Sfr 16 and can be purchased <a href="/mountain-excursion/56-luzern-interlaken-express" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Along the Way:</b><br />
                                            <b>Interlaken:</b> As described above under the Golden Pass Express.<br />
                                            It would be nice to have a couple of nights here so that you can cover the lovely Bernese Oberland region and its most popular attractions like the <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="lnks" target="_blank">Jungfraujoch-Top of Europe</a> and <a href="/mountain-excursion/2-harder-kulm" class="lnks" target="_blank">Harder Kulm.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Brunig pass:</b> At Meiringen, you find the train reversing before heading towards the Brunig Pass. At 1008 metres, this is the highest point on the journey with great views over the lush forested surroundings. The train switches from its normal mode and engages its cogwheel technology to navigate the steep incline across the pass.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Lakes:</b> Depending on the direction of the journey, you will either start or end the journey, passing the shores of the shimmering turquoise blue waters of Lake Brienz.<br />
                                            Among the other gorgeous lakes along the way is the Lungerersee (Lake Lungern), surrounded by verdant forests and rolling hills. The Alpnachersee (Lake Alpnach) is near the south of Lake Lucerne and close to Alpnachstad, from where you take the steepest cogwheel train to <a href=" /mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class="lnks" target="_blank">Mt Pilatus.</a> Finally the Vierwaldstattersee (Lake Lucerne) is surrounded by mountains like Mount Rigi and Burgenstok and across which stands the most iconic Chapel Bridge.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Mount-Pilatus-medium2.webp" alt="Mount Pilatus">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mount Pilatus</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Lucerne:</b> As described above under the Gotthard Panorama Express.<br />
                                            Whether you start or end your journey here, give yourself the time to explore this historic town and some of the famous mountains surrounding it.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>

                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6. Voralpen Express</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/voralpen-express.webp" alt="Voralpen Express" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            If you think all panoramic train journeys are about seeing 4000-metre-high snowbound Alpine peaks, think again. Lesser-known and less touristy than the above trains, the Voralpen Express connects Lucerne in central Switzerland to St. Gallen in Eastern Switzerland. The journey takes you past forests, flower-filled meadows and traditional Swiss villages. Its hourly operation between the towns enables you to hop on without a reservation. Keep in mind that there are no fancy panoramic windows or onboard commentary but that doesn't make the journey any less stunning.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Classes:</b> The train has 1st and 2nd class carriages. The first class is a bit quieter and more spacious.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Duration:</b> The distance of 125 km is covered in 2.15 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Frequency:</b> There are hourly trains in each direction all year round.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Reservations:</b> The journey is covered under the Swiss Travel Pass, and you do not need a reservation.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Along the way:</b><br />
                                            St. Gallen: This town has a UNESCO World Heritage listed Abbey District. The Convent of St. Gall is the centrepiece of this city. The library is one of the richest and oldest ones in the world. The town also has a charming Altstadt(Old Town) and a Wildpark featuring native Swiss animals like marmots. 
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Rapperswil:</b> Rapperswil, also known as the City of Roses, is a beautiful lakeside town. The town boasts of public gardens with over 15000 rose bushes, a charming Old Town and a 13th-century castle perched on a hilltop with views over Lake <a href="/blog/zurich-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">Zurich.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Arth Goldau:</b> A tiny town but a vital railway junction, Arth Goldau is at the base of Mount Rigi, also known as the Queen of the Mountains. It also has a nature and wildlife park with various native and wild animals.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Lucerne:</b> As described above in the Gotthard Panorama Express. You'll likely spend a few nights in this charming lakeside town. Stroll along the scenic promenade, sample treats from local chocolatiers, and capture unforgettable photos of the iconic Chapel Bridge. And of course, don’t miss the surrounding mountains—they beckon to be explored.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            This sums up my favourite panoramic train journeys. I hope this helps you plan your next trip to this fantastic country. Start by purchasing your Swiss Travel Pass and choosing one or more of the above train journeys that fit your program. Then, just sit back, relax (with a good Swiss wine), and let Switzerland work its magic.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>Protips:</b><br />
                                            As you can see in the above list, the Swiss Travel Pass is valid on all the panoramic trains. It gives you a great price advantage since you are not required to purchase pricey tickets and just pay for the reservations instead. Besides the advantage of the panoramic trains, the Swiss Travel Pass gives unlimited travel on all kinds of public transport, entrance to hundreds of museums and great discounts on all major mountain excursions.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Regarding the reservations, you can opt for reservations in the class of your pass. If you have a 2nd-class pass, you can opt for a 2nd-class reservation. However, if you hold a 2nd-class pass and wish to travel 1st class on the panoramic trains, you have to purchase what is known as a 'class upgrade'.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>

                            <%--Top_10_Activities_in_Switzerland_[Updated 2025]--%>
                            <div class="bd-padding" id="div_top_activities_in_switzerland" runat="server" visible="false">
                                <ul>
                                    <li class="in-view">
                                        <p>
                                            Switzerland - the land of white Alps, turquoise waters, chocolate, cheese and endless possibilities. This little landlocked country offers so much and on so many levels.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There is something for every type of traveller: lazy, enthusiastic, adventure sports buff, snow bunny, old and young.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Having travelled to it multiple times, here are my personal <b>top ten</b> <a href="/blog/top-activities-in-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">activities in Switzerland</a> with details on how to get there, what to do there, the cost and more.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <i>Tip: Almost all of the activities give you a great discount with the <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Travel Pass</a> so make sure you have one with you.</i>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A quick glimpse of my favourites before we dive into the details: 
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Jungfraujoch- Top of Europe.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Mount Titlis- The world’s first revolving cable car ‘Rotair’.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Matterhorn Glacier Paradise - The world’s most photographed mountain.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Grindelwald First - Top of Adventure.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Glacier Express Train - The slowest Express train in the world.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Swiss Museum of Transport -  Entertainment and education.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Lindt Home of Chocolate - where sweet dreams come alive.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Tandem Paragliding - the best views over Interlaken.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	St Beatus caves - A magical, mystical underground world.

                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            ●	Bernina Express Train - From snowy mountains to Mediterranean warmth.

                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="1" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">1. Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            Jungfraujoch - known as the Top of Europe is the most popular mountain excursion in the Bernese Oberland region and a convenient day trip from Interlaken or even Lucerne. It is known for its views over the Aletsch Glacier, its impressive Ice Palace and the highest railway station in Europe, located at an elevation of 3454 metres.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Jungfrau-Top-of-Europe-medium1.webp" alt="Jungfrau Top of Europe medium" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Closest town:</b></h3>
                                            Interlaken
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Getting there:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Option 1: From Interlaken station via two train changes in Lauterbrunnen or Grindelwald and Kleine Scheidegg.The total time taken is 2 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Option 2: By train to Grindelwald, followed by cable car to the Eigergletscher station, and then once again on the train to the peak. Total time taken is 1.15 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Cost:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A full fare adult ticket costs SFr 224. However, if you hold a <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Travel Pass</a>, you can get the same at a discounted rate of SFr 149. See the complete fare list and book your tickets <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Things to do:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Jungfrau Panorama:</u></h4>
                                            A 360-degree cinematic experience. A surreal virtual tour through the snowy mountainous terrain.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Sphinx Terrace:</u></h4>
                                            Viewing terrace for the best views of the surrounding Alps and the Aletsch Glacier from an elevation of 3571 metres.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Alpine Sensation:</u></h4>
                                            A 250-metre tunnel showcasing the history of the Jungfrau railways and the people who built it.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Snow Fun Park:</u></h4>
                                            Enjoy activities like snow tubing, ziplining and snowboarding at this summer park (typically May through October. Activities have to be paid for additionally).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Ice Palace:</u></h4>
                                            Walk through a frosty tunnel with fantastic ice sculptures, some of the birds and animals literally "frozen in time". 
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: Dress appropriately for the -3 degrees Celsius temperature inside the tunnel.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There are railings provided to avoid slipping on the hard, icy surface.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Time required:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A minimum of 2 hours for the sights at the peak. More if you plan on hiking or going to a snow fun park.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Shopping / Restaurants:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Top of Europe shop offers souvenirs, snow globes, Swiss Army knives and more. Head to the Lindt Chocolate Heaven for sweet cravings. There are also several restaurants, including a Bollywood-themed Indian one.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>When to travel:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Jungfraujoch is open 365 days a year and is equally spectacular in the summer and winter.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/blog/jungfraujoch.png" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Jungfrau</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">2. Mount Titlis</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            Not far from the city of lights, Lucerne, is the amazing Mount Titlis. Standing at a height of 3020 metres, <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="lnks" target="_blank">Mount Titlis</a> offers amazing 360-degree views, fun activities and the world's first rotating cable car - Titlis Rotair.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Mount-Titlis-medium1.webp" alt="Mount Titlis medium" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Closest Town:</b></h3>
                                            Engelberg
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Getting there:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Train ride from Lucerne to Engelberg- 45 minutes.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Walk or take a public bus from Engelberg to the Titlis Valley station. From here, travel via two cable cars (including Titlis Rotair - the world's first revolving cable car) to the peak.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Cost:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A full-fare adult ticket costs SFr 114 (including an ice flyer chairlift ride). However, if you hold a Swiss Travel Pass, you can get the same at a discounted rate of SFr 63. See the complete fare list and book your tickets <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Things to do:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Titlis Rotair</u></h4>
                                            - the world's first revolving cable. During the journey, the Rotair completes one full rotation, giving you fabulous views of craggy cliffs, deep crevasses and snowy fields.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Viewing platform</u></h4>
                                            : Get amazing views of the surrounding snowy landscape.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Glacier Cave:</u></h4>
                                            A 150-metre long tunnel 10 metres below the glacier. The cave is adorned with ice sculptures and  lit in different colours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: the cave is maintained at subzero temperature so dress accordingly and tread carefully.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Titlis Cliff Walk:</u></h4>
                                            At 3041 metres, this is Europe's highest suspension bridge. Brave the 100 metre walk and enjoy views from 500 metres above the ground.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: There are footprint signs along the bridge. If you stand on these, you will be looking into a camera that will take a photograph from an angle you would not be able to get. You can collect your photograph by paying for it at the photoshop.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Ice Flyer Chairlift:</u></h4>
                                            A chair lift across the glacier with views of deep crevasses and snowfields. In the summer, it takes you to Glacier Park, and in the winter, to the ski slopes.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Glacier Park:</u></h4>
                                            Reach via the Ice Flyer Chairlift to try your hand at snow activities like sledging and snow tubing. The park is only open during the summer (mid May to early Aug).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>SnowXpark at Trubsee:</u></h4>
                                            Situated at the midway point of Trubsee (along the first cable car ride), the park offers activities like sledging, ziplining and electric snow vehicles like the Moonbike.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: Make sure to check the opening dates, times and availabilities of these activities.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Time required:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            One to two hours to cover the main attractions at the peak. More if you want to cover the ones at Trubsee. Keep in mind that cable car lines can also be long and take time.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>When to travel:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The excursion operates all year round but they do have a maintenance closure typically for around 2 weeks in November.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Shopping / Restaurants:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There is a shop offering souvenirs and chocolates in plenty. A photo studio offers the chance to don a typical Swiss dress and have your photo taken ( not cheap, but a good souvenir to have).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Choose from the Titlis Panorama restaurant or the Titlis Panorama self-serve restaurant as per your budget.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/titlis-rotair.jpg?ver=1" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mt Titlis</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">3. Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            Located in the quintessentially Swiss town of <a href="/blog/zermatt-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">Zermatt</a> is the Matterhorn - the most photographed mountain in the world!!. There are various ways to get the perfect pics of this imposing massif, but by far the best views are from the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise (also known as the Kleine Matterhorn). Located at 3883 metres, it is the highest cable car station in Europe.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/Matterhorn1.webp" alt="Matterhorn" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Closest town:</b></h3>
                                            Zermatt
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>How to get there:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Walk around 20 minutes or take a bus (number 571/2) from Zermatt station to the Matterhorn Express valley station. You need to take 3 cable cars to reach the peak via Furi and Trockner Steg.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Cost:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A full-fare adult ticket costs SFr 95. However if you hold a Swiss Travel Pass you can get the same at a discounted rate of SFr 48. See the complete fare list and book your tickets <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Things to do:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Crystal Ride:</u></h4>
                                            A few special glass bottom cable cars embellished with Swarovski crystals.  Choose this ride on the way from Trockner Steg to the peak for amazing views over the Theodul Glacier.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Note: The Crystal cable cars attract a separate fee and are only available in the summer. In the winter, they need to be requested and are available for groups of 10 or more only.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Viewing platform:</u></h4>
                                            Get a 360-degree view that stretches across Switzerland, Italy and France. On a clear day, you can see the Jungfrau, Eiger and Monch in the Bernese Oberland and the Mont Blanc in France.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Glacier Palace:</u></h4>
                                            Located 15 metres under the glacier, this is probably one of the best Ice Palaces you will see. Enjoy the ice sculptures, a slide-through ice tunnel and great lighting effects.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Cinema Lounge:</u></h4>
                                            This is Europe's highest cinema. Step in and watch some interesting short films on Zermatt's fascinating Alpine world.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Zermatt Snow Park:</u></h4>
                                            A small area on the Theodul glacier and the only area where you can ski in the summer.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Matterhorn Alpine Crossing:</u></h4>
                                            Cross countries by cable car! Since 2023, the Matterhorn Alpine Crossing started in 2023, has made it possible to travel from the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise to to Cervinia in Italy by cable car via the Testa Grigia peak.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            You can either do the full journey, or travel upto Testa Grigia and back (1.6 kms) for fantastic views over the Theodul Glacier.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Time required:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            You should have at least 3 to 4 hours in hand for this excursion. Keep in mind that the journey to and from the peak takes 45 minutes each.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>When to Travel:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Matterhorn Glacier Paradise is open all year round and is equally thrilling in both summer and winter.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Shopping / Restaurants:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Souvenirs, chocolates and local delicacies can be found at the Peak Shop.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Restaurant Matterhorn Glacier Paradise offers guests a wide variety of local and international cuisine with the added topping of the view from 3883 metres.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tips:
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Matterhorn Glacier Paradise is snowbound year round, so prepare well for that.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Since it is a popular skiing destination, it is as crowded in the winter months as it is in the summer, so lines for cable cars may be long.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Matterhorn-Glacier-Paradise-medium2.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Matterhorn Glacier Paradise</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">4. Grindelwald First</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            If you are looking for a mountain full of fun, here you have it. The First in Grindelwald offers mountain views, lakes and tons of fun stuff. This one ranks among my top family activities in Switzerland. This is probably the only mountain with one way to ascend and plenty of fun ways to descend.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/Grindelwald5.webp" alt="GstaadSaanenGruyereBroc_img" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Closest town:</b></h3>
                                            Grindelwald
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>How to get there:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Walk from Grindelwald station to the Firstbahn station and hop on to the cable car.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Reach the top in 25 minutes via two mid stations Bort and Schreckfeld.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Cost:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            You can either purchase a ticket for the cable car or purchase a ticket inclusive of one or more activities. Let us presume that you will want to do at least one activity so let's go with that -
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A full-fare adult ticket with one activity costs SFr 82. However, if you hold a <a target="_blank" href="/swiss-travel-pass" class='lnks'>Swiss Travel Pass</a> you can get the same at a discounted rate of SFr 54. See the complete fare list and book your tickets <a href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Things to do:</b>
                                            </h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Views and Hike to Bachalpsee:</u></h4>
                                            The views from the First are simply beautiful.  You can also take a short hike (around 50 minutes) to Lake Bachalpsee. Enjoy the picnic spot or even swim in the lake in the summer months.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Cliff Walk by Tissot:</u></h4>
                                            A seemingly scary-looking metal walkway winding along the side of the cliff at 2168 metres with a viewing platform in the middle. This is included in the ticket cost.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>First Flyer:</u></h4>
                                            The First Flyer is 4 single seats that take you from the top of First to the Schreckfeld. Flying through the 800m cable at 84 km/h was really thrilling.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>First Glider:</u></h4>
                                            Get horizontally strapped to a massive eagle in groups of 4 and fly face down on the 800 metre long route at 72 km/h route.  Trust me guys, don't miss this one!!
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Mountain Cart:</u></h4>
                                            Ride down a 3 km route to Bort in what looks like a close-to-the-ground go-cart with really wide tyres.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Trottibike:</u></h4>
                                            The last leg of the descent can be done on the trottibike (which reminded me of the bikes that we used to ride as kids) Personally, I was exhausted by the time I reached this stage and so gave it a skip. However, it definitely looked like fun way to ride down a mountain.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Note: All of the above activities are to be paid for in addition to the cable car cost. If you intend to do all of them, it would be best to purchase tickets that include the activities.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The mountain cart and trottibike operate in the summer only (typically May through end October).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Keep in mind that all of these activities have age/weight/height restrictions as well.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Time required:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            5 to 6 hours if you want to do most or all of the above activities.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: In the summer months, try to arrive at the mountain between 8.30 to 9 am to beat the rush.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>When to Travel:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The gondolas are shut for maintenance typically from the end of October to the end of November. However, you are interested in all the activities like I was, the summer months would be the ideal time to travel.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Shopping / Restaurants:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There is a restaurant that offers a self-service area and an à la carte area. The Top of Europe shop at the peak offers souvenirs, Tissot watches, chocolates and more.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Grindelwald-First-medium3.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Grindelwald First</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">5. Glacier Express Train Ride</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            Just as famous as the Swiss mountains are the Swiss trains and among them, the Glacier Express stands out as 'Numero Uno' for sure. The train, the route, the scenery, the diverse terrain all just come together to make this one of my top activities in Switzerland.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Note: The Swiss Travel Pass covers the entire route of this train, but you do need a mandatory reservation and to pay for the same.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/GlacierExpress4.webp" alt="Glacier Express">
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>How to get there:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The train travels between the two ski resorts of Zermatt and St Moritz. You can reach either of these two towns comfortably from <a href="/blog/zurich-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">Zurich</a> (in fact, so many other towns in Switzerland as well).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Cost and classes:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            There are three classes on offer.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            2nd class which has 4 seats per row(2 on either side of the aisle).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            1st class which has three seats  per row (2 on one side of the aisle and one on the other).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            In both classes, seats face each other with a table in between.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Excellence Class with single seats only which makes it a window-seats only compartment.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tip: All classes have panoramic windows, so you will not miss out on the scenery in any of them.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            In 1st and 2nd classes, you can order a meal (and a fantastic one at that) at your seat.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Excellence Class comes with a 5-course meal, wines, and more all included.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            You need to purchase a seat plus a reservation. However, if you already have a Swiss Travel Pass, then the cost of the ticket (starting from SFr 159) is covered in it, and you only have to pay the price of the reservation. You can purchase the reservations and Swiss Travel Pass <a href="/mountain-excursion/43-glacier-express" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Time required:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The total journey time from Zermatt to St Moritz is 7.45 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A popular shorter segment is Zermatt to Chur, which takes around 5.30 hours. From Chur, you can also connect to Zurich in 1.15 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Route:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Glacier Express train travels from Zermatt to St Moritz and vice versa. Let's look at the sections along the way:
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Zermatt to Brig- passing rock faces of over 4000 metres.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Brig to Andermatt- passing through the V-shaped Rhone valley.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Andermatt to Chur - takes you to the highest point of 2034 metres at the Oberalp Pass.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Chur to St.Moritz - crossing the famous and picture perfect Landwasser Viaduct.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Gastronomy:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Excellence Class:  Start with an aperitif platter and champagne. The meal is a 5-course menu of local delicacies. For drinks, there are Swiss wines and cocktails from the bar.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            First class and Second Class: You can order an excellent meal (additionally paid for), which will be served at your seat.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/glacier-express-medium1.webp?v=12" alt="Glacier Express">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Glacier Express</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/43-glacier-express" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">6. Swiss Museum of Transport</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            For a fun family day, head to Switzerland's most visited museum, Verkehrshaus der Schweiz or the Swiss Museum of Transport. Just in case you think that a museum based on transport may not be your thing or may be boring, think again…I am so glad I did!
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Other than showcasing the history of transport, and that too every mode of transport ( air, rail, water, road and even space) this fantastic museum is filled with fun stuff for all ages.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Swiss-Transport-Museum-medium1.webp" alt="Swiss Transport Museum medium" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Closest town:</b></h3>
                                            Lucerne
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>How to get there:</b></h3>
