                                            A nice way to get there would be to take a boat from the Bahnhofquai (boat landing) just outside <a href="/blog/lucerne-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">Lucerne</a> main station and disembark at the stop Verkehrshaus - Lido station. However, you can also take a bus (numbers 6,8 or 24) or even a train and get off at the stops with the same name.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Cost:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            A full-fare adult ticket (day pass including all attractions) costs SFr 62. However, if you hold a <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Travel Pass</a>, you can get it at a discounted rate of SFr 45. See the complete fare list and book your tickets <a href="/mountain-excursion/35-swiss-transport-museum" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Things to do:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Switzerland's largest cinema screen:</u></h4>
                                            A movie theatre with a screen measuring 500m2, which means you truly see an XXL sized movie.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Planetarium:</u></h4>
                                            Entertainment and education for adults and kids. Learn all about our starry skies under the planetarium dome.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Swiss Chocolate Adventure:</u></h4>
                                            Have fun discovering the history and process of chocolate making. Learn, see, smell and even taste chocolate on this short but sensual adventure.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Museum:</u></h4>
                                            The museum displays over 3000 articles related to transport spread over its various display areas and the Arena, a large open area with interactive exhibits and activities.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Red Bull The Edge:</u></h4>
                                            Feel the thrill of scaling the Matterhorn on this virtual reality experience unlike any other.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><b>Time required:</b></h4>
                                            Around 4 to 5 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>When to travel:</b></h3>
                                            The museum is open 365 days a year which is particularly helpful if you want to do some indoor activity on chilly or snowy days.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Shopping / Restaurants:</b></h3>
                                            The museum shop offers Lindt chocolates, souvenirs  and toy models of cars, aeroplanes and other modes of transport.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The restaurants Brasserie and Mercato (self service) offer a wide range of foods from local cuisine to coffee and cake.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Swiss-Transport-Museum-medium3.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Swiss Transport Museum</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/35-swiss-transport-museum" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">7. Lindt Home of Chocolate</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            If you love chocolate as much as I do, don't think twice about including the <a href="/mountain-excursion/47-lindt-chocolate" class="lnks" target="_blank">Lindt Home of Chocolate</a> in your program. This is where you discover everything there is about chocolate. Follow the journey from cocoa bean to the packed product in the most interactive way. This state-of-the-art facility will truly tantalise the senses and ignite your passion for chocolate.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/lindt1.webp" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Closest town:</b></h3>
                                            Zurich
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>How to get there:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Situated in Kilchberg, just south of Zurich, you can get there by boat, train or bus.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Boat: From Burkiplatz to Kilchberg (See) ZH and a 10-minute walk to the venue.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Bus: From Burkiplatz to the stop Lindt and Sprungli  (trust Switzerland to have a bus stop named after a chocolate company).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Train: The S8 or S24 line from Zurich main station to the station Kilchberg ZH and a 10-minute walk from there.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Cost:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            An adult ticket costs SFr 17 and a child aged 8 to 15 costs SFr 10. Kids under 8 years of age go free. See the complete fare list and book your tickets <a href="/mountain-excursion/47-lindt-chocolate" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Things to do:</b> </h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Chocolate Fountain:</u></h4>
                                            An eye-catching, over 9-metre-tall chocolate fountain that stands in the centre of the white entrance hall had me feeling like the child in the movie Charlie and the Chocolate Factory. The fountain carries 1400 litres of molten chocolate!!
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Chocolate tour:</u></h4>
                                            Embark on an interactive experience and learn everything about chocolate. Trace the evolution of chocolate, cocoa cultivation, its journey to Europe and the fine art of chocolate making by Swiss chocolatiers. After this comes the best part...grab some spoons and start tasting a few types of chocolate ( dark, white and milk).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Chocolate Shop:</u></h4>
                                            Go wild in the biggest Lindt chocolate shop in the world (500 m2). There is no way you will leave this place without a big bag of chocolates.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Chocolate making course:</u></h4>
                                            Prebook a chocolate making course and learn from the Lindt Master chocolatiers.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Cafe:</u></h4>
                                            Grab some fine Swiss coffee and pair it with some delectable desserts like waffles and ice cream…topped with chocolate, of course!
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Time required:</b></h3>
                                            Around 2 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>When to travel:</b></h3>
                                            The museum is open almost all year round, except for 2 days during Christmas and 2 days for maintenance (once in May and once in November).
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/lindt-chocolate-medium1.webp" alt=" Jungfraujoch included in budget trip to Switzerland" />
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Lindt Home Chocolate</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/47-lindt-chocolate" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">8. Tandem Paragliding from Beatenberg</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            Interlaken in the Bernese Oberland area is quite an adventure sports hub. It is popular for adventures like helicopter skydiving, airplane skydiving, white water rafting and paragliding. Personally, I am not much of an adventure sports buff, but when I heard that I could do paragliding accompanied by an expert, I was all for giving it a go, and I am so glad I did. It was an experience of a lifetime.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="https://d3rr2gvhjw0wwy.cloudfront.net/uploads/activity_galleries/360/2000x2000-0-70-04ab12675e1e960959b8d2cef20313ce.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Closest town:</b></h3>
                                            Interlaken
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>How to get there:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The activity providers typically pick you up from any hotel or a central location in Interlaken and take you to the flight's starting point (Beatenberg).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Cost:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The cost can vary depending on the season and the timeslot chosen. It is usually upwards of SFr 180 per adult.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Details:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The ride from <a href="/blog/interlaken-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">Interlaken</a> to Beatenberg takes around 20 minutes.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Get briefed on the safety and take-off/landing procedures along the way.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            You take flight at 1350m and have an amazing view of the Bernese Oberland, the sparkling Lake Thun and the peaks of the Jungfrau, Monch and Eiger.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Your tandem partner will take photographs of you, which you can then purchase upon landing in a field in the centre of Interlaken.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Note: This activity has age/weight restrictions. Kids under 6 are not allowed to participate.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Time required:</b></h3>
                                            1.15 hours (airborne time is between 10 and 20 minutes).
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="https://d3rr2gvhjw0wwy.cloudfront.net/uploads/activity_headers/360/2000x2000-0-70-8aec8fdd78511f5f0f489952f55801a9.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Paragliding Summer</p>
                                                <a href="/adventure-tours/paragliding-summer/?id=act_e8172ddc-7958-4e46-a56e-f887cffa60aa" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">9. St Beatus Caves</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            Located high along a cliffside just outside of Interlaken, the <a href="/attractions/ticket-beatus-caves/?id=act_874e695e-d9b6-4929-a09f-8a4e7fdd7e79" class="lnks" target="_blank">St Beatus</a> caves are famous for their natural beauty and the legends associated with them. According to legend, a mighty dragon who once lived deep within the caves was slain by the travelling pilgrim St Beatus.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Today, out of the 14 kilometres of the caves that have been excavated, 1 kilometre is open to the public.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="https://contentapi-swissactivities.imgix.net/contentapi.swissactivities/BHG_Wasserfall03_2023_bce647100b.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Closest town:</b></h3>
                                            Interlaken.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>
                                                <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>How to get there:</b></h3>
                                            </b>You can conveniently reach the caves from Interlaken by bus in 25 minutes. The bus is covered by your Swiss Travel Pass.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>
                                                <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Cost:</b></h3>
                                            </b>An adult ticket costs SFr 20, and a child from 6 to 16 years costs SFr 12 .
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>
                                                <h3><b>Things to do:</b></h3>
                                            </b>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Marvel at nature:</u></h4>
                                            The walk takes you through the caves, grottos and passages while passing by waterfalls and streams. Marvel at the stalactites and stalagmites extending from the floor and ceiling like giant icicles.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Cave Museum:</u></h4>
                                            Adjacent to the entrance, the Cave Museum is a good starting point to learn about the legend, the area's geology and the cave system's historic findings.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Guided or Self-Guided tour:</u></h4>
                                            Take an audio-guided tour (available in multiple languages) to learn about the various exhibits, or opt for one with an expert guide who will explain the history and geology of the caves. There are also information boards along the way.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Picnic spot and park:</u></h4>
                                            Spend some quality time with the family at the dragon-themed park and enjoy a picnic at the picnic spot.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h4 class="inlinetxt"><u>Sunday Brunch:</u></h4>
                                            Every Sunday, the restaurant Stein Und Sein offers a "Brunch on the Rock". The buffet brunch with sausages, cheeses, fruits and desserts can be enjoyed with views over the surrounding Alpine terrain and Lake Thun. Unfortunately, I was not around on a Sunday, so I have not tried this out myself. The brunch is quite popular and is best pre-booked.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>
                                                <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Time required:</b></h3>
                                            </b>1 to 2 hours 
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Note: The walk through the caves involves a total of 297 steps and therefore is not suitable for wheelchairs or prams. 
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <b>
                                                <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>When to travel:</b></h3>
                                            </b>The caves are open all year round. 
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="https://contentapi-swissactivities.imgix.net/contentapi.swissactivities/BHG_Wasserfall03_2023_bce647100b.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Ticket Beatus Caves</p>
                                                <a href="/attractions/ticket-beatus-caves/?id=act_874e695e-d9b6-4929-a09f-8a4e7fdd7e79" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10" class="in-view">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">10. Bernina Express</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            I cannot help but end my list of top activities in Switzerland with another fabulous Swiss scenic train- The signature scarlet Bernina Express. This train connects the towns of Chur and St Moritz to Tirano in Italy. In the summer, the journey extends by bus to Lugano. The UNESCO World Heritage-listed train journey covers a spectacularly scenic route crossing 55 tunnels and 196 bridges.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Note: The Swiss Travel Pass covers the route of this train, but you do need to make a mandatory reservation and pay for the same.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/BerninaExpress5.webp" alt="A cruise boat on the calm waters of Lake Thun, surrounded by Swiss mountains." />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3 class="inlinetxt"><b>Closest town:</b></h3>
                                            You can start the journey from Chur or St Moritz. Both these towns can easily be reached from Zurich.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Cost and classes:<b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The train offers 1st and 2nd class seating.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            2nd class has four seats per row(two on either side of the aisle).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            1st class has three seats  per row (two on one side of the aisle and one on the other).
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            In both classes, the seats face each other, with a table in between.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Both classes have panoramic windows, so you will not miss the scenery in either of them.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The ticket cost from Chur to Tirano is SFr 66 in 2nd class and SFr 113 in 1st class. Your Swiss Travel Pass covers this. However, you need to purchase a reservation fee of SFr 32. You can see the complete list of reservation costs and book them <a href="/mountain-excursion/42-bernina-express" class="lnks" target="_blank">here.</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Time required:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The journey from Chur to Tirano (Bernina Express long route) takes 4 to 4.5 hours. 
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The journey from St. Moritz to Tirano (Bernina Express short route) takes 2.5 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The bus journey from Tirano to Lugano takes 3 hours.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Route highlights</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Chur to St Moritz route takes you via some stunning scenery through 55 tunnels and over 196 bridges. Some of the highlights along the way.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Landwasser Viaduct: Arguably one of the most recognised rail structures, resting on its five arches at a height of 65 metres.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Bernina pass: This is where the train reaches its highest elevation at 2253 metres, with breathtaking views over the snow-capped peaks and the Morteratsch glacier.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Brusio Spiral Viaduct: Between Poschiavo and Tirano, the train descends around a tight right-hand curve on this icon of the Rhaetian Railway. The viaduct has nine arches, each one 10 metres in diameter.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <h3><b>Gastronomy:</b></h3>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Bernina Express does not have a catering car. However, it does have a snack and beverage service for both first and second class. Carrying some food along would also be nice( since the catering service is quite pricey).
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/bernina-express-medium1.webp?v=12" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Bernina Express</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/42-bernina-express" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            So there you have it. My top 10 activities in Switzerland. Hope this inspires you to pack your bag, grab your Swiss Travel Pass and get ready to experience some or all of my favourites in your next Swiss holiday.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </div>

                                <ul>
                                    <li class="in-view">
                                        <p>
                                            Switzerland is an absolute haven for adventure seekers. With its varied landscape of mountains, lakes, hiking trails, and slopes, it offers activities of all types, at all levels, and for all seasons. Almost all of the popular resorts, such as Interlaken, Zermatt, St. Moritz and Lucerne, offer amazing adventure activities.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Listed here are some of the <a href="/blog/adventure-activities-in-switzerland" class="lnks" target="_blank">adventure activities in Switzerl   and</a> that you can easily fit into your Switzerland program, regardless of whether you are doing a <a href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-3-days" class="lnks" target="_blank">3-day itinerary</a>, a <a href="/blog/switzerland-itinerary-6-days" class="lnks" target="_blank">6-day itinerary</a> or a more detailed, longer program.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            For ease of planning, the activities are categorised by the resorts that typically offer them. However, you can do many of the experiences from multiple places (not only the ones mentioned)
                                        </p>
                                        <p><b>Interlaken:</b></p>
                                        <p>
                                            Tandem Paragliding<br />
                                            Jetboat Ride<br />
                                            Helicopter Skydive<br />
                                            Ropes Park Interlaken
                                        </p>

                                        <p><b>Grindelwald:</b></p>
                                        <p>
                                            Grindelwald First<br />
                                            Glacier Canyon
                                        </p>

                                        <p><b>Zermatt:</b></p>
                                        <p>
                                            5 Lakes Hike<br />
                                            Skiing<br />
                                            Snowshoe Hike<br />
                                            Heliskiing<br />
                                            Sledging
                                        </p>

                                        <p><b>St Moritz:</b></p>
                                        <p>
                                            Bobsledding<br />
                                            Hiking
                                        </p>

                                        <p><b>Lucerne:</b></p>
                                        <p>
                                            Mount Titlis<br />
                                            Mount Pilatus<br />
                                            Aquatic activities on Lake Lucerne<br />
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="1">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Tandem Paragliding</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="https://d3rr2gvhjw0wwy.cloudfront.net/uploads/activity_headers/360/2000x2000-0-70-8aec8fdd78511f5f0f489952f55801a9.jpg" alt="cloudfront.net" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            This is probably the most popular activity in Interlaken. There are various adventure sports companies that offer scenic <a href="/adventure-tours/paragliding-summer/?id=act_e8172ddc-7958-4e46-a56e-f887cffa60aa" class="lnks" target="_blank">tandem paragliding</a> rides, allowing you to soar high above the scenic town, its turquoise lakes and surrounding mountains. Typically, you are picked up from your hotel or a central point in Interlaken and driven to a launch site in a nearby village such as Beatenberg, where you receive a briefing before takeoff. The airborne time is between 10 and 20 minutes and the views over Lake Thun and the Eiger, Monch and Jungfrau mountains are absolutely fantastic.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            If you have the whole day to spend in Interlaken, combine this with an excursion to the lovely <a href="/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe" class="lnks" target="_blank">Jungfraujoch-Top of Europe</a>.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="2">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Jetboat Ride</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="https://d3rr2gvhjw0wwy.cloudfront.net/uploads/activity_headers/305721/2000x2000-0-70-b6095d98a9ccd9a9eb156a1621643a5e.jpg" alt="" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Interlaken's lakes beckon to be explored. You can opt for a leisurely ferry ride across them or for a real adrenaline-pumping 45-minute <a href="/adventure-tours/scenic-jetboat-ride/?id=act_2ba016e1-514e-422c-b4f9-07884e6b6aa8" class="lnks" target="_blank">Jetboat ride</a>. The Jetboat pier located at Bonigen, is a short bus ride from Interlaken. Before takeoff, you are given a briefing and the necessary waterproof gear for the ride. Taking off with your captain, the ride takes you past scenic points like Iseltwald (now also famous as the location for various scenes from Crash Landing On You) and the thundering Giessbach Falls. Be prepared to have a blast and get splashed as the boat takes swift turns and 360-degree spins before getting you back to the starting point. Since almost any program to Switzerland will include Interlaken, you can easily incorporate this short but thrilling activity into any program.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="https://d3rr2gvhjw0wwy.cloudfront.net/uploads/activity_headers/305721/2000x2000-0-70-b6095d98a9ccd9a9eb156a1621643a5e.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">JetBoat</p>
                                                <a href="https://swisstours.com/adventure-tours/scenic-jetboat-ride/?id=act_2ba016e1-514e-422c-b4f9-07884e6b6aa8" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="3">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Helicopter Skydive</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="https://d3rr2gvhjw0wwy.cloudfront.net/uploads/activity_headers/249261/2000x2000-0-70-968395d7b8ce0f151432be924415a4a0.jpg" alt="cloudfront.net" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            While this activity may not be for everyone (definitely not for this writer 😣), if you have the nerves needed, it is something you will cherish forever. Gliding down over Interlaken with your parachute will give you the most unique views of the Eiger, Monch and Jungfrau and the two glistening lakes Thun and Brienz. A typical <a href="/adventure-tours/helicopter-skydive-from-interlaken/?id=act_860dadec-1eec-4dd4-9f41-34b8e01f44ae" class="lnks" target="_blank">helicopter skydive</a> program would offer a central pick-up point or a hotel pick-up. You are treated to a 10-minute scenic flight through the narrow Lutschental valley and the Schynige Platte mountain ridge before you get ready for your jump from roughly 14000 feet!! You will need approximately 2 hours in total for this activity. You can also consider adding another popular excursion, such as the <a href="/mountain-excursion/2-harder-kulm" class="lnks" target="_blank">Harder Kulm</a> in Interlaken, on the same day. In fact, an evening drink and snack atop the Harder Kulm would be the perfect end to an exhilarating day.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="https://d3rr2gvhjw0wwy.cloudfront.net/uploads/activity_headers/249261/2000x2000-0-70-968395d7b8ce0f151432be924415a4a0.jpg" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Helicopter Skydive from Interlaken</p>
                                                <a href="/adventure-tours/helicopter-skydive-from-interlaken/?id=act_860dadec-1eec-4dd4-9f41-34b8e01f44ae" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="4">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Ropes Park Interlaken</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="https://img.ecmaps.de/remote/.jpg?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdam.destination.one%2F192050%2Faed822cafd9cc98dd330f920dfacfaca3fb16fd761b0fb778ffb03b5e3918e8c%2F.jpg&scale=both&mode=crop&quality=90&width=1920&height=1080" alt="cloudfront.net" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Feel like Tarzan and Jane as you spend a great day with your family on this forest adventure. The park can be reached via a comfortable 15-minute walk from Interlaken West station or by bus from Interlaken East station. It offers nine courses of varying difficulty and over 150 different challenges, ranging from ground level to 23 metres. From toddlers to teenagers, there is something for everyone here.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="5">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Grindelwald First</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/Grindelwald5.webp" alt="Grindelwald" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Grindelwald First is also known as the Top of Adventure and definitely lives up to its moniker. It is the only mountain excursion that offers one way to ascend (by cable car) but four different and exciting ways to descend from it, and you have the option of choosing either one or all.<br />
                                            Start with the First Flyer, a zipline that has you securely fastened and flying through the 800m cable at 84 km/h.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The First Glider has you flying under the enormous wings of an eagle while being horizontally harnessed under it.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The Mountain Cart is similar to a go-cart but really close to the ground and with very wide tyres for safety. You can control the speed with the hydraulic brakes, but hey, don't forget you are here for the thrill.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Finally, the Trottibike will remind you of the bike that you rode as a child and will take you down the last leg of the descent.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Note: Make sure you have purchased the correct ticket inclusive of the number of activities that you want to do at the <a href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class="lnks" target="_blank">Grindelwald First</a>.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Grindelwald-First-medium3.webp" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Grindelwald First</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="6">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Glacier Canyon</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="https://d3rr2gvhjw0wwy.cloudfront.net/uploads/activity_headers/325590/2000x2000-0-70-1565b4f2c65244a4bf32c03f5ee69c8f.jpg" alt="cloudfront.net" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            A short bus ride from Grindelwald town centre (or a roughly 35-minute walk) takes you to the <a href="/attractions/glacier-canyon-grindelwald/?id=act_d2f762b7-6606-458b-811c-6a9611d9b21b" class="lnks" target="_blank">Glacier Canyon</a>, an amazing natural attraction carved by nature over centuries. Inside the gorge, there is an elevated walkway that allows you to take a sensory walk through its exposed rock galleries and tunnels. If you have the nerves to take a wobbly walk (or crawl), you can try to cross a spider web stretched 170m2 across the gorge and 7 metres over the flowing Lutschine River.<br />
                                            The big thrill here however, is the Canyon Swing. The swing platform sits on the edge of the canyon wall 90 metres above the glacier melt below.  Once you have passed the safety briefing and crossed the safety barrier, it's time to take the leap of faith, step off and swing at 120 km/h between the canyon walls. The few seconds of this swing may just be the most exhilarating ones of your life.
                                        </p>
                                        <%--<div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Grandcanyon</p>
                                                <a href="" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>--%>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="7">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Five Lakes Hike</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            Whilst many may not see this as an adventurous or tough hiking trail, it is definitely one of the most popular activities in the area. The hike takes you to 5 different lakes, each one unique in its own way. You start by taking the mountain train to Sunnegga and then the gondola to Blauherd (the tickets are part of the <a href="/blog/top-discounts-on-swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">Top discounts on the Swiss Travel Pass</a>). From here, you simply follow the well-marked ‘5 Seenweg’ trail. The entire hike takes between 2.30 to 3 hours. If you are lucky, you will see the monumental Matterhorn massif all along the way and also as a reflection in the lakes (which makes for some really memorable photos). Witnessing the changing hues of the water as you pass by the five lakes (Stellisee, Grindjisee, Grunsee, Mossjisee, Leisee) is a visual treat.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="8">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Skiing</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            Zermatt is arguably the best all-round Ski resort in the Alps with over 200 kms of pistes. Its three main mountains offer enough and more for every level of skier. To ski with the best views of the Matterhorn, one can head to the Sunnegga-Rothorn area. For intermediate skiers, the Gornergrat sector offers long cruising runs with fantastic views. For more advanced skiers seeking a real adrenaline rush, the Kleine Matterhorn area, with its numerous options, is the place to test their skills. This area is also the highest and largest summer ski area in Europe, offering almost 21 km of slopes.  Zermatt’s varied terrain and snow conditions also make it the ideal spot for those wishing to explore off-piste options.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="9">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Snowshoe Hike</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            If you are not a ski fan but still want a snow activity, a snowshoe hike is the perfect fit. The route between Trockener Steg and Schwarzsee on the trail of the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise is a popular area for this hike. There are other trails along the Sunnegga-Rothorn area too. Keep in mind that you will need to travel to the start point of these trails by cable car, for which you will receive discounts if you hold a <a href="/swiss-travel-pass" class="lnks" target="_blank">Swiss Travel Pass</a>.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="10">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Heliski</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            For the avid adventure seeker wanting to take the skiing experience one notch further, there is heliskiing. The heliski operators either fly you to one of the mountain landing sites or to one of the off-piste spots from where you drop on fresh powder snow to descend through the most beautiful alpine landscapes with a mountain guide. Popular on-piste landing points are Monte Rosa landing area (4200 metres) and the Aeschihorn landing area (3600 metres).
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="11">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Sledging</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            One of the most fun activities to do with the family is sledging (also called Luge in Zermatt). You can do it solo or even with kids riding along with an adult. The most popular run in the Zermatt area is the Rotenboden toboggan run, which is the highest run in the Alps, starting at 2815 metres. There are also husky dog sledge rides where a pack of well-trained and super-friendly huskies pulls the sledge. You can do this near Trockener Steg on the way to Matterhorn Glacier Paradise. Yet another form is using a snooc, which is a seat fixed atop a short ski.  There are runs with varying degrees of difficulty and speed but rest assured, every one of them is a treat.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="12">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Bobsledding</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            St Moritz is home to the Olympia Bob Run, the world's oldest and natural bobsleigh track. The 1722-metre track with some really challenging curves has been in operation since 1904 and hosted events for two Winter Olympics and numerous other European and international competitions. Unlike all other bobsleigh tracks, which are artificially iced, this one is the last remaining naturally iced track in the world.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="13">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Hiking</h2>
                                        <p>
                                            With the pristine lake St Moritz and the lush forests and Alpine peaks surrounding it, there are plenty of scenic hiking trails around St Moritz. Leisure walkers can walk around the lake and explore the area and town. The more serious hikers can head to popular trails like the Muottas Muragl to Alp Languard trail (6.3 km, roughly 2 hours), the Corvatsch Panorama Trail (6 km, roughly 2 hours), and the Morteratsch Glacier Walk, which is perfect for families since it is an easy 6 km round trip on a wide dirt path.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            In the summer months the lake's calm waters also offer the chance of watersports like stand-up paddleboarding, canoeing and kayaking.
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="14">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Mount Titlis</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Mount-Titlis-medium1.webp" alt="Mount Titlis" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Located in Engelberg, 45 minutes from Lucerne, <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="lnks" target="_blank">Mount Titlis</a> has something for all kinds of adventure seekers. Start the fun with a ride in the Rotair (the world’s first revolving aerial cableway) that takes you to the summit. A huge attraction on the peak at 3041 metres, is  Europe’s highest suspension bridge. Gather the courage to walk on it and peer down into the icy depth below and you will be rewarded with breathtaking views. Take a ride on the Ice Flyer Chair Lift and visit Glacier Park, where you can try the snake gliss, minibob or glide down on a snow tube.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Along the ascent or descent, at the midway station of Trubsee, the Adventure Park offers a plethora of activities. Try your skills at the Bagjump or the zipline. Get more adventurous at the SnowXpark with various kinds of electric vehicles like the moonbike, bobsled and the e-snowmibile. End the day with a glass of mulled wine on the balcony of your hotel or <a href="/apartments" class="lnks" target="_blank">apartment in Lucerne</a>.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Blog/titlis-rotair.jpg?ver=1" alt="">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mt Titlis</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="15">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Mount Pilatus</h2>
                                        <div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/Pilatus1.webp" alt="Mount Titlis" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                        <p>
                                            Known as the Dragon Mountain, this mountain is replete with legends. However, today, it is better known for the amazing Golden Round Trip, which involves an exciting journey to and from it. The Golden Round Trip (possible in summer) takes you via cable car, steamer and the world’s steepest cogwheel railway with a maximum gradient of 48%!
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            The rope park at the midway point of Frakmuntegg offers 10 courses and exciting ziplines catering to all levels. Not to leave the kids out of the fun, there is also the Pilu Rope Park, which caters primarily to kids aged 4 to 8. The toboggan run, with its steep curves and jumps, is the longest summer run, stretching 1350 metres.
                                        </p>
                                        <div class="bdm-bookCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-left">
                                                <img src="/images/Mountains/Mount-Pilatus-medium2.webp" alt="Mount Pilatus">
                                            </div>
                                            <div class="bdm-bookCard-right">
                                                <p class="bookButton">Mount Pilatus</p>
                                                <a href="/mountain-excursion/6-mount-pilatus" class="bordered-btn gray" target="_blank">Book Now</a>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    </li>
                                    <li data-index="16">
                                        <h2 class="bdm-title">Aquatic activities on Lake Lucerne</h2>
                                        <%--<div class="bdm-placeCard">
                                            <div class="bdm-placeCard-image">
                                                <img src="/images/photogallery/Pilatus1.webp" alt="Mount Titlis" />
                                            </div>
                                        </div>--%>
                                        <p>
                                            As the centrepiece of the town, the shimmering Lake Lucerne offers various aquatic activities. For the leisure seeker, there are ferry cruises, yacht cruises and more. However, for those seeking something a little more active, there is kayaking, stand-up paddleboarding and canoeing. There are guided services or rentals that allow you to do things at your own pace.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            Of course, with Switzerland’s endless natural beauty and landscape of forests, mountains, and lakes, there are many other places and activities to enjoy. Listing them all here would be almost impossible.
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            For now, I hope this guide has excited you enough to plan your next ‘adventure’ to Switzerland. Wait no more-choose the next slope to ski down, the next forest trail to traverse and the next mountain to soar over. Once that is done, just grab the gear and get going!
                                        </p>
                                    </li>
